title: Newly Demolished Home Site
comments: A home was recently demolished here, and is now a clean vacant lot. Municipal utilities and natural gas are available here! Paved city streets. Build your new home here !

title: Handyman Special In Manistique
comments: This one has been "let go" for a while and will need a commitment to return to productive use. It has hardboard siding which is delaminating, especially near the foundation. Older doors and windows that need upgrading. Has an old stone foundation that has been veneered with a thin coat concrete which is beginning to "go south" as well. Inside, the roof here has been leaking for eons, and it has caused a lot of damage to floors and structural members. The front porch is rotten to the core, and the rest is not far behind. This will take some courage and hard work. Bad roof needs immediate replacement.

title: Vacant Lot On Michigan Avenue, Manistique
comments: home has recently been removed from this location, and it is being sold as a vacant lot. City utility and natural gas. Build your new home here !

title: Vacant, 49X132 Parcel In Manistique
comments: This is a vacant 49x132 parcel "on the curve" at South Fifth and Spruce (Elk) Streets in Manistique. Northeast corner of the intersection.

title: The Hotel Barnes. Manistique
comments: This is a historic, 20+ room hotel property in downtown Manistique, that in recent years was used only as a bar and quasi-boarding house. This could become an exciting boutique hotel project for someone with deep pockets looking for a calling in a small town ... or it could become a money pit for an unwary buyer. Structurally, this building seems very sound and square to us. It has a bad roof over the rear 20 feet or so of the building, but much of the rest of it is in decent repair structurally and it appears that the roof has been maintained in the entire forward section until recently. The buyer of this property needs to quickly repair the roof, manage the collection of gutter and downspout discharge, and repair the rear wall. There is a washout happening on the rear facade, which requires the immediate attention of a brick mason, or this one will be beyond feasible economic repair in another 2-3 years. Mechanically, this building has a fairly new boiler and newer looking electric service and and hot water heater, but the rest of it is a start-over. What mechanicals remain have either been stripped/harvested for scrap or are antiquated and nowhere near function (or code) anymore. The last guy that bought this at our sale disregarded our comments about its condition, and now we have it back again. If you're looking at this one, please understand that it needs a lot of elbow grease, soon. This is not a "flip" for a passive investor at all. The potential here is endless, but it will require the same from you in commitment. Three floors. Lobby, restaurant/tavern room. Kitchen. One or more buildings on this parcel has a roof which is either leaking to the interior or appears close to failure. Failing roofs often indicate substantial structural decay inside the building. You should investigate the integrity of this structure(s) prior to bidding.

title: Mini-Resort At Ash Point Near Indian Lake.
comments: Located 1/2 mile north of the Indian Lake State Park. There are 3 buildings on the property, including a shop/store use (has plumbing), a residence and what was probably a mini-motel type building to the rear. The lot shape is irregular, fronting on roads on the north, west and south sides ... and you can surmise the approximate east line visually. This parcel is about 1000 feet from large, popular Indian Lake. The main house has some knotty pine and 2+ bedrooms and a bath. It has some 90s-ish remodeling done to to it. Full unfinished basement. Newer architectural shingle on the main building that does not appear to leak. The building to the east was at one time a 4 unit efficiency motel, now 2 remain and the other half has been converted to storage use. Could be a great place for the kids or as "extra bedrooms". This would make an excellent family retreat or seasonal business location !

title: Small Acreage Near Lake Michigan At Manistique
comments: This is the rewmainder parcel to a tract that was divided for lakeview homesites. For lack of a better description, it is the extended back yards of water view homes along Glenwood Drive ... that extend all the way to US 2. This parcel is irregular in shape, fronting 334' along US 2 south of the old railroad grade, and also fronting 66' on Glenwood Drive. If this one interests you, you'll want to check with the township or county for a good map ... as the boundaries are irregular. Gently rolling, mostly wooded ... nice land ! This could potentially be a great private home location very near town and Lake Michigan !

title: Upgraded Older Cabin And 10.3 Acres On Davidson Road Near Cooks!
comments: From the appearance of the roof line(s), this appears to be an old cabin that has had a storage building added to the west side. Editors note: There are a couple healthy colonies of wasps here ... one in the garage door, and another in the eaves to the east (left) side). There are several outbuildings on the property, some are probably worthy of a repair, but others are a winter or two away from being flat. The interior of the house is spartan ... and we believe this was probably more of a camp than a year-round home in the recent past. The last evidence we can find of occupancy dates from 2012. There is a fair amount of debris to empty out, but the "bones" of the house appear to be worthy of rehabbing. The roof is not too ancient and we did nott see any ecidence of leaks inside. Home has a small crawlspace type cellar. Floors are solid. The garage/storage unit is primitive, but it works. Woodburner in the garage.

title: 40 Acre Deer Camp North Of Manistique!
comments: You get to this one off M-94, exiting east onto Haywire Road, and then coming south about a mile. The road is likely an old railroad grade ... straight and narrow. Cabin sits beack in about 600 feet off the grade road on a shared driveway. There is no power, water or septic here ... but it does have a "bath with a path" nearby. The interior actually is of quality finish ... some knotty pine ... a couple of bedrooms and living room upstairs. Downstairs is garage and shop space. There is some debris here to reckon with outsdoors ... mostly "man junk" .. various pieces and parts of machines and vehicles which we do not have titles to. There is still personal property here that remains titled in the former owner. A neighbor is watching this one .. so please do not enter it ... we have it posted for a reason. The property here is oddly set up ... and is 40 acres in total. It's basically a "square 40" (1320x1320) except that the SE 10 acres is shifted 660 feet to the south. Topographically, the SE 10 acre parcel is marshlands, and the other 30 acres are mapped as uplands by the USGS for the most part. There are many other seasonal use places in this area and a signifigant amount of state and federal land as well. East of here there are thousands of acres of sloughs and Manistique River State Forests marshlands. I think this is where Bigfoot lives. So if you're looking for him (or her ?), this would be as good a place as any. Seasonal roads. No power. No cable TV. Cellular service though ... This parcel is accessible by a road that is believed to be a seasonal or non-maintained public road. While we make no representations or warranties as to the precise nature of such road access, our research suggests that this road is either 1) Not regularly graded; and/or 2) Not snow plowed in winters; and/or 3) Appears subject to fallen trees or other events which have not been addressed by the county road commission. You should conduct your own research into this issue prior to bidding. Our visual inspection indicated that electrical service was not available on or near this parcel. The nearest electric service appeared to be a considerable distance (hundreds or perhaps thousands of feet) from the property. As such, electrifying this parcel could be costly. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding.

title: Dozer Bait Shack In Germfask
comments: The value here is in the property. This is an old frame structure that has had a couple of additions tacked on, and some of those are now fully collapsed. This one has been sitting, without much maintenance, for a long time. Facia boards, siding near the ground and soffits have visible rot and decay. Inside, floors have fallen into the crawlspace in a couple of areas, and while the roof might be good, whats under it is suffering from a combination of construction issues and decay. The parcel here fronts about 100 feet on the road and runs 300 feet to the east. 3/4 of an acre. We assume there is a well here, but could not find it. It may be in a collapsed area of the building. This parcel includes a structure which should be considered DANGEROUS. This building has suffered structural damage which creates substantial risk of harm from falling through damaged areas or collapse from above. It may also contain extensive debris which could fall or collapse, rusty nails, broken glass, and other hazards. You are not permitted to enter this or any other structure offered at tax sale. You should limit your inspection only to what can be safely observed from the building's exterior. Trespassers are subject to prosecution.

title: 2+ Acres In Germfask!
comments: Parcel is irregular in shape, but is a little over 2 acres in size. Fronts about 140 feet on Pine Street, and runs 500 feet deep along the south line. Wraps around behind the Propane dealership with a "dogleg" to the north.

title: 290X300 Parcel On Jackson Road. 2 Acres. Doyle Township.
comments: Parcel fronts 300 feet along the west side of Jackson Road (CR 432), and runs 290 feet deep. Lands here are level and wooded. Sits below the road grade about 3 feet. We found a culvert and a rough cut drive into the property here, but it is older and needs improvement.

title: 40 Acre Lot!
comments: 40 acres

title: 40 Acre Lot!
comments: 40 acres

title: Bundle Of Parcels - Buy All Or None.
comments: This group of parcels has been "bundled". In order to buy any of the parcels in this group, you must buy ALL of them. ATTENTION: NO ONLINE BIDDING FOR THIS PARCEL. It is a requirement of of this sale that a purchaser must demolish, remediate,rehabilitate or repurpose this property as follows: 1) ALL STRUCTURES must be secured and made un-enterable within 15 days of sale at auction, at the purchasers sole expense, or the sale shall be cancelled and no refund or deed issued. 2) Any visible refuse, garbage, trash or other cast off shall be removed from lands within 15 days of the sale at auction, at the purchasers sole expense, or the sale shall be cancelled and no refund or deed issued.. 3) The conditions required in (1) and (2) above shall be maintained against further entry or blight for a period of 12 months following the execution of a deed. 4) Those properties that are beyond reasonable repair or economic vitality to repair must be demolished at the sole expense of the purchaser. The cost of such work shall be at the sole expense of the original purchaser and shall not be assigned, delegated or otherwise transferred to third parties through sale or conveyance until complete. All such demolition must be performed within 6 months of deeding, by a licensed, insured demolition contractor acceptable to the code official of the local unit of government where the property is located. All proper permits for demolition and the removal and disposal of volatile debris (asbestos, contaminants etc) must be obtained. 5) Those properties which appear to either the purchaser, FGU or the code enforcement official of the local unit of government to be potentially contaminated, shall be the subject of a Baseline Environmental Assessment (BEA) at the sole expense of the purchaser. The cost of such BEA(s) shall be at the sole expense of the original purchaser and shall not be assigned, delegated or otherwise transferred to third parties through sale or conveyance until complete. The BEA(s) shall be conducted by an insured environmental consultant licensed in the State of Michigan within 45 days of purchase, and shall be fully complete and filed with the proper authorities within 90 days of purchase. The level of the BEA to be conducted shall be determined by the findings of the initial phase(s) of the BEA at each parcel subject to such study. Where contamination is evident, the purchaser shall indemnify the FGU with a separate performance bond (issued on the same terms as others herein required) in an amount equal to the full cost of remediation of the contamination at each such site, and for a period of twenty (20) years, unless remediation is undertaken and completed during that time period. If the site is remediated to a level satisfactory to state officials charged with such determinations, the requirement for a performance bond shall be removed for that site. 6) Those properties which can be rehabilitated or repurposed shall be brought into compliance with all construction, occupancy, zoning and other use codes of the local unit of government within 12 months. Construction and/or mechanical permits must be obtained prior to performing such work. Occupancy permits must be obtained by the expiration of that term. All construction and rehabilitation work at these properties shall be carried out by contractors that are licensed and insured, and acceptable to the code enforcement officer of the local unit of government. The cost of such work shall be at the sole expense of the original purchaser and shall not be assigned, delegated or otherwise transferred to third parties through sale or conveyance until complete. In pursuance of those requirements and their costs and timelines, the FGU is requiring the posting of a performance bond in the amount of $150,000. The performance bond shall be made out in favor of the Office of the Marquette County Treasurer (acting as the Foreclosing Governmental Unit). Evidence of the issuance and full payment for such bond shall be presented to the FGU within fifteen (15) days of the acceptance of the purchasers bid at auction. In the event evidence of issuance and full payment is not tendered within fifteen (15) days of sale, the sale shall be cancelled outright, and the purchaser considered non-responsive to a necessary condition of the sale. Such bond shall be issued by an underwriter licensed to do business in the State of Michigan, who is not the subject of any pending disciplinary action by the State of Michigan or any department, bureau or commission thereof. It shall be payable, in full amount, to the FGU in the event of either whole or partial non-performance of the terms above written for its entire duration. It shall run as effective and be fully pre-paid, for the entire term of twenty-four (24) months. Any overage or refund shall be payable to the purchaser upon earlier termination of the bond because of full performance hereunder. This 24 month time period is not applicable to those performance bonds required for contaminated parcels noted in (5) above. The original of such bond(s) shall be held by an escrow agent satisfactory to the FGU, fully prepaid, at the expense of the purchaser. In the event any purchaser is a corporate or other entity, the principals of such entity must also execute full-recourse personal guarantees that assure payment of the amount(s) due under performance bonds in the event they are not honored for any reason. Compliance with the terms of the requirements hereof shall be at the sole discretion of the FGU. Please contact the auction house or Marquette County Treasurers office for additional detail. The structure(s) on this parcel have been slated for demolition by the local unit of government prior to sale. As such, it is being presented here as a vacant lot. You should confirm the status of this parcel as well as the allocation of the cost of demolition prior to bidding.

title: Five Adjoining Lots On M-28 In Ishpeming!
comments: This sale includes five platted lots in Ishpeming. Combined, the parcel fronts about 200 feet on Greenwood Street (M-28), and about 400 feet on Washington Street in Ishpeming. City water and sewer, and natural gas are available here. Lots sit slightly below road grade and are brushy with some younger growth softwoods. Corner parcel on two paved roads with municipal utilities ! Sale combined with 4024. See that parcel for details Sale combined with 4024. See that parcel for details Sale combined with 4024. See that parcel for details. Sale combined with 4024. See that parcel for details

title: 1/2 Acre Of Vacant Land On Cr 444 (Diffin Road)
comments: This parcel sits due west of a camper at 4237 CR-444. The camper is NOT on the property, and not part of the sale. The parcel fronts 104 feet +/- on the road, and the lot runs 208 feet deep. Level, wooded, dry lands here. There is power at the county maintained gravel road. Nice campspot.

title: 40 Acres Of Recreational Property At New Dalton Location.
comments: Never heard of New Dalton, you say ? That's probably because it's tough to get there. This is a square 40, 1320x1320 more or less, that is on a pretty overgrown road about 10 miles southeast of Marquette near Skandia. Anderson Road is the street address, but it's somewhat impassable from both north and south. If you're coming north off Dalton Road, the road abruptly ends into what looks like a real good place to get stuck up to your axle in mook. And as much fun as that sounded to us, we decided to try the south approach. Anderson Road from Yalmar Road is actually paved for a bit, then turns gravel and then ends into an overgrown path about 1400 feet short of the north boundary of the land ... which lies east of the road. It would seem unlikely that this land has been timbered recently based on the growth on the roads here, unless they came in from a different way. Topographical maps tell us that the SW 1/2 of this parcel is marshland. Deer camp ! The roads which are shown on plat or tax maps for this parcel do not appear to exist or may be located in a different location than shown on such maps. While a legal right to build such roads may remain, this construction would likely be very expensive. However, in some instances these unimproved roads have been vacated or abandoned by action of the local government and no such right to construct the roads remains. Issues surrounding unimproved roads can be complicated and expensive to resolve. You should investigate the existence of any roads and the ability to access this parcel thoroughly before bidding.

title: 1.74 Acres Near Negaunee! Hillside Building Spot.
comments: Parcel is irregular in shape. Sits atop a hillside perch that we believe the driveway that is cut into this area probably rises to. The teerrain here is steep and rolling. We located a power service that we believe is ON this property at the top of the driveway, and you may want to verify that with the utility. The road is not county maintained ... in fact it's not even showing up on our GPS unit ... so we'll call it a private shared road. This is a very scenic and quiet location, and would make a wonderful retreat or cabin spot at the top of a hill, nestled into the trees.

title: Ravine Parcel With Many Possibilities In Marquette!
comments: This parcel is FOUR adjacent vacant lots in the Trowbridge Park plat, on Marquettes west side. If you come in from the north, the parcel is at the end of East Avenue, and then down at the bottom-right of a steep embankment. You can also approach the lots from Norwood Street on the west side .. same situation. This parcel is essentially a deep ravine with a creek that is a tributary to the Dead River flowing through it. This is a very scenic parcel, but it will take a creative mind (and some engineering) to put it to use. There is probably potential to build a home across the creek with a glass floor. You just need to win the lotto. It would also be a great place for a secret hideout ! Overall size is 240' (east-west) x 136' (north-south). This parcel appears to have challenging terrain. Challenging terrain can include steep hillsides, ravines, gullies, or similar topographical features as well as little to no buildable area. Such parcels often have no practical use. You should investigate this parcel's terrain and suitability for your desired purpose prior to bidding.

title: Last Lot On The Left ... On Shady Lane. Little Lake Area.
comments: This is a sparsely wooded lot at the end of a quiet cul-de-sac in Little Lake near Swanzy, Sawyer and Gwinn. Roughly 100x100 in size.

title: 1/2 Acre Recreational Parcel On Bilsky Lake Near Gwinn
comments: This parcel is over 1/2 acre in size and fronts on Bilsky Lake. The practical issue with this one is that all of its road frontage sits well below grade, and is behind a guardrail .... so we're not too sure how you'd actually get into it with a vehicle ... unless you obtain an easement from the neighbor to the north or south. The drop from road grade is substantial, perhaps 20 or more feet. And the lands at the lake grade appear to have some wetland and ravine indicators. It's not likely to be a spot you can build, but it could have campspot potential with a little imagination ! This parcel appears to have challenging terrain. Challenging terrain can include steep hillsides, ravines, gullies, or similar topographical features as well as little to no buildable area. Such parcels often have no practical use. You should investigate this parcel's terrain and suitability for your desired purpose prior to bidding.

title: Escanaba Riverfrontage With An A-Frame Cabin Near Rock!
comments: Parcel fronts 100' on the east side of the Escanaba River, and runs roughly 200' deep to Choo Choo Lane. The riverfrontage here is simply stunning, and if you're looking for fishing and scenic life up north, THIS IS IT. The riverfrontage here is about 10 feet above the river, which is swift moving and we have to imagine GREAT trout fishing, right off your front deck. The yard is nicely wooded in mid-life evergreens and softwoods. The A-frame is vinyl sided for low maintenance. We thing the roof could probably use a refresh ... it's not leaking now, but it looks like it may have a few shingles that could become issues. Space heat, indoor plumbing plus a "bath with a path". There is a monument to a deceased former owner near the rivers edge that we request you do not disturb out of respect. Someone will be coming to pick it up, so please do not tinker with it. We did notice the floors in the side addition here seem uneven under the carpet. but they didn't seem to be weak. There is comfortable sleeping here for 4 (2 pair) between the main floor bedroom and the loft above. We'd guess this has been winterized, but we can't be certain or guarantee that. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

title: A Great 40 Acre Parcel With Frontage On O'neil Creek Near Skandia
comments: This is a square 40, 1320x1320, that is at the end of JH Lane off US 41. Could be a great rustic homesite or vacation getaway. The road runs parallel with the west boundary of the parcel for about the last 300 feet, and then veers left onto a somewhat mucky trail that runs along the north line of the parcel. We found a recent power service here as well as a hand driven shallow well with pump. There is a culvert when you pull into the property that we'd recommend not crossing with a regular auto, lest you get stuck. The property is well wooded and does not show signs of recent harvest. We survey a fair amount of maple here, as well as poplar and other softwoods. The property rolls gradually downhill to the west, where the border of the property fronts along O'Neil Creek pretty much along its entire west boundary. The topo maps do not indicate there being wetlands here, but it's probably got some wetlands indicators into the west half as the elevation drops toward the creek. There is a good amount of "man junk" here that you'll need to dispose of. Much of it will probably burn, but there is also a pretty good pile of scrap metal and tires here also. We didn't see anything that points to potential contamination, but its clear that the past use of the property has including some random dumping, so you should take a real good look around if you're interested in this one. It has a street address, well and power ... so it has probably been used at least as a camp, and there may have been (or could still be) something more than just the campers here that have been used for occupancy. This is a private road, not maintained by the county, and you may have trouble getting back here in a non 4WD vehicle in the winter. There are year rounders on the road a couple thousand feet toward civilization .... so you'll need your own snowplow ...

title: 1.5 Acre Swamplot In Dalliba
comments: A dozen 50x100 lots in the platted villlage of Dalliba, which is now just a memory. These are ankle deep in water in the spring (maybe all year) and you'd need consultation with the district health department if you're thinking about building here for septic concerns. The total dimension of the combined lots is 300x220.

title: Occupied Home On The North Side Of Escanaba
comments: This one was OCCUPIED at the time of our visit in early June, so we did not have the opportunity to view it in detail. It's a 1.5 story frame home with a mid-life roof and aluminum siding that appears to be in overall merchantable condition. Has a small exterior storage shed in deteriorating condition that could be restored or removed at your option. This one appears solid and straight from a cursory view. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. Buildings which are dangerous, occupied, boarded, condemned, or otherwise difficult to enter are inspected from the exterior/curbside only. You are NOT authorized to enter these or any other buildings offered for sale. You should limit your inspection to that which can be made safely from the building's exterior. This property is occupied. Please respect the privacy of current occupants and limit any inspection to what can be safely observed from the road. Some occupants may be upset or angry and may meet contact with aggression or violence. Please use discretion and caution when researching this or other occupied properties. Furthermore, although this property has been foreclosed for unpaid taxes, occupants have certain rights under Michigan law and must be formally evicted if unwilling to leave voluntarily. You may wish to consult a licensed attorney for more information.

title: Modern Mid-Century Home In Escanaba.
comments: This is a spiffy little bungalow with attached one car garage in Escanaba. The house appears to be in generally good repair, but she's loaded with smelly castoffs including raw food garbage. You'll need a strong stomach here, but this one is well worth cleaning out. Great little house in a well kept neighborhood. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. Buildings which are dangerous, occupied, boarded, condemned, or otherwise difficult to enter are inspected from the exterior/curbside only. You are NOT authorized to enter these or any other buildings offered for sale. You should limit your inspection to that which can be made safely from the building's exterior.

title: Boarded House And A Spare On The North Side Of Escanaba.
comments: **NOTE: This property is subject to a voluntary demolition order. The purchaser will be required to demolish the structure at its own cost within 6 months of the sale. Prior to deed delivery, the purchaser will be required to furnish a personal guarantee and performance bond in the amount of $25,000 to assure this demolition. Please contact the Treasurers office or auction house for complete details.** There are two units on this lot. The larger, front one has been boarded up to keep all the goodness inside. Or maybe to keep the pigeons out. Either way, we did not view the interior and she is closed up tight ... probably by local authorities. We assume this has been condemned by the city building offficial, and that reuse would require it be brought to current building code, which could be a formidable task. The structure is a "Biltmore", and has several additions to the rear and side, some of which are leaning and weaving suggesting foundation issues. To the rear is a one story "mother in law" unit that is actually in pretty decent overall condition, but could still use some cosmetic updating to the exterior. Inside it has knotty pine, and has an updated (90's-ish) bath and kitchen. Newer forced air natural gas heat. Roof is not new, but does not appear to be a leaker. This is a two-for-one deal, but you have to demolish both of them. This parcel has been posted as "Condemned" by the local building authority. Properties are generally condemned when they are deemed substandard, unsafe, or otherwise unfit for use and habitation. Condemned property must be rehabilitated to meet local building codes prior to use or occupancy. A building is not automatically slated for demolition when condemned. However, this does not necessarily mean that demolition will not also be pursued by the local unit. Please check with the local building official before bidding to determine the specific status and requirements for this property.

title: 100 X 230 Foot Parcel In Wells Township.
comments: This one is to the end and east of Parkwood L-75 Drive in Wells Township. Wooded mostly in middle aged maple and pine. This may not have any improved road frontage depending on the exact boundaries. Probably of the most value to an adjacent property owner ... although it would be of buildable size if it has legal access. We'd suggest checking for easement rights prior to bidding if you do not own adjacent property. Level, dry lands. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: Older Mobile On A 2/3 Acre Lot In The Soo Hill Area.
comments: Parcel is 88' wide x roughly 330' deep to the north = .67 acre. This is an older mobile that has been wrapped in vinyl siding and roofed over. The roof is architectural shingle, but has a very low pitch. We notice that the ends of the roof are a bit "pagoda" ... which causes us to wonder if that was intentional, accidental, or if the center of the roof has settled. There is an addition to the front, and a wolmanized lumber front deck that is in good shape. This home appears merchantable, but has a lot of personal property, that is not included in the sale. New water heater, but otherwise original mechanicals, kitchen and bath. We did not see any roof leaks. Deep rear yard with a couple of storage sheds in functional condition. This one could probably be made into your new place without a ton of work depending on winterization. Inoperable car in the yard that we do not have title to. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

title: 7 Acres With A Home On Us 2 Near St Jacques
comments: Parcel fronts 440' along the south side of US 2 and just east of St Jacques. Measures 440' x 660 more or less. There is a home here, overgrown by the landscape, that certainly has the potential to be restored. It has RB&B plywood siding and a roof which is older but appears to still be in merchantable condition. We suspect that this is a modular. 3 Bedrooms and one bath plus an attached one car garage. As far as we can tell, it's on a crawlspace and not a basement. It's got a 70's sort of vibe going on, and appears to have been vacant for years. However it it is in good overall condition, and it doesn't appear that any critters except maybe mice have been touring the inside. We think there is natural gas at the road here, but no signs of a meter, unless it's buried in the brush. This one has real potential.

title: 275' Of Frontage On The Rapid River!
comments: This parcel is a narrow strip of land with 275' of riverfrontage on a real nice stretch of the Rapid River, about a mile off US 41 on a maintained gravel county road. There is an old frame structure and a shed here, but they're dozer bait and beyond any economic value to repair. You have to look real carefully for them or you'll drive right by. The depth of the property varies from perhaps 100 feet to just a few feet west of the County Road. The lands here at the homesite seem to be built up and would probably support a septic, but we'd check with the district health department if that's your intention for the property.

title: Five Acres. No Road Access. Maple Ridge Township
comments: This is a five acre parcel, 330' (north-south) x 660' (east-west) in dimension, that has no frontage on any improved public road. It is unclear if there are any easements to the property. We did not find any two tracks to it. USGS maps indicate that it is level, wooded land and free of substantial amounts of marshland. But because we could not get to it ... that is "according to the USGS". The nearest improved road is Plantation D Lane ... about 1/2 mile away. There is no power anywhere near this one ... Our visual inspection indicated that electrical service was not available on or near this parcel. The nearest electric service appeared to be a considerable distance (hundreds or perhaps thousands of feet) from the property. As such, electrifying this parcel could be costly. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: Former Gas Station Location On Us 2 At Isabella
comments: There was a bar/store/gas station combo here in the early days of US 2, known as the "Penguin Bar" and what remains of it still resides here. The DEQ is doing some remediation work at the property, assessing it for impacts from the underground tanks that used to store gasoline here. You will want to check the Michigan Environmental mapper (see link) for the latest information on this study. It still contains TWO UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS which a new owner will assume responsibility for the removal of. It is "Facility" number 39866 as registered with DEQ. Please carefully understand the obligations here before bidding on this. This parcel may contain buried storage tanks from previous use as a gas station or similar enterprise. Our analysis is based solely on visual inspection of the property surface as further detailed in the lot description. The State of Michigan may require a new owner to remove any remaining tanks and remediate environmental concerns at their sole expense. Additional information may be available from the MDEQ Storage Tank Database. You should conduct careful and thorough research prior to bidding on this parcel.

title: Commercial Property Used For Residence. Bark River
comments: This is an older frame construction building that is located in "downtown" Bark River, just off US-2. The front face has been vinyl sided over the old plate glass storefront facade. The other 3 sides are pretty much left untouched since their last, mid-century upgrade with asphalt shingle siding. There is a steel roof on the two story portion of the building. Inside, the main floor is spartan and plain. We noticed springy floors in the center of the main floor. It appears that it may have been used as a restaurant, although the sign out front says "Video & Tanning". The second floor is actually most of the way through a remodel, and much of the material to finish it is onsite. There is standing water ... probably a couple of feet worth ... in the basement (No power = no sump pump) that will need to be removed. The elcectric service here is substantial, 200 amp, but it's all discombobulated and will need a review by qualified personnel. We suspect that the plan here was probably to convert the entire building to residential. The building on this property appears to have been used for multi-family occupancy in the past based upon indicators such as multiple mailboxes, entrances, numbering, layout, or other such factors. Modifications to the property may NOT have been legally made and may NOT conform to local zoning. Prospective bidders should verify with local officials that multi-family use is permitted under existing zoning. In many areas, once a multi-family use has been discontinued, it cannot be reinstated unless in conformance with local zoning and code. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed.

title: House In Eben Junction With Structural Issues!
comments: This is an estate property held by a family trust from California that decided to let it go. It looks decent from the outside, with some newer windows, modern furnace, an upgraded architectural style shingle roof and vinyl siding, but inside we found some serious issues. The floor in the living room is very springy, and has some pretty serious dips and bowing going on. One spot caved in and is now covered with a board to prevent someone from falling through. This also has transmitted itself to other areas of the house including a second floor door that will not open because the jamb is out of square. Someone will probably need to lift this entire house up and put a new support system underneath it in order to make it merchantable. it would never pass an inspection in its current condition. This parcel has substantial structural issues caused by poor design, insufficient maintenance, or both. Such buildings may be subject to condemnation orders which we were unable to locate during our inspection. All such buildings should be brought into compliance with local building regulations prior to use. We strongly recommend that you contact the local building code official and consider consulting a competent structural engineer to assess the condition of this property before to bidding.

title: Vacant Corner Parcel, One Acre, North Of Shingleton On H-15
comments: The structure that was on this parcel has recently been removed. This is a vacant lot and does *not* include the outbuildings and collecction to the rear, which is on a different parcel. This lot runs 264 feet along H-15 and 165' down Percy Road to the west. Our review of this parcel indicates that the noted State Equalized Value (SEV) does not appear to reflect the current value of the property. This is often due to buildings or other improvements being demolished or fire damaged or other similar items included in the SEV being removed from the property. It can also be due to market changes in the area in which the property is located. It should be further noted that the SEV/assessed value of the parcel as noted in this listing may be several years old. You should consult a local real estate professional or appraiser to help you assess the current market value of this property before bidding and should not base your valuation on the stated SEV.

title: 132' X 330'. One Acre. Alger-Delta 43Rd Road
comments: Parcel sits a couple of feet below road grade. Topo maps indicate that these lands are marshland, and visual observation would support this. It fronts 330' along the north side of the road, and runs 132' deep. Wooded .

title: Triangular Parcel Lying Northeast Of Us 41
comments: This parcel is triangular in shape, and has roughly 1100 feet on the northeast side of US 41, about a mile north of Diffin. It is about 475 feet deep at its center, and tapers to nothing at the two ends. The side lines run north-south, and east-west, and the road frontage runs at a 45 degree angle. The lands here are marshlands according to the USGS topographical survey.

title: Triangular Parcel Lying Southwest Of Us 41 Near Diffin.
comments: This parcel is triangular in shape, and has roughly 1000 feet on the southwest side of US 41, about a mile north of Diffin. It is about 535 feet deep at its center, and tapers to nothing at the two ends. The side lines run north-south, and east-west, and the road frontage runs at a 45 degree angle. The lands here are marshlands according to the USGS topographical survey.

title: Nice Building Site In Scenic Grand Marais!
comments: This parcel is about 2 miles southeast of the village of Grand Marais in a platted subdivision of fairly modern vintage based on the age of the homes in it. It's about a mile ffrom here to the Lake Superior shoreline. Sate and Federal lands abound here, and there are many outdoor and recreational opportunities in the area. Once of Michigans most scenic spots ! The lot is 100' on the south side of Valentine Drive and runs 200' deep. Nicely wooded, level and dry lands. A great place for your vacation retreat or retirement summer house.Well wooded in mid-aged softwoods.

title: 3/4 Of An Acre On M-28 Near Autrain.
comments: Parcel fronts 147 feet on the north side of M-28. It is irregular in shape, but certainly large enough to build on. It sits below road grade, but appears to be dry and buildable. We'd check with the district health department for a perc test if you're considering this for a build spot, but there is a home right next door ....

title: Square Ten Acre Parcel Off Cr 199
comments: This is a square ten, 660x660 in size. The lands here are wooded, level and brushy. Topographical maps indicate that it is not marshlands. The Sturgeon River, Dam Lake and Cranberry Lake are all within a couple thousand feet of this parcel. On topographical maps, it shows that CR 199 crosses or touches the very NW corner of this parcel, and that CR 199 is an old railroad grade. On the ground, we can't see that this road exists. There isn't even evidence of a railroad grade where it cross Mead Road. We came in from the south off CR 440 (DD Road) then took Mead Road north. The area is heavily timbered, and they could have been into this parcel harvesting it ... we'd walk in to it if that is important to you. Our visual inspection indicated that electrical service was not available on or near this parcel. The nearest electric service appeared to be a considerable distance (hundreds or perhaps thousands of feet) from the property. As such, electrifying this parcel could be costly. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: 10 Acres Of Recreational Land In Autrain Township
comments: This is a square ten, 660x660 in dimension, in southern AuTrain Township. It is several hundred west of USFS Road 2184. We did not see any road access into this area, and topographical maps show it to be 100% marshlands. Would make a great frog farm or place to test amphibious vehicles. Or leave it in your will to that relative that thinks they're getting something special. Won't they be surprised ! This parcel has surface water, soil, or vegetation conditions indicating that it may include wetland habitat. Such habitat may comprise all or part of the parcel's area. However, it is possible that this parcel contains buildable areas as well. There are many environmental and building regulations related to wetlands which you should consult before bidding on this parcel. It is your responsibility to determine if this parcel is suitable for your desired use. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: Handyman Special In Ontonagon.
comments: Home is on a large (50x100+ foot) corner lot in Ontonagon. Home has been vinyl sided, but some has fallen off, revealing what looks to be a shady looking underside. The roof is is really rough shape, but surprisingly, it doesn't leak yet. The house has poor wooden pier footings, and perhaps unstable ground underneath, because it is sloping heavily inside to one corner. Kitchen and bath are dated and in disrepair. The back shed, which was collapsed, has been removed, but now the house is open to the critters and the elements who will take over if left unattended. House will need attention sooner rather than later.

title: Downtown Storefront In Ontonagon
comments: This is one half of the building that formerly contained the "Captains" Restaurant and Lounge. We are offering ONLY THE LOUNGE half of the property ... even though they are connected on the interior ... This property has a weak floor back in the kitchen, and it looks as though roof issues may be starting on the one story flat roof. This property has been vacant for probably nearing a decade now, and the two halves have been through a parade of owners, some of whom only bought it to remove its contents and then let it go again. It may be a worthwhile project for someone to acquire the other half ... as well as the building to the right/east, and re-establish a business here. The building is still restorable, but will require some elbow grease and investment. This is a very visible location in Ontonagons Central Business District.

title: 2 Story Home In Ontonagon. Handyman Special!
comments: This older 2 story home has seen some abuse, and will need help to get back to proper function. A front window is broken out and boarded, the front door jamb has been kicked in a few times, and the building shows evidence of having had a rough last few years. The remodeling here has been subpar, with newer windows in a few spots. In the rear right corner of the house, someone has removed a load bearing wall to expand a porch and try to convert it to a bedroom. There are several interior walls that have been removed, leaving the upper floors a little springy. And it looks like they took the breaker box and furnace with them too ... because we could not find them inside. Overall, the building has potential, but it's going to take some work and investment. May be beyond economic sense to do this. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed. This parcel appears to have been subject to harvesting of electrical, plumbing, mechanical systems, or other building components. Buildings are sometimes targeted by criminals that steal or "harvest" items such as copper plumbing, wiring, furnaces, water heaters, fixtures, hardwood flooring, etc. This building should be considered incomplete due to such harvesting and may require substantial investment to reequip.

title: 2 Story Home On German Road Near Bruce Crossing.
comments: This home was occupied within the last couple of years. Two story frame construction with an attached 2 car-plus garage on a one-acre square lot. Has been updated with a steel roof and a newer, efficient furnace next to a wood burning unit in the breezeway. We noticed that the floors in the kitchen area are wet, but the ceilings and roof are good. This indicates that there is likely frozen plumbing which at one time had saturated the floors. There is a good amount of clutter to be removed here to truly assess the condition, but it likely needs plumbing repair, replacement of the subfloor in the kitchen and a complete resurfacing and new floor coverings. The upper level was recently drywalled but not yet finished. This could be a good family home with some work. 3 bedrooms with nice walkin closet space.

title: Old Shack Not Far From Bruce Crossing.
comments: This is a 60 foot wide strip east of Bruce Crossing on Blacksmith Road off M-28, that runs almost 300 feet deep. The front half of the cabin is a goner. The back half is better, but not by much. The garage also has rot to the rafters. Pretty much everything here is a teardown. Power servicce has been dropped. There may be a well here in the grass, but we didn't see it. There is still a fishing boat and some other property here that is NOT part of the sale and it's not yours to remove either :). This property is supervised by a neighbor, so be on good behavior .... oh. And it's occupied by one Rocky Raccoon and his kinfolk.

title: House On 7 Acres! Near Ontonagon .... Good House, Bad Foundation.
comments: Home is on a parcel that fronts 230 feet on the east side of Norwich Road, just north of its intersection with Perander Road ... and runs a full 1/4 mile ... 1320 feet ... deep to the east. This is a mid-century 1.5 story house that appears to be in good condition overall as a frame structure. We noticed several open windows when we arrived, and they've been open so long that it has caused deterioration of the window units themselves which may require their replacement. The larger issue here is the foundation, which appears to have pretty much caved in to the basement at the rear right corner. This house will require someone that can raise it and repair the existing foundation ... or better yet ... move it to a new basement on the property. The house itself seems to be a solid frame structure, but this one is going to need some quick help or it'll turn into a liability. The backlot here is a nice, solid pine forest and a nice, private setting. At the back end of this property, topographical maps show that it drops abruptly, and should have an amazing view of the Ontonagon River valley to the east. The potential exists here to clear a trail far back into the property and create a homesite or retreat with an exceptional, and private, view of natural beauty.

title: Rustic Small Acreage Parcel, 1/4 Mile From Lake Superior.
comments: This is a triangular shaped parcel of land that sits off a two track in Golvernment Lot 3, Section 30. It is northeast of Ontonagon, and the roads here are developed but can be seasonally rough. The parcel sits east of the road here, and we would estimate its size at 9 acres. It has been forested regularly in the past. There are many 200' Lake Superior waterfront lots across the road, and this area will likely see future residential development even with its rather rustic location at present.

title: Commercial Storefront In Ewen.
comments: This is a retail storefront with some mechanical updates in Ewen. The building has been dormant for nearly a decade, and unfortunately has been sitting with a basement full of water all of that time (No power = no sump pump). It is difficult to know if it has suffered any foundation issues from this malady, but the upper frame structure still seems straight and square at our most recent observation. It is vinyl sided and has what still appears to be a good roof. Some damage has been done to the doors by various people entering the building illegallky, but it is superficial and can be repaired. This building will require a pump out and then some restoration of mechanicals that live in the basement (furnace etc). This will be a super deal IF you have a productive end use for the building. This is NOT a "flip" property. Several people have tried, and failed to do that already. It probably also has potential for conversion to a spacious one floor residence.

title: 50X120 Parcel In Trout Creek
comments: Parcel is situate at the NE corner of Main and First Street in Trout Creek. This is a wetlands lot and there are cat tails and surface water evident.

title: Mobile And Sauna On 11.25 Acres Near Trout Creek Village!
comments: This is an older, roofover mobile home, on 11.25 acres just outside Trout Creek. There is a hand-hewn sauna on the property, which is at the end of a long, private drive off Hardes Avenue. This could be a real nice countryside spot for an up-north cabin or new home.

title: 1.5 Acres On Us 45 Near Himanka Hill
comments: Parcel fronts 416 feet along the east side of US 45 and runs 150 feet deep. There appears to have been a driveway cleared into the parcel, and there is a primitive shack/deer blind set in the clearing there that we believe is likely on this parcel .... but you may wish to verify that with a survey or local records. Level, wooded lands with GREAT cell phone reception ... because a cell tower is just a few hundred feet to the rear.

title: 2 Acres With A Camp Shack In The Woods Near Paulding
comments: This is a 2 acre parcel, 295x295 in size, with a somewhat primitive bunker that can be seen from the road. It may have originally been a garage or small cabin. There is electricity here in the form of a fairly new service on a pole out front. There are warning signs on the property that threaten trespassers with "traps", so we would suggest due care be used when viewing this property. It was unoccupied (we think) when we were there in early June, but it's difficult to say if the former owner/occupant is still around here or if they've left for greener pastures. The power is still on, so that's questionable. There was previously a modular home here, and we assume there are a fairly modern well and septic that have potential for reuse. The SEV noted is a couple of years old ... and the property is now assessed under $2000. There is some debris here to reckon with. Level, wooded dry lands. Just a couple miles up the road from the LVD Casino on a recreational area, gravel, county maintained road. Would be a nice spot for a getaway or new home. Few year-rounders in the immediate area. Lots of peace and quiet.

title: Commercial Property At Paulding! Jarvi's Bar.
comments: This is a property that has been occupied as Jarvi's bar until the last few years. It is a "Biltmore" that has an attached garage to the north side, and a residential structure connected at the rear. The building fronts on Old US 45, and obviously existied well before the highway here was relocated 100 feet further east. The property includes frontage on both Old and New US 45, and has paved parking in front. The south side of the parcel also fronts on Sleepy Hollow Road. The building appears to still be solid and square. Mechanically, this is likely needs some updates, but the basics are all here. It appears to have been vacated around 2011. Much of the interior of the bar and house is knotty pine. The home to the rear is in comparable repair. The roof of the attached garage to the north has some noticeable sway to it, but it has likely been like that for years. There is also a partly completed new storage or bunkhouse type structure that is partly completed to the rear, a well as a sauna ! The liquor license is not a part of this sale, and we believe is no longer assigned to this address. These structures appear to be solid and worthy of rehabilitation.

title: Scrappers Special In Mass City!
comments: Collapsed steel shop building on a parcel of land in Mass City. Could be some scrap value (or repurposing use) for the steel here. Some other general debris here as well to be tossed. This parcel includes a structure which should be considered DANGEROUS. This building has suffered structural damage which creates substantial risk of harm from falling through damaged areas or collapse from above. It may also contain extensive debris which could fall or collapse, rusty nails, broken glass, and other hazards. You are not permitted to enter this or any other structure offered at tax sale. You should limit your inspection only to what can be safely observed from the building's exterior. Trespassers are subject to prosecution.

title: Vacant Parcel Behind Merritts Travel Center In Mass City.
comments: If you take a gander down the road north of Merritts Travel Center in Mass City, you'll see our large yellow sign on a pole a few hundred feet to the east. This parcel sits on an unimproved section of a platted road ... and may not be exactly where the sign is located ... but you can see it from there ... The lands here are moist, level, and brushy. Lot size is 50x110 The roads which are shown on plat or tax maps for this parcel do not appear to exist or may be located in a different location than shown on such maps. While a legal right to build such roads may remain, this construction would likely be very expensive. However, in some instances these unimproved roads have been vacated or abandoned by action of the local government and no such right to construct the roads remains. Issues surrounding unimproved roads can be complicated and expensive to resolve. You should investigate the existence of any roads and the ability to access this parcel thoroughly before bidding.

title: Large, 24 Unit, Multi-Family Housing Unit At White Pine
comments: Sales 5109 and 5110 are reminders of the mining boom days in White Pine. These buildings first served as housing for mine workers, their families, and those in supporting local business during the last half of last century. When the mine closed, they transitioned to rental housing for those who stayed behind ... and then gradually fell vacant and into disrepair. The buildings are substantial, having almost a military housing grade of infrastructure to them. The floor decking on the main level is reinforced concrete, and the mechanical systems are hefty and elaborate for their time in this place. Each housing unit is separately wired to its own individual panelboard, but each building only has one power service. Because the individual units are fed from the basement level (which is underwater) we can't be sure if it is individually sub-metered. Sale 5110 is the more "original" of the two buildings, and we suspect it has been vacant longer, perhaps well over a decade. Unlike 5109, the roof has not been leaking for an extended period time, but we trust that is a short term situation at best. We aren't sure of their exact age, but we do know these buildings predate 1978. There is a high probability that the buildings contain either/both lead based paint and asbestos wrap on steam pipes in the corridor ceilings and basement level. The basement here is nearly full ... at least 5 foot in depth ... with water (power offf = no sump pump). We also noticed mold creeping up the main floor walls here, and some "harvesting" has been taking place of scrap metal (radiators etc). It will require "deep pockets" to restore this building to a code-approvable multi-family residential use. Are there other options ? It could possibly be used for storage or warehousing at a much lower cost, but with a similarly low return. This building exhibited more decay to the exterior surfaces that 5109, but that may be simply because the other unit has some more recent effort made at cosmetics. This property appears to include one or more obsolete structures. Due to changed circumstances, physical conditions, or the passage of time, structures can become economically unviable. Such changes may be related to physical condition but may also be the result of things like changed traffic patterns or local economic distress. Prospective bidders should be aware that this property may no longer be suitable for purposes to which it was previously put and should investigate and consider all circumstances prior to bidding. This parcel appears to have been subject to harvesting of electrical, plumbing, mechanical systems, or other building components. Buildings are sometimes targeted by criminals that steal or "harvest" items such as copper plumbing, wiring, furnaces, water heaters, fixtures, hardwood flooring, etc. This building should be considered incomplete due to such harvesting and may require substantial investment to reequip.

title: Large, 24 Unit, Multi-Family Housing Unit At White Pine
comments: Sales 5109 and 5110 are reminders of the mining boom days in White Pine. These buildings first served as housing for mine workers, their families, and those in supporting local business during the last half of last century. When the mine closed, they transitioned to rental housing for those who stayed behind ... and then gradually fell vacant and into disrepair. The buildings are substantial, having almost a military housing grade of infrastructure to them. The floor decking on the main level is reinforced concrete, and the mechanical systems are hefty and elaborate for their time in this place. Each housing unit is separately wired to its own individual panelboard, but each building only has one power service. Because the individual units are fed from the basement level (which is underwater) we can't be sure if it is individually sub-metered There was an effort made to transform 5109 into short term lodging, an effort that met with limited success, before it too became vacant. The building in sale 5109 is in the better condition of the two, though that is mostly a superficial, cosmetic assessment based on some carpet and similar upgrades. The roof has been leaking for some time, and the pattern is widespread across the structure indicating that the entire roof is due for replacement ... which is certainly a $50,000+ expense. We aren't sure of their exact age, but we do know they predate 1978. There is a high probability that the buildings contain either/both lead based paint and asbestos wrap on steam pipes in the corridor ceilings and basement level. The basement here is nearly full ... at least 5 foot in depth ... with water (power offf = no sump pump). It will require "deep pockets" to restore this building to a code-approvable multi-family residential use. Are there other options ? It could possibly be used for storage or warehousing at a much lower cost, but with a similarly low return. Of note, the property does have a detached steel storage building that is roughly 24x36 in size. This property appears to include one or more obsolete structures. Due to changed circumstances, physical conditions, or the passage of time, structures can become economically unviable. Such changes may be related to physical condition but may also be the result of things like changed traffic patterns or local economic distress. Prospective bidders should be aware that this property may no longer be suitable for purposes to which it was previously put and should investigate and consider all circumstances prior to bidding. This parcel appears to have been subject to harvesting of electrical, plumbing, mechanical systems, or other building components. Buildings are sometimes targeted by criminals that steal or "harvest" items such as copper plumbing, wiring, furnaces, water heaters, fixtures, hardwood flooring, etc. This building should be considered incomplete due to such harvesting and may require substantial investment to reequip.

title: 10 Acre Recreational Parcel West Of Bergland Off M-64
comments: This is a "square 10", being 660 feet (north-south) x 660 feet (east-west). It does not front on any public road, and appears to only be accessable over *gated* two track roads that cross the private lands of other parties. You will want to research easement rights, if any exist, prior to bidding. The USGS topographical maps for the parcel indicate that much of this parcel is marshlands. Parcel 5106 adjoins this parcele to the north, and you may wish to consider purchasing both. Great recreational lands just a few miles west of Bergland off M-64 ! Our visual inspection indicated that electrical service was not available on or near this parcel. The nearest electric service appeared to be a considerable distance (hundreds or perhaps thousands of feet) from the property. As such, electrifying this parcel could be costly. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

comments: Parcels 5100, 01, 03 and 04 are 4 "almost" adjacent parcels that are situated around an abandon section of Old M-28 west of Bergland. title: 38X137 Lot In Stambaugh. Has Collapsing Structure On It.
comments: It's difficult to tell there is anything on this lot, because of the thick brush at the lot line, but there is a cruddy old house here. We're considering this as a vacant lot because the structure here is beyond repair. Sits at the NE corner of the intersection of Jefferson and Iris streets in Stambaugh. Corner lot. 38 feet on Iris, 137 deep along Jefferson. The garage may have potential ... but the house is rough. Bad roof. Bad foundation. Bad everything. Ignored for a long, long time. This parcel includes a structure which should be considered DANGEROUS. This building has suffered structural damage which creates substantial risk of harm from falling through damaged areas or collapse from above. It may also contain extensive debris which could fall or collapse, rusty nails, broken glass, and other hazards. You are not permitted to enter this or any other structure offered at tax sale. You should limit your inspection only to what can be safely observed from the building's exterior. Trespassers are subject to prosecution.

title: Quality Built 1.5 Story Bungalow In Iron River
comments: It appears this one has been sitting for a bit, but it's still got the bones of a pretty solid house. This is a classic 30's bungalow style home that had a late century remodel that was out of character for its period. The roof is older but does not appear to be a leaker. Older natural gas forced air heat, and original 60A fusebox. The whole house is really grubby and there is a fair amount of food-type garbage here stinking things up. We suspect there has been freeze damage, as the ceiling on the first floor below the second floor bath has come down ... indicating that water has been running. 3 bedrooms and 2 baths. The garage has a pretty substantial lean to it and will need to be repaired or removed before it gets worse.

title: Partly Remodeled Two Story Home In Stambaugh.
comments: This is an older frame construction home that was modernized we'd guess in the 60's or 70's based on the materials used. Has a detached 1.5 car garage, and an alley access. Inside, the living room has some unfinished knotty pine treatment underway, and the rest of the house has the appearance of a mid-century modernizing, upgraded casement windows in places, and some subsequent attempts at modifications in the kitchen and baths. Has a newer, forced air natural gas furnace, electric service and water heater. The garage is in decent condition. Has an an older steel roof, that looks like it is nearing the end of it's time, but there are no visible leaks in the second floor of the house. 3 bedrooms and one bath down. A decent, solid house ... that needs mostly cosmetics. This home appears to have been occupied until fairly recently. The power was still on and shutoff notices were on the door when we were by there in early June.

title: Vacant Home Sized Lot In Stambaugh
comments: Parcel is on the north side of Diamond Street. 60' at the road x 120' deep. Level, dry open lands.

title: 1.5 Story Home On Cherry Street In Stambaugh
comments: This is an older home in Stambaugh that has been vacant for several years based on observations. Has a barrier free ramp to the front door, and a full basement with posts that have been added to shore up a sloping floor. However we also notice that several door casings inside the house are out of square, and upon further investigation, the whole structure seems to be leaning to the west a couple of inches. Is that fatal ? Probably not. We suspect it's been like that for years. But it's something you should probably be aware of. The mechanicals here are all antiquated. The roof is old, and we saw a localized leak in a second floor bedroom. 3 bedrooms, 2 baths. The back shed has a bad roof ... and we notice that the electric service overhead has actually been dropped by the power company, whiuch usually indicates that you'll need to bring the entire thing up to code prior to occupancy ... which may be a real trick here. Overall it's grubby and will need to be emptied and scrubbed. And it may have structural issues as well. Bid accordingly.

title: Parcel With Two Junk Shacks In Iron River
comments: We are combining sales 2636 and 2637 to bring to you not one, but TWO old shacks plus an outbuilding that is in similar condition. This is situated at the corner of Cedar and Minckler Street at the noirth edge of town. This is actually a decent piece of dirt if you remove the old buildings. Combined, this parcel is 60 feet along the western edge of Cedar, and it runs 120 feet deep to the west. City utilities and natural gas are available here. title: Vacant Lot Downtown Iron River - Next Door To The Vfw
comments: Parcel is on the south side of East Genesee Street in downtown Iron River, and immediately adjacent to the VFW to the west. A building was removed from this parcel, and it has been graded and is now clean and ready for new uses. Fronts 72' on Genesee, and runs 120' deep to the South. Commercial distict at the east end of the "main drag" in Iron River.

title: Vacant Parcel On Boynton Avenue, Iron River
comments: this is a vacant parcel near downtown that a neighbor appears to have been using for storage. It is down the hillside from Washington Avenue, on the north side of Boynton. 120' on Boyington Street x 100' deep to the north.

title: Condemned Brick House In Iron River
comments: This one is coming down ... either intentionally by city action ... or allllll on it's own. The brick coursework in this house has deteriorated to the point that it is literally falling down in piles. It has been condemned by the city, which means that it cannot be occupied until brought up to 2016 code standards ... and that is a tall order which exceeds the value of the home if completed. Be aware that a neighbor has things stored in the garage here that will be moved ... and is watching this property.

title: Dozer Bait In Iron River
comments: This home has been disassembled to the point that it's probably in danger of collapse. Someone appears to have been repurposing the lumber from here, and there isn't much left attached. There are several piles around the property, but this one is certainly past the point of being put back together. A neighbor has expressed interest in this one to finish the demolition, so ....
