title: Two Story 4-Square Home In Iron River. A Classic In Great Condition.
comments: This is a sharp, older ORIGINAL home in Iron River. It's a little tough to see from the road as the yard has overgrown. We suspect that this one has been vacant for a few years, but at one time, not too long ago, this was a well maintained property. It is quite original as to doors, windows and trim. There is a coffered ceiling and fireplace in the living room, and a classic built-in at the dining room. The kitchen here is bad 1980s, but otherwise this one is in VERY authentic condition. Hardwood (probably maple) floors. Has hot water boiler/radiator heat and a newer boiler unit in the basement that has no visual indications of freeze damage. Has an older roof that is near the end of reliable life, and we saw a leak in the left front bedroom and water stains on the dining room ceiling and wall just to the lef of the front door. Two car, detached garage of a more recent vintage ... in very good condition and clean as a whistle.

title: 60X125 Parcel Without Improved Road. Gaastra
comments: This parcel fronts on a section of 2nd Street in Gaastra that was never improved. It is 60x125 in size. Please investigate whether the road here was ever "vacated" with village offices to be sure of having access rights. The roads which are shown on plat or tax maps for this parcel do not appear to exist or may be located in a different location than shown on such maps. While a legal right to build such roads may remain, this construction would likely be very expensive. However, in some instances these unimproved roads have been vacated or abandoned by action of the local government and no such right to construct the roads remains. Issues surrounding unimproved roads can be complicated and expensive to resolve. You should investigate the existence of any roads and the ability to access this parcel thoroughly before bidding.

title: 120X120  Vacant Parcel. Nice Lot. Gaastra.
comments: This is a really nice 120x120 parcel fronting on the east side of Fifth Street, just north of its intersection with Center Avenue in Gaastra. Towering pines would make a really nice homesite. Paved roads here. Natural gas and city water too !

title: Small Rectangular Parcel In Crystal Falls
comments: This is a small parcel that fronts 25' on Old 141 and then runs to a point about 53' to the east. Triangular. Too small to build on, but could be used by a neighbor. This parcel is too small to be practically useful under most circumstances. Many times such parcels are the result of survey or property transfer errors which create small orphaned slivers of land. These parcels are frequently too small to allow construction or any other practical use. They often have no road frontage or legal means of access. These parcels can often lead to adverse claims or encroachments by neighboring land owners which can be complicated legal issues to resolve. Please investigate this parcel thoroughly prior to bidding.

title: Handyman Special In Crystal Falls.
comments: It appears that this one has been sitting for some time. The yard is very overgrown, and the roof is warped and checkered. It has numerous issues with foundation and footing components falling in. However someone has been working on the interior, which seems to be partway through a remodel. The roof doesn't look too hot, but we did not see any signs of leakage inside. Again, the foundation here is going to be a major defect to correct, so most other conditions are secondary. You will want to assess the condition of the foundation here carefully before bidding. The foundation of one or more buildings located on this parcel appears to be failing. Correcting foundation issues can be very expensive and issues are often more complex than they initially appear. You should research this issue thoroughly prior to bidding on this parcel.

title: Home In Need Of Help. Crystal Falls
comments: This home has a failing foundation, which could preclude it from economic vitality as a candidate for restoration without a serious, and immediate effort to correct it (see photos). The basement foundation wall is already leaning, and has a major stress crack that indicates it could probably fail and collapse inward at any time. It needs a roof and a complete interior redo. It does have a newer electric service, older furnace, original kitchen and bath. The home is worthy of rehabilitating, but you're going to need to assess the foundation situation before making that decision. There are 5 bedrooms here. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed. The foundation of one or more buildings located on this parcel appears to be failing. Correcting foundation issues can be very expensive and issues are often more complex than they initially appear. You should research this issue thoroughly prior to bidding on this parcel.

title: Commercial Storefront In Downtown Crystal Falls
comments: This is an older frame building (with addition) "on the hill" in Crystal Falls downtown district. It has most recently been a second hand/antique store, but appears to have spent its original life as a hotel building or lodging house, as to the original two story portion on the left side. The property is still under the control of the store operator, so we did not have the opportunity to view the interior. From the exterior, the left side building appears to be solid, straight and square. The upper floor appears to be accessed from the side street, although there may be an interior stairway as well to the "Moberg Hotel" section. The building to the right is also two story, and the two are corrected inside on the main floor and by a hallway or some similar connection across the front of the second floor. The roofs here are quite old rolled roofing, and there are ladders visible which infers an ongoing battle has been underway to keep them from leaking. This property is occupied. Please respect the privacy of current occupants and limit any inspection to what can be safely observed from the road. Some occupants may be upset or angry and may meet contact with aggression or violence. Please use discretion and caution when researching this or other occupied properties. Furthermore, although this property has been foreclosed for unpaid taxes, occupants have certain rights under Michigan law and must be formally evicted if unwilling to leave voluntarily. You may wish to consult a licensed attorney for more information. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. You are NOT authorized to enter these or any other buildings offered for sale. You should limit your inspection to that which can be made safely from the building's exterior. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

title: Messy, Collapsing Old House Near Crystal Falls
comments: If you're not sure how to find this one, you won't. The driveway is overgrown, and you can't see the house from the road ... but it's there ! And, boy howdy it's a treat when you get there ! This one has had a bad roof for a LONG time, and has lots of broken windows and other issues as well to compound that. And if you needed extra enticement, the foundation has collapsed and the whole structure has potential to cave into the basement. It's a "sunken living room" !!! The value here is in the land. We're thinking this one is probably at least 2 acres, and it's a really nice, private setting with some great cedar and softwoods. Remove this house and put in a new one ... the privacy of country living right inside the city ! Irregular shaped parcel. See local records for all the details. On Railroad Street up behind the Paint River Hills campground. This parcel includes a structure which should be considered DANGEROUS. title: Older, Frame Home In Crystal Falls
comments: This is an older frame strructure in Crystal Falls that has some footing and structural issues. It appears to be built on wood pier posts footings, some of which are decaying and shifting. The main potion of the structure has some serious bows and weaves in the floor, and the back porch is badly leaning. There is a modern sewer cleanout at the rear that infers something may have been done in recent years with a septic field of some kind ... but we can say for sure what that is. Is there potential here ? Perhaps. Is it worth that investment ? That question is one you will have to answer. We'd advise you to check with building officials regarding requirements for occupying this one again. The value here is in the lot, which is a very nice, dry open city parcel. The foundation of one or more buildings located on this parcel appears to be failing. Correcting foundation issues can be very expensive and issues are often more complex than they initially appear. title: Large Corner Lot In Caspian
comments: Parcel fronts 120 feet along the east side of Second Street, and 125 along the north side of Albino. Rolls sharply downhill to the east.

title: Double Lot Atop A Hill In Caspian
comments: Lot fronts 60 feet on the west side of Second Street, and runs 126 feet, uphill, to the west. This parcel sits between two stone retaining wallsa and appears to be marked at the north boundary by a neighbors flag.

title: Commercial Property : Trails End Saloon In Caspian.
comments: We seem to be getting a lot of small town bars the last few years. This one is in a commercial brick storefront in Caspian that would appear to have promise for repurposing to other retail, office or even residential uses. Had a big plate glass storefront in its original incarnation, "modernized" to small thermalpane windows in the last few decades. Inside, the property is in remarkably good shape, and appears to have been well taken care of during it's operation, which ended about 5 years ago. The original tin ceiling ... which is in very good, restorable condition, still exists .... mostly intact ... above the 1970's drop acoustic ceiling. Broken pool trophies litter the floor in front of a deco-era backbar of about 20 foot in length that is also very restorable. Small walk in cooler to the rear (watch out for the SKUNK that lives back here now). An exterior concrete block structure has been built to enclose an exterior stair to the living space above the bar room. The second floor was a remodel-in-progress which was unfinished. Niiiice hardwood floors here ... and it's 3BR and seperately metered for power. There is also an "annex", which in its original life was a twocar garage that they creatively attached with a secretive hallway ... probably was the pool room. Overall this is a very solid building awaiting your repurposing.

title: Home In Caspian
comments: This home in Caspian was occupied until very recently. Some personal belongings have been left behind, but with a little clean up and repair work, this could be a great home. Appears to have been updated (newer furnace and water heater) and in reasonable condition. Vinyl siding, and alley access, good roof. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. title: Home In Pretty Rough Condition. Caspian
comments: This one has been let go for a long, long time. What is left of the roof has visible holes in the shingle. Front porch is tipping to the east probably 4 to 6 inches, but that way you don't need to invest in a door closer! It has numerous broken windows. A neighbor tells us that the last owner of the house bought it, and then proceeded to strip the furnace and everything of value out of the inside. The house, with a new front porch and new roof, may have some potential for restoration, but it would be quite an undertaking. The siding needs a little work, but we have seen far worse. Older 100 amp electric service. Handyman special.

We remind you that where ownership is held in common with others, that you cannot make changes to, or build on the property without the consent of all owners. title: Home On Scott Lake Road, Gaastra
comments: 313 x 313 parcel gives this one 2.23 acres more or less. This is an older, one story home that has been vacant for some time now. The lands here are open and gently rolling ... dry and buildable. A collapsed garage on the property appears to be an older structure made from rough sawn lumber and logs that was covered with steel. The shallow well pumphouse sits to the rear of the house and looks like it will need to be put back together. There is some debris laying around in general, but really not a horrid amount. A good mowing and this place will look respectable real quick. The house is solid and worthy of your restorative efforts. The roof looks old and is probably in its "last few years", but we did not see any leaks inside. Water heater is missing, but the older furnace is still on the job. Everything in here is old, but solid. Full basement. This one needs to be emptied and cleaned, but she's got potential.

title: Two Acres And A House On Gibbs City Road!
comments: Older one story home ... mid-century construction ... Has an older roof and older elecric service. Aluminum siding for low maintenance. The soffits here have pulled loose in a couple spots and have become nesting spots for birds. The foundation at the rear has washed out into the basement and will need repair by a mason. The house itself is in generally solid condition, with an older fuel oil furnace. Original kitchen and bath. 2BR/1BA. Home is situated on a double lot ... with a total of 240' along the west side of Gibbs City Road and then running 363' deep. It rolls uphill from the road and is mostly wooded in middle aged softwoods and evergreens with some brushy spots near the road. The foundation of one or more buildings located on this parcel appears to be failing. Correcting foundation issues can be very expensive and issues are often more complex than they initially appear. You should research this issue thoroughly prior to bidding on this parcel.

title: 4.2 Acres With Cabin And Detached Garage. Iron River Township With Rehab Potential
comments: The cabin here was built on wood pier footings and is pretty much junk. Windows have been boarded. Floors sway and are buckled from shifting and heaving. The detached garage, however, has excellent potential for being converted into a cabin and there is potential to reuse the well and septic. There are two adjacent parcels in this sale ... a 3.7 primary parcel, and another .5 acre slice to the northwest along the road. The foundation of one or more buildings located on this parcel appears to be failing. Correcting foundation issues can be very expensive and issues are often more complex than they initially appear. You should research this issue thoroughly prior to bidding on this parcel.

title: Mini-Farm! Ten Acres - 4 Parcels On Campbell Road With Orchard And Classic Farmhouse.
comments: We are offering a classic farm property north of Iron River near the Forbes Location. There is a classic older farmhouse type property here that appears to have been well maintained over the years from the outside. Inside, there are some incomplete remodeling efforts on the main floor, with the second floor being more original. It has a dual fuel oil/wood heating system and older kitchen. Newer electric service. There are numerous outbuildings here including a quaint, VERY old log cabin and newer barns. The property is a "long ten" (roughly 330x1320) that fronts on both Campbell Road on the south and Iron Lake Road on the north. Consists of 4 separate parcels that total 9.67 acres. It is entirely fenced (including several smaller pens) and would be great for horses. These are rolling, open lands with mature apple orchard plantings all over it. if you're looking for a country farm property, look no further !!

title: Commercial Storefront Property In Amasa!
comments: This is a historic storefront property in "downtown" Amasa. At a previous tax auction, the property adjacent to this, which contains its septic system, was sold to a third party, who then donated it to the church next door. A buyer will want to investigate obtaining an easement, either voluntarily or with the assistance of circuit court, for the continued use of the septic system. This is an older wood frame building, the "Amasa House", a tavern in the Central Business District of the village. The building is vinyl sided, and the soffits on the right side are in rough shape. It appears that the left half of the building is the original structure, and the right side was added later, with a shared stairway to the second floor. Upstairs, the original/left half was originally a boarding or rooming house based on the layout we see. Parts of the upper floor have been stripped for a renovation that never happened, and there is a lot of incomplete construction. Overall, the building is solid, but all torn up. We'd recommend focus on getting a solid new roof on it, or the rest is meaningless. The roof does not seem to leak at present, but it's not going to be long until it does based on ther condition of the soffits and fascia. There is also a deteriorated outbuilding to the rear that probably should just come down.

title: 10 Acres And Two Homes Near Gibson Lake.
comments: Parcel is 330' wide (north-south) x 1320' (east-west). There is an older frame home here as well as a newer modular home on a foundation to the rear. The structures sit several hundred feet off Clark Road, at the end of a private driveway. There are also a couple of outbuildings here that are in decent repair also. Because the property may still contain personal property belonging to the last occupant, we did not enter them, but they appear to be in excellent overall condition. There are only surface rights being sold, and subsurface interests are titled to a third party. This property has been "posted" by the former owner who appears to have relocated, but we would urge caution here.

title: One Square Acre, Offroad. No Road Access.
comments: This is a "square acre", roughly 208x208 ... that sits about 450 feet west of Reiman Road. There is no public road frontage to this parcel. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. title: 70.6 Acres ... 8.7% Ownership Share ... No Access Roads
comments: This is 8.7% ownership, undivided, in a 70 acre parcel south of the Bates Mine location at Iron River. Keep in mind that an undivided interest property owner cannot make changes or build on property without the consent of ALL other owners. There is no public road frontage that approaches this parcel. The interest which was foreclosed and which is being offered for sale is less than a 100% ownership interest in the total parcel. title: Dozer Bait House In Hancock.
comments: This home is on the DEMO LIST for the City of Hancock, and they've earmarked it for a trip to the landfill. Would they let you buy it and repair it ? That will take some fast talking and assurance to the City ... which you will want to investigate BEFORE bidding. The date of the demolition is uncertain at this moment, but it is inevitable. It will at some time be a vacant lot under the status quo. The rear addition to this home has collapsed, and there are lots of areas where it has been open to the elements. It is probably best as a vacant lot is our assessment. This parcel includes a structure which should be considered DANGEROUS. This building has suffered structural damage which creates substantial risk of harm from falling through damaged areas or collapse from above. It may also contain extensive debris which could fall or collapse, rusty nails, broken glass, and other hazards. You are not permitted to enter this or any other structure offered at tax sale. You should limit your inspection only to what can be safely observed from the building's exterior. Trespassers are subject to prosecution. This parcel has been posted as "Condemned" by the local building authority. Properties are generally condemned when they are deemed substandard, unsafe, or otherwise unfit for use and habitation. Condemned property must be rehabilitated to meet local building codes prior to use or occupancy. A building is not automatically slated for demolition when condemned. However, this does not necessarily mean that demolition will not also be pursued by the local unit. Please check with the local building official before bidding to determine the specific status and requirements for this property. The structure(s) on this parcel have been slated for demolition by the local unit of government prior to sale. As such, it is being presented here as a vacant lot. You should confirm the status of this parcel as well as the allocation of the cost of demolition prior to bidding.

title: Vacant Lot On Iroquois Street In Laurium
comments: A home has been removed from this lot, and now it's ready for you to build anew, or add it to your neighboring property. Level, open lands on a paved street with municipal utility. A quiet neighborhood with some newer homes, all well maintained.

title: Occupied 1.5 Story House In Laurium.
comments: Old school cedar shingle sided one-and-a-half story home in Laurium. This one is still under the control of a former occupant and we did not have access to the inside during our visit in early June. From appearances, it is merchantable, and has some newer doors and windows. The roof is older and has some staining, but the shingle appears to all be in place. It has a newer chimney, which could indiacet some mechanical upgrades have taken place here. There is natural gas here, and the electrical service, at let outside the house, appears to be newer and upgraded. This property is occupied. Please respect the privacy of current occupants and limit any inspection to what can be safely observed from the road. Some occupants may be upset or angry and may meet contact with aggression or violence. Please use discretion and caution when researching this or other occupied properties. Furthermore, although this property has been foreclosed for unpaid taxes, occupants have certain rights under Michigan law and must be formally evicted if unwilling to leave voluntarily. You may wish to consult a licensed attorney for more information. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

title: Large Older Home In Laurium. Restorers Look Here.
comments: This is a large, two story home in Laurium. It originally had an open front porch that has been enclosed. And the garage to the side is also an afterthought. Inside, the home is generally solid, but the flkoors slop to the center of the house (probably repairable with bracing) and the roof and much of the wiring looking old and in need of an upgrade. There are some missing roof shingles, but we only noticed interior leakage in the kitchen in one spot (see photos.) The home has some sharp interior trim that is very restorable. Wood floors that would sand up nicely.

title: Occupied Home In Calumet
comments: This is an older frame construction home that is cosmetically challenged, right in the central downtown district of Calumet. It is still in the possession of the former occupant, and we did not have the opportunity to inspect the interior of the home in detail ... but we assume that the inside matches the outside. Rustic. The lot is 23 feet wide. This property is occupied. Please respect the privacy of current occupants and limit any inspection to what can be safely observed from the road. Some occupants may be upset or angry and may meet contact with aggression or violence. Please use discretion and caution when researching this or other occupied properties. title: Vacant Commercial Property In Calumet!
comments: Sales 2427 consists of two adjacent commercial lots in the Central Business District of Calumet. Municipal utilities are available here, as well as natural gas. It would appear that adjoining parcels are also vacant and could be consolidated into a larger piece for a more substantial project. Sales 2427 and 2428 have been combined. Please see 2427 for the particulars on this parcel.

title: Vacant Offroad Lot. Dollar Bay Area.
comments: This is a parcel on an unimproved, platted road. It is a couple hundred feet from an improved road, and USGS topographical maps indicate the lands in the area are primarily marshlands and brush. The roads which are shown on plat or tax maps for this parcel do not appear to exist or may be located in a different location than shown on such maps. title: Sharp, Updated House In Hubbell!
comments: This one is fresh and ready to go ! Nice, updated home with low maintenance exterior in Hubbell. Vinyl siding, newer roof, vinyl clad windows. Upgraded mechanicals, furnace and clean surfaces all make this one one of the nicest in the auction this season. If you are looking for one that is "ready to move into", this is as close as we have to offer you. This one would call "decor challenged", but nothing a little paint would not take care of. Maybe you *like* it this way ? That's your call. But this one has been mechanically updated and will need very little to make it functional. One bedroom/bath upstairs. Kitchen is older, but functional. Wood burning fireplace too !!

title: Vacant Bottom-Of-The-Hill Lot In Hubbell
comments: This lot is at the bottom of the hill, on F Avenue (Birch Street on the plat), in Hubbell. Looks like whoever owns the top of the hill uses it as a convenient place to get rid of their excess brush and such. But we guess thats how gravity works if you're the guy at the bottom of the hill. Fronts 50 feet on the street, and runs 80 feet deep to, and partway up, the hill. Could be useful as a spot for a garage for one of the homes across the road ....

title: Vacant Hillside Parcel In Hubbell
comments: Single platted lot in an addition to the Village of Grover (Hubbell). This one pretty much runs straight downhill into a ravine. If you've been looking for a hole in the ground to throw your money into, LOOK NO FURTHER. You've come to the right place. 150' along the street, and 50' down the hill ... This parcel appears to have challenging terrain. Challenging terrain can include steep hillsides, ravines, gullies, or similar topographical features as well as little to no buildable area. Such parcels often have no practical use. You should investigate this parcel's terrain and suitability for your desired purpose prior to bidding.

title: Waterfront At Mud Lake, North Of Houghton!
comments: Sales 2418 and 2419 are adjacent lots in a newer development. These lands are in a rustic location, on a private dirt road, noth and east of the Portage Channel and Houghton. These are WATERFRONT on the south shore of Mud Lake, Lake Linden, MI. Parcel 2419 (Lot "9") has 231 feet of waterfrontage. Either of these lots alone would make a magnificent rustic retreat. Together, they would be an estate sized property in a serene locale. This is a private road area with only a handful of residences. Few (if any) on the road are year-round. 3.16 acres in size.

You'll be able to spot this house on this densely populated street, because its the only one with a hearse in the yard. We did not have the opportunity to view the house up close and personal, but we're told it has strong "animal odors", and has a healthy population of felines in residence. title: Waterfront On The Sturgeon River Mouth At Otter Lake.
comments: Otter Lake is a very scenic, wildlife intensive locale. This parcel is one acre in size, and sits at the very mouth of the prominent Sturgeon River where it joins the Lake. Our topographical maps indicate thst there are roads into this area that do not exist, and we also noted that much of the area between the end of the current road (Myllya Road) and the property is low and marshy. It would likely be an education in wetlands law to determine if you could put a road to this parcel, and even if that was navigated ... whether you would be allowed to build on it or if it would support any sort of on-site sanitation (septic) system. This is a very desirable and scenic location for a piece of property, we're just not sure of its practical uses. It would likely be a great campspot if it contained uplands ... we were not able to determine that with any certainty. This will require some muck boots and handheld GPS. We are also uncertain if there are any legal easements or unimproved roads into this piece ... or if your only legal access is by boat. Also, power is hundreds of feet away. Bid accordingly.

comments: Parcels 2413 and 2414 are adjoining lots on an unimproved section of Huron Street in Paavola (Pewabic). We're offering them together to assure access to 2414, which sits to the rear (south) of 2413. comments: Sales 2411 and 2412 are being combined to give potential access to 2411, which has no improved road frontage. Being sold with parcel 2411. See that sale for details.

title: Riverfrontage On The Ontonagon River In Kenton!
comments: Property fronts on Harrison Street, and fronts on the south west side of the Ontagon River where the M-28 bridge crosses it. It appears that there was likely an structure here in the past that was removed, as the parcel has a gate and an address. There is an inactive power service on the property, and what look like well/water and sewer/septic connections. This is a nice setting for a new home or cabin !

title: Historic Charm! 2 Story Home With Sharp Interior At Osceola (Calumet).
comments: This is a well appointed, historic two story home that appears to have been vacant for a bit. Has the old school asphalt and/or asbestos shingle siding (that a restorer would strongly consider removing), and an older roof that still looks to be all in place. The yard is a bit overgrown, but has some very nice potential. Has a high footing wall under the house that elevates it a couple feet more than normal. The front stairs will need upgrading as they're old and rickety. This is a fairly large home with ceilings on the main floor in the range of 10 feet, and the interior is very richly trimmed with a higher grade of woodwork than we often see in homes that we normally sell here. This one is very "original", including the spartan kitchen, antiquated electrical and plumbing fixtures, but a newer furnace. This home is very worthy of restoration, and if you're looking for a historic home that just needs a little attention, this is the one. It is square and solid, just lonely.

title: 1.5 Story Home And Adjacent Vacant Lot. Laurium.
comments: This is an older 1.5 story home on Lauriums west side, just a hop, skip and jump from Calumet. Home has seen some modernization, and has an extra vacant lot included in the sale. The roof is older, but appears to be intact. The siding is a composition/hardboard product, and is delaminating in places. Windows, doors and furnace have been upgraded . 3 bedrooms 1 bath. Vacant lot. Adjacent to, and being sold with, sale 2405. See that parcel for details.

title: Handyman Special On Wedge Street In Calumet.
comments: Older, 1.5 story home with asphalt and/or asbestos shingle siding. Has been insulated in the past as disclosed by the plugs in the siding. Yard is overgrown, and the roof has seen better days and is due for a replacement. Some replacement windows have been patched into spots here. Interior of the house is cluttered with rummage-sale grade stuff, so you'll become friends with the dumpster man by the time it's emptied. There is a lot of incomplete remodeling underway here, and some of the materials and craftmanship are subpar. Floors are unlevel, there are things torn apart and not put back together ... The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed.

title: Home In Florida!
comments: If you've always wanted to have a place in Florida, now's your chance ! Located near the south border of metropolitan Laurium, this old frame structure realllllly, needs to come down. The foundation is shot, and the "Biltmore" garage has been failing for generations. The roof here has been leaking since last century. This would make a real sharp vacant lot, and that's the category we're listing it in. The foundation of one or more buildings located on this parcel appears to be failing. comments: Vacant parcel sits just to the east of the house on M-26th at 7th Street in Trimountain. Level, open land, a couple feet below the road grade.

title: Fallin' Down Shack Outside Of Wakefield
comments: This one is dozer bait. The value here is in the land. The house was built on wood pier footings, which have given way. Now the house has more waves in it than Lake Superior in a November storm. The shifting has caused stress .. which caused roof leaks ... which means rotten structural elements. Add that all together and it would make a great bonfire ! The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. Buildings which are dangerous, occupied, boarded, condemned, or otherwise difficult to enter are inspected from the exterior/curbside only. title: Large Family-Size 2 Story Home With Detached Garage In Wakefield
comments: Large, 2 story home in Wakefield, appears to have had an exterior upgrade probably about 1970-80 with aluminum siding and Anderson-type crankout windows. Has has insulation blown into the walls as evidenced by the plugs in the siding. Inside, it is a work in progress and not quite finished. Has natural gas hot water (boiler) heat and a newer electric service. This one could be put back into productive use without a lot of work. That being said, this is built on a wood pier footing system, which have a bad habit of going bad eventually. 4 bedrooms plus a walk-thru room at the top of the spiral stairway as a 5th/childs room. 2 baths. No basement ... crawlspace only.

title: Cute, Efficient Home In Wakefield
comments: This is a small, mid-century one story home with attached one cara garage. Aluminum siding assures low maintenance. Has an older roof that has a few noticeable patch spots, but it does not appear to be a leaker at this time. Has a small amount (an inch or so) of standing water in the basement because the sump pump is off (no power). Newer natural gas forced air furnace. Inside this one is in very good overall condition other than a small ceiling spot from the roof leak in the valley above the garage. This one will probably need a roof sooner rather than later, but its worth the investment.

title: Vacant Parcel On Birch Street, Ironwood
comments: Vacant double lot in the Norrie Addition to Ironwood. Hilltop setting that rolls steeply to the south on the other side. Dense brush here. May not lend itself to construction due to topography.

title: Updated Home With Overgrown Yard And Bad Decks.
comments: Someone put some time and money into this one, and then walked away from it and let it sit. It has rapidly overgrown, and there is some noticeable settling in the porches (which need replacement) and a noticeable deflection in the wall nearest Birch Street that could be an indicator of deeper structural issues warranting investigation. Home has a decent looking roof that appears mid-life and is vinyl sided. Newer doors and windows. Detached 2 car garage that needs a new overhead door. This home is intact, but ignored. Could likely be put back together with elbow grease. You'll need 2 or 3 40 yard dumpsters, as they pretty much left everything here when they took off.

title: Old Frame House On A Shifting Foundation. Ironwood/norrie
comments: Older frame construction home in the Norrie Addition to the south side of Ironwood. This was built on wood pier footings that have deteriorated, and have begun to shift. Floors are wavy and uneven. Roof is older and on its last legs. Has asphalt shingle siding which sometimes contains asbestos. The mechanical systems here are antiquated. Has 2 abandon vehicles in the driveway. Chuck full of garbage too. This would be a good one to pass on. The foundation of one or more buildings located on this parcel appears to be failing. Correcting foundation issues can be very expensive and issues are often more complex than they initially appear. You should research this issue thoroughly prior to bidding on this parcel. This parcel includes a structure which should be considered DANGEROUS. This building has suffered structural damage which creates substantial risk of harm from falling through damaged areas or collapse from above. It may also contain extensive debris which could fall or collapse, rusty nails, broken glass, and other hazards. You are not permitted to enter this or any other structure offered at tax sale. You should limit your inspection only to what can be safely observed from the building's exterior. Trespassers are subject to prosecution.

title: Older 2 Story Home In Ironwood
comments: We suspect that this one has been vacant for a little bit, bassed on the overgrown condition of the yard. Older roof is mid life and does not leak, but it probably is in its last decade of service. Wood shingle siding and original windows in most places. Home is generally in original condition and worn. Could use a refreshing, but it's essentially straight and square from what we can see. Three bedrooms, with original kitchen and bath.

title: Wetlands Parcel. 4.3 Acres. Ironwood.
comments: Parcel fronts about 300 feet on the south side of Brogan Street, and runs about 635' south. It is a ravine/wetlands parcel. Could be recreational or a wetlands mitigation trade property. Roughly 4.3 acres in size. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress. This parcel has surface water, soil, or vegetation conditions indicating that it may include wetland habitat. Such habitat may comprise all or part of the parcel's area. However, it is possible that this parcel contains buildable areas as well. There are many environmental and building regulations related to wetlands which you should consult before bidding on this parcel. It is your responsibility to determine if this parcel is suitable for your desired use.

title: Double Lots, Double Streets! Ironwood
comments: Two adjacent lots in Ironwood that front on both Pine Street on the south, and Houk Street on the north. Rolling, mostly open lands.

title: Modest One Story Home On Rowe Street, Ironwood.
comments: This is a small, efficient, one story home in Ironwood. It has seen upgrading including a newer roof, vinyl siding, and vinyl clad windows. 2 bedrooms and one bath, seems to be an upgrade-in-progress that was not completed. Some missing fixtures and unfinished drywall. Older roof that is mid-life and does not appear to be a leaker.

title: 1.5 Story Home In Ironwood
comments: Older 1.5 story frame construction home that has seen some upgrades, Vinyl siding (needs some repair) and a roof that is screaming "replace me". The electrical service is deteriorated and should be upgraded. There is a shed to the rear that is in pretty rough shape. Could be saved, but will need some attention and fresh lumber. 2 bedrooms one-and-a-half bath. Full basement. Kitchen and bath are original equipment. Older mechanicals. Home is in generally solid condition, but plain. Sale 2235, which is the vacant lot to the east, is also included in this package.

title: Large Commercial Storefront In Downtown Ironwood
comments: This masonry block building would make a spectaular flea market or antique store property. Large, wide open space with a solid floor and good ceiling height. The building has been "harvested" of all of its wiring by a previous owner, so you'll have to deal with that. And there is daylight at the ridge cap in the otherwise solid roof that needs to be tightened up. There is a partial basement that is not really useful for much other than storage. Walk in coolers at the rear that could be repurposed as well. The back wall of the building warrants a little bit of review as well, as there are some openings into ceiling cavity that should be enclosed with a proper fascia board. If you're looking for wide open space, this is it. This parcel appears to have been subject to harvesting of electrical, plumbing, mechanical systems, or other building components. Buildings are sometimes targeted by criminals that steal or "harvest" items such as copper plumbing, wiring, furnaces, water heaters, fixtures, hardwood flooring, etc. This building should be considered incomplete due to such harvesting and may require substantial investment to reequip.

title: Mid-Century Rancher In Ironwood
comments: This is a post war tract housing ranch style home that has been a little beat up. There is visible damage to the foundation at the front corner of the house next to the driveway where it may have been struck by a vehicle (?). But there is no evidence of this transmitting to the basement. The home is grubby but solid. Has wood floors. Natural gas forced air heat and central AC. Original kitchen and bath. 3 bedrooms. A lot of castoffs have been left behind for you to toss, including a garage tthat is stuffed full. Inoperable car in driveway with no rear window, and a boat in the back yard that has probably sailed its last voyage. This one has potential, but will need to be emptied, and then scrubbed well. There are a couple of broken windows in a bedroom.

title: Large 2 Story Duplex In Ironwood Across The Street From Longyear Park.
comments: The is an older quality built duplex (not a butcher-job conversion) home that had a 1960's remodel, enclosing the porch and adding shingle siding and a detached 2 car garage. We're guessing the roof may be that vintage as well, as it appears tired and missing a few teeth. The shrubbery surrounding the buildings has overgrown, so we suspect it has been a few years since this one was last inhabited. The roof is bad and needs immediate work over the front porch. The two apartment units are both *very* merchantable. The lower was owner occupied and will need to be cleaned out, but the upper unit does not look like its been lived in for a long time. The roof does not appear to leak, "yet" ... but it's not far away. Garage roof is also getting iffy. Power here is old 60A service, but seperately metered. Heat and hot water are also split and gas metered individually. This one has some potential ... just needs some love. The building on this property appears to have been used for multi-family occupancy in the past based upon indicators such as multiple mailboxes, entrances, numbering, layout, or other such factors. Modifications to the property may NOT have been legally made and may NOT conform to local zoning. Prospective bidders should verify with local officials that multi-family use is permitted under existing zoning. In many areas, once a multi-family use has been discontinued, it cannot be reinstated unless in conformance with local zoning and code.

title: Brick Commercial Building On Br Us 2 In Ironwood!
comments: This property has been last used as a sporting goods and bait store. Located on Business route US 2, just north of downtown Ironwood. Building is brick with a low pitched roof. Has no offstreet parking out front, but there is onstreet parking (both sides) here on Douglas Boulevard (BR US2). Building appears to be in pretty merchantable condition. The original storefront display windows have been downsized. 2300 square feet in size, new rubber roof over retail area, new furnace, new floor, new kitchen area and new bathroom (vanity removed). Rear portion of the building has a two stall garage with an access easement from Michigan Ave. Garage portion of building has collapsed from snow load, and needs some repairs and renovations. It has solid walls ... just no roof ! Full basement.

title: 1.5 Story On Ironwoods North Side
comments: Small, efficient one story home on Ironwoods north side. Wood siding, fascia, soffit and windows are in need of a coat of paint, but appear to be solid and easily made presentable. The roof has some patchwork of shingle going on, but it is midlife and looks like it has a few years left on it yet. There has been some joint repair to the blockwork in the foundation, but nothing that screams of an ongoing problem. This one has been a little bit ignored overall, but with some spit and polish should come back to life. They took the liberty of taking the furnace with them when they left, so you'll need to replace that. Second floor is unfinished, and awaits your finishing. Original kitchen and bath. Older wiring. 2BR 1BA. Has a little garbage to get rid of ...

title: Family Home In Yale, South Of Bessemer
comments: Large, 2 story modernized home in Yale location, a few miles south of Bessemer. Newer doors, windows and vinyl siding here.Some of the vinyl siding has drifted away in the breeze and will need replacement. Roof is older and probably nearing the end of its useful life, but not a leaker. Inside, the house is incomplete. It has been stripped to the studs and insulated/wired on the main floor. Older upgraded kitchen with a new laminate floor. Second floor is an intact older upgrade, with a bath that has been stripped for a rehab that was not completed, tho some of the parts are here to do the work. 3 bedrooms. 1.5 bath. Has a small older outbuilding. Newer mechanicals and electric service underway here. Comes with an extra lot to keep your mower in shape. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed.

title: Mobile And Extra Lot In The Yale Location
comments: We suspect that this is an older mobile that has been gift wrapped in vinyl siding. We notice some deflection in the front wall, infering either structural issues or possibly just a "quickie" job with the siding. We did not have the opportunity to view the interior of the unit. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. Buildings which are dangerous, occupied, boarded, condemned, or otherwise difficult to enter are inspected from the exterior/curbside only. title: Vacant Parcel On Clayberg Street In Bessemer
comments: Parcel is roughly 50 x 140 in size. Right in Bessemer and ready for your new home. Municipal utilities and natural gas here. Well maintained neighborhood.

title: Tall Block 2.5 Story Home In Bessemer With Very Bad Roof.
comments: Tall (2.5 story !), narrow concrete block home in Bessemer. This one has been left to sit and rot, and it now has large holes in the roof which have led to advanced decay of everything below it. This was probably a sharp home in its day, but that ship sailed a while ago. The front porch columns have been replaced with ill fitting 4x4 posts (themselves in disrepair). The inside has become a haven for pigeons, and we scared up a bunch of them when we opened the door. Inside, the floors have all warped up from the bad roof. It has the original staircases, but most of the wood trim was removed during a 70-ish "updating". The foundation is buckling inside the basement. This one is past it's ninth life already ... One or more buildings on this parcel has a roof which is either leaking to the interior or appears close to failure. Failing roofs often indicate substantial structural decay inside the building. You should investigate the integrity of this structure(s) prior to bidding. The foundation of one or more buildings located on this parcel appears to be failing. Correcting foundation issues can be very expensive and issues are often more complex than they initially appear. You should research this issue thoroughly prior to bidding on this parcel. title: "better Than It Appears From The Outside" Mobile And Detached 2 Car Garage. Watersmeet
comments: Older roofover mobile home in Watersmeet. Has been reroofed and resided, but needs cosmetic guidance. The skirting is in disarray, and it looks like the plumbing has been pulled apart in places inferring freeze damage. Inside, this one is a real fooler. From the outside you could easily discount it as another cruddy old mobile. But it actually has been nicely upgraded inside and is probably functional with just a little work. Most of the effort here will be restoring the mechanicals, and making the exterior more appealing. The garage is much more substantial, being built out of 6x6 timber. It has an overhead door that needs to be properly trimmed out, but it appears to have potential for rehabilitation and continued use. Overall, this one is not real pretty, but it has much potential.

title: Old Storefront Property In Marenisco
comments: This is an old frame structure that once served as a retail building on the main drag in Marenisco. More recently it has been used as a residence, but it has been vacant for the better part of 10 years, with decay and mold issues. This was built on a wood pier footing system which has decayed, and the groundwater is finding its way into floor joists and flooring, causing them to rot All of the mechanical systems inside this one are either missing or bad, and the power company has dropped the service ... which is usually a sign of condemnation. The floors are springy and bad from front-to-back.

title: Lot In Mountain View Plat Near Powderhorn
comments: Lot is irregular in shape. Fronts diagonally 158' along CR 513 on the north. West line is 163', east line 72, south line 130'. Secondary frontage on Summit View Drive along the east lot line.

title: Homesite At Powderhorn!
comments: Nicely wooded homesite near Powderhorn Ski Resort. Subject to deed restrictions and POA fees. Lot is shaped like a slice of pie, with 157' along the curve on the road, and running 200' to the rear on each side to a point.

title: Vacant Building Parcel At Alpine Village North Near Powderhorn!
comments: Nicely wooded parcel in the Big Powderhorn area. Natural gas is available here. Subject to deed restrictions and POA fees. Lot is 100' at the road and 130' deep. This plat has many homes in it that are in the Big Powderhorn Lodging Association rental program, so there is an income potential with property here as well.

title: Townhouse Unit Near Ironwood.
comments: This is a townhouse unit in a row house design building a little north of Ironwood. We believe it has use of a detached single car garage unit. Unit is dated, but very liveable. A lot of character here ! This is a 2 bedroom unit, but only one has been finished to date. Has a full basement that is unfinished, full height. Roof is mid-life and has no visible leaks. Antiquated electrical you may want to consider upgrading. There is natural gas available at the road here, but this unit is still running on fuel oil. City water and sewer. This one could be a charmer with the right persons touch.

title: 5 Adjacent Lots In The Newport Heights Plat.
comments: Lots 10-16 in the Newport Heights plat, all rolled into one sale. These lots are 295 x 130 in total, and sit 150 feet south of Newport Street where the road ends. There is a two track that runs back into this area ... then left ... and back about 100 feet ... the property is to your left at that point. This is really pretty, wooded land. Looks like a great morel mushroom hunting spot. The roads which are shown on plat or tax maps for this parcel do not appear to exist or may be located in a different location than shown on such maps. While a legal right to build such roads may remain, this construction would likely be very expensive. title: Vacant Parcel On Bluffwood Drive
comments: One square acre, 208x208, on Bluffwood near where it meets Section 12 Road, NW corner of the intersection. Level, wooded lands on a paved county maintained road. Well maintained homes in this area.

comments: Vacant triple lot at Ramsay. The road to this parcel is unimproved. title: Small, Efficient Home In The Anvil Location
comments: Cedar shake sided one story home that sits just below road grade at the Anvil Location near Ramsay. Older roof, but not a leaker at this time. A few newer windows. Has a detached two car garage with a hodgepodge of vinyl siding is nearby. Lot runs downhill to the rear. This is a cute, solid 3BR/2BA house that is larger than it appears from the street. Electric has been upgraded, furnace is older. Generally a solid, cute house.

comments: A single lot in the plat of Ramsay. No improved road to this parcel. title: Nice Building Site In Scenic Three Lakes.
comments: Parcel is located on US41/M-28 at Three Lakes ... between Marquette and Baraga. we suspect there has been a campspot use of this parcel in the past, as there has been a power service here. We did not see a well here. The parcel is a little over 1/2 acre. Fronts 145' on the road and runs 156' or so deep. It is just a rocks toss several nearby lakes (Three to be exact). Give this one a look if you're after an RV or campspot in the area. It should have been called "1000 Lakes" because there are more than a DOZEN lakes in close proximity to this parcel.

title: Multi-Family Housing Unit In L'anse!
comments: This is a 3 or maybe 4 unit rental unit in L'Anse. It is well used and will need some rehab. The roof is older and there are signs of distress in facia and soffits. The siding is hardboard and is warping and deteriorating in the couple of feet nearest the ground. The attached garage and porches show sway and buckling in the walls, and should be removed, repaired or replaced. At the time of our visit, people were still in the process of moving, and we saw kitties and peoples cars here, so we did not enter the building for interior inspection. This one has some potential, but you'd certainly have better luck renting and higher rents for your ROI if you put a few bucks into it in upgrades. The roof is quite old, and if isn't leaking yet, tick ... tock. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. title: Occupied Mobile Near Baraga.
comments: This is a mobile home on a single lot in the St Anns Catholic Church neighborhood, just off M-38 (Michigan Avenue). The mobile was still partly furnished and had a dog inside, so we ddid not have the opportunity to view the interior during our visit in early June. It appears to be in generally merchantable condition, and there is natural gas here. Mobile homes (and some modular homes) can be separately titled and considered personal property. title: Bulldozer Bait In Michigamme
comments: This is a corner lot near Michigamme, and fronts 80 feet on Nelson Street, running thence 108 feet to the northeast. The house here is a goner. Dozer bait. A mess. Beeyond economic sanity to try to restore due to extensive rot from a bad roof and generally being wide open to the elements for a long, long time. We're not even going to categorize this one as a home ... just as a vacant lot. This parcel includes a structure which should be considered DANGEROUS. This building has suffered structural damage which creates substantial risk of harm from falling through damaged areas or collapse from above. It may also contain extensive debris which could fall or collapse, rusty nails, broken glass, and other hazards. You are not permitted to enter this or any other structure offered at tax sale. title: Old Timer In Covington
comments: This is a 1.5 story wood frame home in Covington that is built on the often-seen wood pier footing system. Over time, these pilings deteriorate, and the whole home begins to settle. On this one, there have been some efforts made to stabilize the situation, but it's likely to continue. We're guessing that this one has been vacant for a little bit. It has peeling paint, some siding in need of attention, and the roof will need replacement sooner rather than later, as we saw some missing and displaced shingle. Inside, the house has been "modernized", circa 1980, with dropped ceilings, paneling and even z-brick ! The floors and ceilings sway, and there is a hole in the kitchen floor ... tho we're not sure what it's from. The upper floor is unfinished, and several of the windows have been covered over presumably to save heat. It appears that the building was last used perhaps about 2002. This one has some potential and is general preservable ... but will need some attention. The mechanical's are all ancient, and it appears they used the wood stove in the kitchen for cooking ...

title: 40 Acres Of Recreational Property In Baraga Township!
comments: This property is on the Hanka Road, about a mile past the turnoff for the Hanka homestead location. The road becomes a real axle buster in here, and is deeply rutted and muddy after a rain. There is no power out here from what we could determine after the Hanka site. The property sit 1320 feet east off the road, and if there were roads in, we couldn't find them. Topographical maps indicate that all but the NW corner of the lands are marshland, and that the NW corner, while being a bit dryer, slopes downward a distance of almost 30 feet in just a couple hundred feet. The uplands here seem to have a healthy sampling of maple, but we did not get back into the parcel to see if that is accurate there, or to what degree it may have been timbered in the past. We're thinking that the amount of uplands on this property does not exceed 5 acres. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding.

title: 50X132 Parcel Northeast Of The Finns Bar .... Arvon Township
comments: These 2 lots sit just off Skanee Road, and due east-northeast of the Finns Bar. It is difficult to be certain of exactly where they are without a survey, but we believe them to be across the road from the bar, and just southeast of the metal storage building there. Would make great extra parking for the Finns (hint, hint)

title: Mobile And 2 Car Garage On 2 Acres. Arvon Township.
comments: Older mobile home is situated on a 330x264 lot on Sawmill Road. There is an oversized, 30x30 frame construction, 2 car garage with a 10x10 overhead door for the car and a 12x12 one for your boat. Also a shed for your wifes stuff. The mobile has a couple of roof leaks developing, but not too late to get right on them and salvage it. Otherwise, it is a pretty standard mobile home. This parcel is about 1.1 miles off the Skanee Road. A nice, quiet place.

title: 40 Acres In Arvon Township!
comments: This is a square 40 in Arvon Township off Black Creek Road. This parcel is fairly remote and does not front on any improved public road. There are some lumbering roads and other two tracks in the vicinoty, but none that are maintained by the county. There is no power here. title: Vacant Lot In Ausable Ridge Subdivision
comments: Vacant lot, mostly wooded in quiet neighborhood. Great building site. No neighboring homes.

title: Vacant Lot In Ausable Ridge
comments: Vacant lot, mostly wooded in quiet neighborhood. Great building site. No neighboring homes.

title: Charming Home In The City Of Grayling
comments: 3 bedrooms and 2 bath (one located in basement) home in the City of Grayling located just steps away from the River. Updated electrical and newer roof on home. Close to local canoe livery, resturants and local shops. Well Kept neighboring homes. Approx. lot size 60x120

title: Vacant Lot Located Outside Of Roscommon

Large wrap around covered deck with stone (firewood) built in grill is the perfect spot for summer gatherings. Personal property will not be inlcluded in sale. title: Midcentury Cottage In Barton City
comments: One story home with attached shop type room is located in Barton City at the 330 foot mark in the municipal ballparks left field. You can probably sit right there in a chair and catch homers on the 4th of July weekend. The home is modern and efficient. Has hot water heat and slab on grade floors. The roof on the rear addition/shop appears to maybe have been hit by a falling tree (?) and will need repair to the soffit. The TV tower needs to be out back up ... or taken down. There is a strange deflection to the kitchen floor along the north wall, but we could ffind to significant structural reason for it upon inspection of the cellar and exterior. Wood burning fireplace with a nice insert. Some knotty pine. This one could make a great family retreat in a quiet resort town "up north".

title: Cute, Cute, Cute! Vertical Log Cabin Just Steps From Hubbard Lake!
comments: This is a first generation log cabin that is less than 200 feet from the South end of Hubbard Lake. The lot is 40 feet wide. Based on the fact that nearly everyone here has a boat *and* a portable dock in their yard, we assume the waterfront across the street is first come first serve. The plat indicatyes that it for the use of the lot owners. But you may wish to confirm that. We cannot be certain of the condition of the well or septic system, but we are confident that the roof is shot. This one has suffered neglect for some time. However all that being said, it is in remarkably better ccondition than many of its age we have seen. The interior is knotty pine and appears to generally be salvagable. There is some evidence of critters being in the attic and making their way through the ceiling, but this too, is recoverable. Curiously, the turlet is on the front porch, so we assume the septic (what there is of it) is to the left, and the well is in the pit to the right. In the right hands, this could be a charmer. In other hands, it would be a great place for a garage or addition for a neighbor. NOTE: The structure on this property has had a condemnation order placed on it since 2011. There is a history of litigation with the former owner involving the dangerous building status of this structure. The township may require the purchaser to demolish or bring the structure up to code after purchase at the cost of the buyer. Please be advised. title: 33' Wide X 200' Deep Strip Of Land.
comments: Parcel is 33' wide and runs from road, then east 200 feet. A great location for lawn bowling. Likely too small for any purpose other than lawn bowling or maybe a garden. This parcel is what we refer to as a 33'/66'. We frequently see foreclosed parcels that are either 33 or 66 feet wide. These parcels are often a result of existing or former road rights of way. A common road right of way is 66 feet wide. Half of that is 33 feet. There are two common scenarios that we see. Scenario 1: A land owner splits a tract of land and creates a common easement parcel for access. They might then quit paying taxes on the parcel with road frontage knowing that the easement would remain even after foreclosure. Such easements are generally either 33 or 66 feet wide. Scenario 2: Rural land generally runs to the center of any public road on which it fronts whereas subdivided land usually runs to the edge of the road right-of-way. Sometimes during surveys or other splits, half of the right-of-way (usually 33 feet) can become orphaned, effectively turning to no-man's-land. Potential bidders should be aware that 33 and 66 foot wide parcels are very likely to include easements. That means that there are people who have a right to use the property even though they do not own the land. It is unlawful to cut off access over a 33 or 66 foot parcel where an easement already exists. Even if an easement doesn't already exists, courts will frequently create such an easement to prevent a neighboring parcel from becoming landlocked. Potential bidders should consider that this parcel likely has little value and cannot be used to landlock a neighboring parcel when there is no other path for ingress and egress. This parcel is too small to be practically useful under most circumstances. Many times such parcels are the result of survey or property transfer errors which create small orphaned slivers of land. These parcels are frequently too small to allow construction or any other practical use. They often have no road frontage or legal means of access. These parcels can often lead to adverse claims or encroachments by neighboring land owners which can be complicated legal issues to resolve. Please investigate this parcel thoroughly prior to bidding.

The interior features cedar walls and ceiling. Central air. Skylights. A light and bright home, with views of the lake from the living room and expansive deck. The power that runs the sump pump in the basement is off, and this has caused some water to collect in the basement level, which is unfinished. Unless properly managed, this can cause molding. We are also told that the former owner complained of mold issues, so there may need to be some remediation and preventative planning done to manage this when the home is "closed up" for extended periods. The roof has some buildup of moss which should be promptly addressed. Someone (for whatever reason) discharged several fire extinguishers around the outside of this home before they left ... we are unsure why. There is a detached, one car garage here that could easily double as a studio or workshop. The property is nicely landscaped, and partly furnished. We remind viewers that personal property is not sold as part of the offering and still belongs to the former owner of the property. The well for this home is in a pit in the detached garage, and appears serviceable. A beautiful little hideaway in the woods near the lake. title: Vacant Lot In Scotts Subdivision Near Hubbard Lake
comments: Small lot fronts on Maple Street, just steps from Hubbard Lake. Could be a great spot for that northern getaway or campspot if permitted by zoning. This is a tidy resort area with many well maintained mid-century and newer second homes. We are told that this lot has shared access to Hubbard Lake. You will want to verify that if it is important to you.

title: Modernized Two Story Home In Alanson!
comments: This is an older two story home in Alanson that has been modernized. It has vinyl siding and newer windows and doors. The inside has some wear and tear and will need upgrading to surfaces. There is a partially finished basement, detached one car garage/workshop and playhouse out back. The kitchen and bath are dated, but functional. The house will need a new roof sooner rather than later. It is old and decaying shingle ... with some found on the ground. An effort has been made to patch it up, but it's really just time for a new one.

title: Vacant Lot In Alanson!
comments: Vacant double corner lot, at Terrace and Grove Street in Alanson. Level, open and sandy soils.

title: Beautiful Homesite At Birchwood Farms Gcc Near Harbor Springs
comments: This season, we are offering 3 different homesite in the Birchwood Golf and Country Club development west of Harbor Springs. This is, simply put, a BEAUTIFUL development, The roads and woods here look like someone vacuums them daily. This place is spotless and on point, and the homes here are manicured. This is a fairly exclusive residential community, and there MAY BE some substantial FEES that are mandatory for membership in the POA in addition to the deed restrictions and other covenants that attach here. These are not lots to be purchased for speculation unless you have short term plans to construct a home here. The "buy in" and annual membership fees here can runs well into the thousands of dollars, and they're quite intent on collecting them. We strongly suggest that prospective purchasers do their due diligence on these potential costs and restrictions prior to purchase. Please see the legal description for the identification of the specific lot being sold. This parcel is likely subject to ASSOCIATION FEES which are assessed to cover maintenance and other costs associated with the development in which the parcel is located. Interested parties should verify the existence and extent of association fees and costs prior to bidding.

title: Tidy Occupied Mobile Home Near Alanson And Harbor Springs
comments: This is a tidy litle mobile home between Harbor Springs and Alanson. IT IS OCCUPIED and we expect this one will be litigated prior to the auction. Please maintain a distance if you decide to look at this property, as the former owners will not be welcome to approach. This property is occupied. Please respect the privacy of current occupants and limit any inspection to what can be safely observed from the road. Some occupants may be upset or angry and may meet contact with aggression or violence. Please use discretion and caution when researching this or other occupied properties. Furthermore, although this property has been foreclosed for unpaid taxes, occupants have certain rights under Michigan law and must be formally evicted if unwilling to leave voluntarily. You may wish to consult a licensed attorney for more information. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. Buildings which are dangerous, occupied, boarded, condemned, or otherwise difficult to enter are inspected from the exterior/curbside only. You are NOT authorized to enter these or any other buildings offered for sale. You should limit your inspection to that which can be made safely from the building's exterior. The foreclosure of this property may be subject to legal challenge by the former owner or another party of interest. Therefore, this parcel may be withheld from the sale if a legal action is commenced prior to the auction. The status of any such legal action, to the extent known, will be disclosed if the property is auctioned as planned. Bidders are advised that the cost of defending legal title after the auction is wholly the responsibility of the purchaser. Please conduct your own research and investigate any potential legal issues prior to bidding.

title: Vacant 1/2 Acre Parcel Near Boyne Highlands, Nubs Nob And Harbor Springs!
comments: This is unplatted, metes and bounds described land in the Harbor Springs area. You can see the slopes of Boyne Highlands right out your back door! As far as we can ascertain, this is not a part of the developments in the area that are deed restricted or belong to a POA, but you may wish to verify that with an examination of local records. Nicely wooded, level lands in a great year-round resort area !

title: Tidy Little House In Levering
comments: Small home in Levering, located directly behind the old "Mr Carps" restaurant, known more recently as the "new" Pioneer Bar. Has a newer roof and vinyl siding, but the side porch off the living room is literally "gone". Inside, this seems like a pretty solid little place that mostly needs a good thorough cleaning and decor refresh. It has been occupied until recently, so there should not be any issues with frozen plumbing. Has a full, unfinished, walkout basement that fronts on the street out front. Sits on a spacious lot, however it comes with a "collection" that will require some cleanup. Bring your scrub brush and CLEAN UP on this one !

title: Vacant Building Site In Misty Acres Site Condo Near Alanson.
comments: Misty Acres is a small site condo (subdivision condomunium) between Indian River and Alanson, south of M-68. In this form of ownership, the condomunium association could control some elements of maintenance and control (roads and such) and the unit owner has other rights and responsibilities. These are laid out in the Master Plan documents which should be obtained from the Register of Deeds in Petoskey and understood prior to bidding. We are told that the developer of this project failed, and that there is no active association or fees. You may wish to verify that information if interested. In this site condo, there are 8 lots. 2 have homes on them and have been previously sold. We are selling the 6 remaining vacant lots. There are horses here, behind unit 8. No horses included in the sale. Sorry. This sale is for one unit only. See the legal description for identification. This parcel is part of a site condominium development. A condominium "unit" is a form of land ownership which is similar to a traditional subdivision "lot" but is also different in some important respects. Each condominium development is laid out in a document called the master deed which outlines the extent and nature of each condominium unit. The master deed also contains rules and restrictions related to construction and permitted use. Construction requirements can include everything from the size or design of buildings to color and orientation on the site. Condominium developments also include "common elements" like streets and sidewalks which are shared across all units. Some developments include amenities like golf courses, clubhouses, beaches, pools, and parks whereas others include only basic infrastructure like roads and sidewalks. Site condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Prospective bidders should carefully review and understand the master deed and investigate association fees prior to bidding.

title: Vacant Site Condo Lot At Eagle Beach Near Alanson
comments: Eagle Beach was a proposed golf community just east of Alanson and north off M-68. The residential development was established, but the golf course never materialized. The lots here are interspersed through the proposed course, and have paved roads and the ultities are in. We are offering three lots here, and they have views of Pickerel Lake to the southwest. Be aware that this is a site condo unit and not a "subdivision lot". You should obtain a copy of the Master Deed and understand how it works prior to bidding. These are actually very nice lots. Level, dry and open. Many of the units in this development have begun to see new construction in the recent years. Sale 2108 is the adjacent lot. This parcel is part of a site condominium development.
