title: Corner Lot In Cross Village
comments: Parcel is adjacent to sales 2104 and 2105. Together they form a "C" shape. This is a brushy corner lot of irregular dimension at Wadsworth and Oak, east corner of the intersection.

title: Vacant Parcel In Cross Village
comments: Parcel is wooded in younger growth, and is adjacent to sale parcels 2104 and 2106. 82.5 along the road by 123 deep.

title: Vacant Triangular Parcel In Cross Village
comments: Parcel is irregular in shape, and fronts on Oak Drive in Cross Village. Wooded mostly in small maple. Sales 2105 and 2106 are adjacent.

title: Vacant 2.59 Acre Parcel, Located Just West Of Levering
comments: This parcel is 2.59 acres, and fronts 200 feet on the east side of Pleasantview Road, which is a county maintained, paved road. It runs 600+ feet deep ad has secondary frontage on a private road. Open, level, dry lands very suitable for a home, in a quiet rural area. This is a nice, large, clean country lot.

title: Prime Commercial Location In Downtown East Jordan!
comments: This is a solidly built 5,000 square foot building located on a high traffic .... very visible corridor in downtown East Jordan. 300 feet of frontage on the street with a small showroom and about 1/2 acre of land. The building appears to need a new roof over the one story area (about 500 square feet), but the roof over the two story bay area seems to be good at present. There is a small amount of refuse to get rid of inside including a couple dozen tires. There are two auto bays here with 10x10 overhead doors, and the interior area has floor drains. There are no signs of there having been lifts or oil change pits. The Michigan Environmental mapper suggests that this parcel has two underground storage tanks still in the ground. You may wish to verify this information for yourself on the attached link. We did notice two hooded vent pipes on the front of the building to the right and left sides of the showroom that look an awful lot like a UST vent ... but no other outward signs that there might be tanks still here. So that condition should be verified. Note that while the Enviromapper suggests there may be still be tanks here, it is LISTED as being a contaminated site. The purchaser of this property will need to license or remove the remaining tanks, and a baseline environmental assessment is highly recommended within 45 days of purchase to limit your potential liability if any problems turn up in the future. See more detail at : http://www.deq.state.mi.us/sid-web/Tank_Detail.aspx?mod=ust&mode=CGI&Facility_ID=00007559 This is a substantial, prime piece of East Jordan commercial real estate The building has been an auto parts store and a mechanics garage among other uses in the past. Has newer, substantial electric service. This sale includes two adjacent parcels This parcel may contain buried storage tanks from previous use as a gas station or similar enterprise. Our analysis is based solely on visual inspection of the property surface as further detailed in the lot description. The State of Michigan may require a new owner to remove any remaining tanks and remediate environmental concerns at their sole expense. Additional information may be available from the MDEQ Storage Tank Database. You should conduct careful and thorough research prior to bidding on this parcel. Being sold in combination with sale 1513. Please see that description.

title: Condominium Boat Slip On Lake Charlevoix!
comments: This is a FABULOUS dock-on-minium on Lake Charlevoix at the Northwest Marine Yacht Club. This is right in Charlevoix proper ... just outside the gate of the prestigious Belvedere Club residential summer community. We are offering slip/unit #8, which is located on the front wall nearest the parking lot. You can access Lake Charlevoix AND Lake Michigan from this location. The NWMYC is a full amenity yacht club, with a manned attendant house, shower facility and clubhouse, laundry room, heated pool, and WiFi service. Each dock has power and water. There are restrictions on the use of the slip, as would be expected, and fees that are presently $255 per quarter, which equals $1,020 annually. The yacht club also supports transient and seasonal rental, and this slip, which is a 30' pier, rents for $3,300 per season. More information is available at the yacht club website at www.nwmyc.com For purpose of reference, Slip number 11 ... same size and near the unit we are selling, is listed with a local Realtor for $25,900. This lot is part of a condominium development. A condominium is a form of land ownership which is divided up into individual "units." Owners are required to be part of the applicable condominium association (COA) which includes rules and regulations related to the use and ownership of each unit. Additional restrictions will be spelled out in the development's master deed. Condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Some condominium units delegate things like exterior maintenance and repair to the COA whereas the owner remains responsible for the unit's interior. However, there are many varieties of condominiums including residential and commercial interior space, condo subdivision lots, condo boat slips, condo campsites and others. Prospective bidders should carefully review and understand the master deed, COA rules and regulations, and investigate association fees prior to bidding.

title: Vacant 1/3Rd Acre Parcel On Ottawa Street, Boyne City
comments: Open level dry lands. There may have been a house removed from this parcel in the past. Still an old shed here that we believe is on the lot. City water & sewer.

title: Vacant Wooded Lot In Boyne City.
comments: Parcel sit to the end and right side of Fremont Street. Has a low spot, but it does not appear to be wet. There are municipal utilities and natural gas in this general area, but we're not sure how far away that hookup is. Nice, quiet neighborhood.

title: 1+ Acre Commercial Building And Location On High Traffic M32 Near East Jordan
comments: This is the old East Jordan Co-op propane filling dock on M-32, south east of East Jordan. The building is about 40x50 in size and could be used as a small truck dock or secured storage ... or improved into something that takes even better advantage of its high visibility location.

title: Vacant Building Site On Beaver Island
comments: On the south side of White Cedar Trail, vacant, level and dry. Ready for your camp !

title: Adjacent To 1505 On Beaver Island
comments: This parcel is north of, and adjacent to parcel 1505. About 1/4 acre in size.

title: Parcel On Tamarack Trail, Beaver Island!
comments: IOrregular shaped pacel sits along the curve on Tamarack Trail . About 1/4 acre in size. Sale #1506 is next door ... buy 'em both and have an extra large place for your retreat !!

title: 1/4 Acre Parcel On Beaver Island!
comments: Parcel ios located on the east side of Island Woods Road, a couple feet south iof Whiskey Island Court. Roughly 1/4 acre in size.

title: Parcel On Donegal Bay Road. Beaver Island
comments: Parcel is roughly 1/3 acre, and sits directly across from Font View Road where it intersects with Donegal Bay Road.

title: Beaver Island Parcel. 90X100 In Size. No Improved Road.
comments: Parcel is 90x100, and sits about 400' off East Side Drive in the Martin Point area. There is no improved road to this parcel. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: Small Triangular Parcel In Hudson Township
comments: Parcel fronts on N Camp Ten Road, a few hundred feet north of Heart Lake in Hudson Township. It is about 1/3 of an acre, and sits across the street from the house at 4207 and south of the driveway to 4170 and 4182 N Camp Ten Road. It has roads or driveways on all three sides, and is easy to discern.

title: Vacant Subdivision Lot In Incomplete Site Condo Near Bellaire.
comments: Semrau Estates is a site condo NW of Bellaire. The entrance to this development has been barricaded, and the neighbor down front to the west on the Bellaire Highway made it clear that we were not welcome there ... so we didn't get a good look at this parcel. Because it is a site condo, it will have some restirctions and perhaps even fees that are associated with it. We would suggest getting a copy of the Master Deed for this property development and understanding what the ramifications of its ownership are prior to biddding. This parcel is part of a site condominium development. title: Nice Vacant Corner Building Lot In Mancelona.
comments: This is a vacant site in the newer "Pleasant View #2" subdivision along Mancelonas north boundary. This is a fairly recent plat, and the homes here are newer and feature municipal utilities and natural gas. Paved roads. Nicely wooded in younger evergreens. Great spot for a new home.

title: Nice Vacant Building Site In Mancelona
comments: This is a vacant site in the newer "Pleasant View #2" subdivision along Mancelonas north boundary. This is a fairly recent plat, and the homes here are newer and feature municipal utilities and natural gas. Paved roads. Nicely wooded in younger evergreens. Great spot for a new home.

title: Vacant Corner Lot In Mancelona!
comments: A structure was removed from this parcel, and it is now a vacant building site with municipal utilities ! There is a wonderful, mature Maple tree at the curbside. It has frontage on both E Division and N Maple Street. This parcel is located within a municipality which monitors property maintenance and condition. You may be assessed fees and fines if you fail to mow the grass or do not otherwise properly maintain the property after purchase. One advantage to these parcels is that they typically have infrastructure nearby (water, sewer, power). However, you should confirm the availability of such utilities as well as the connection costs prior to bidding. It is your responsibility to determine whether a parcel is suitable for your desired purpose. Our review of this parcel indicates that the noted State Equalized Value (SEV) does not appear to reflect the current value of the property. This is often due to buildings or other improvements being demolished or fire damaged or other similar items included in the SEV being removed from the property. It can also be due to market changes in the area in which the property is located. It should be further noted that the SEV/assessed value of the parcel as noted in this listing may be several years old. You should consult a local real estate professional or appraiser to help you assess the current market value of this property before bidding and should not base your valuation on the stated SEV.

title: Old House Chock Full Of Treasures. Bad Roof. Mancelona.
comments: We did not enter this one, as it appears to be a little on the risky side of physics. It appears to have been sitting for quite a while, and the deterioration of the exterior infers that the inside is similar in condition. Broken windows, bad roof areas, lots of issues around the perimeter of the foundation. The interior appears to be loaded with waterlogged castoff. This one may possibly be saved, but it probably outweighs economic sense to make that efffort. If there is a redeeming quality here, it is probably the large steel storage building/garage on the rear part of the lot, which fronts on Masonic Lane. Building is roughly 24x36, and we assume it is similarly loaded with goodies. You'll have some friends at the dumpster company by the time you're done here. One or more buildings on this parcel has a roof which is either leaking to the interior or appears close to failure. Failing roofs often indicate substantial structural decay inside the building. You should investigate the integrity of this structure(s) prior to bidding. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. Buildings which are dangerous, occupied, boarded, condemned, or otherwise difficult to enter are inspected from the exterior/curbside only. You are NOT authorized to enter these or any other buildings offered for sale. You should limit your inspection to that which can be made safely from the building's exterior.

title: 60X150 Parcel In Mancelona. Shop Building With Large Skylight.
comments: Parcel fronts 60' on South Maple Street, and runs 150' deep to the west. Has an old, caved in, 2 car garage size shop building. Could be scrapped, repaired or repurposed. Let your imagination be your guide. There is muncipal water, natural gas and power/phone at this location at Mancelonas southern edge. This parcel includes a structure which should be considered DANGEROUS. This building has suffered structural damage which creates substantial risk of harm from falling through damaged areas or collapse from above. It may also contain extensive debris which could fall or collapse, rusty nails, broken glass, and other hazards. You are not permitted to enter this or any other structure offered at tax sale. You should limit your inspection only to what can be safely observed from the building's exterior. Trespassers are subject to prosecution.

title: 2 Parcels ... 48 Acres! Home And Pole Barn!
comments: This property was OCCUPIED at our last visit in late May. There are two parcels here that total 48 acres, including a "front 20" and a "back 28", which has no road frontage. We are selling them together for purposes of access to the rear property. The property has been listed at $129,900 in the recent past. We did not have the opportunity to view the property in detail because it is occupied, but it is a newer modular housing and a 24x36 pole barn of similar age with a dirt floor that could house livestock. The house is 3 bedrooms and 2 baths, and has cathedral ceilings. While we cannot repost them, we located several webssites that had interior photos of this property. Try an online search for "1464 N US 131" and you'll probably find them too. This will be a popular property with outdoors entheusiasts. You can head right out yoyur back door and enjoy northern Michigan recreation and sports opportunities limited only by your imagination. Bring your checkbook folks, because this one will be popular ! This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property. This property is occupied. Please respect the privacy of current occupants and limit any inspection to what can be safely observed from the road. Some occupants may be upset or angry and may meet contact with aggression or violence. Please use discretion and caution when researching this or other occupied properties. Furthermore, although this property has been foreclosed for unpaid taxes, occupants have certain rights under Michigan law and must be formally evicted if unwilling to leave voluntarily. You may wish to consult a licensed attorney for more information. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. Buildings which are dangerous, occupied, boarded, condemned, or otherwise difficult to enter are inspected from the exterior/curbside only. You are NOT authorized to enter these or any other buildings offered for sale. You should limit your inspection to that which can be made safely from the building's exterior. This 28 acre parcel has been combined with sale 548. Please see that listing for information.

title: Triangular Parcel ... Unbuildable ... Milton Township
comments: This is a teenty-tiny sliver of land, about 100 feet long east-to-west, at thew SW corner of the intersection of Cherry Avenue and Eagles Way Lane. It is 36 feet wide at its widest (west) end, and narrows to nothing at the intersection. It's an election year ... maybe you can put a sign on it. Other than that ... This parcel is too small to be practically useful under most circumstances. Many times such parcels are the result of survey or property transfer errors which create small orphaned slivers of land. These parcels are frequently too small to allow construction or any other practical use. They often have no road frontage or legal means of access. These parcels can often lead to adverse claims or encroachments by neighboring land owners which can be complicated legal issues to resolve. Please investigate this parcel thoroughly prior to bidding.

title: Roofover Mobile And Garage In Lakes Of The North Near Mancelona
comments: We are selling 3 lots (sale #357, 358 and 359) as a unit. These lots contain an older roofover mobile home with stick built addition, as well as a detached two car garage. This property is still under the control, use and occupancy of the former owners until July 15th. It appears to be in overall good condition, and was occupied through the winter which means there is probably not any frozen plumbing situation ... but that's not guaranteed. The structures here are in serviceable condition, but will need some scrubbing and minor repair. The last occupants here were renters, and they didn't do much in the way of taking all of their castoffs with them when they left. This is located in Lakes of the North, which is a development that is under the auspices of the Lakes of the North Property Owners Association. We have linked to their website, and you will want to refer to that information for details in fees, POA amenities and restrictions. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property. This parcel is likely subject to ASSOCIATION FEES which are assessed to cover maintenance and other costs associated with the development in which the parcel is located. title: Vacant Lot On Otis Drive, Just Outside Of Mancelona.
comments: Building site just south of Mancelona and north of Elder Road on Otis Drive. A trailer has been removed from this site, and it still contains a natural gas service in the center of the lot. There is municipal water here, so you can save on the cost of having to drill a new well too !

title: Narrow Strip Of Land On Elder Road
comments: Parcel lies between and 684 and 686 E Elder Road. Probably only of use to the two neighbors, unless you're into lawn bowling. This parcel is 1/2 of a lot and too small to build on. This parcel is too small to be practically useful under most circumstances. Many times such parcels are the result of survey or property transfer errors which create small orphaned slivers of land. These parcels are frequently too small to allow construction or any other practical use. They often have no road frontage or legal means of access. These parcels can often lead to adverse claims or encroachments by neighboring land owners which can be complicated legal issues to resolve. Please investigate this parcel thoroughly prior to bidding.

title: Homesite In The Lake Of The North Development!
comments: Lake of the North is an expansive development of residential resort homes in eastern Antrim County, not far from Gaylord and Grayling. There are hundreds of home sites here, interspersed between 20 different subdivisions. Amenities include restaurants, a private landing strip, campground, horse stables, golf course, winter sports area and a clubhouse with pool. Parcels here are subject to restrictive deed covenants and HOA membership fees. We did not find the annual fee amount listed on the HOA website (see link) but we believe them to be around $350 per year for the first parcel with a discount for adjacent lots. You may wish to check that with the HOA office if it is a critical detail for you. This parcel is likely subject to ASSOCIATION FEES which are assessed to cover maintenance and other costs associated with the development in which the parcel is located. Interested parties should verify the existence and extent of association fees and costs prior to bidding.

title: 10 Acres With A Pole Barn In Mancelona Township!
comments: This is a "long 10", known as "Parcel 22" in the survey of this acreage division on record at the Register of Deeds in Bellaire. The land rolls steeply toward the rear past the barn, with the front 300' or so being fairly open. There is a 24x36 Morton brand building. The building has a dirt floor, but could be upgraded to a concrete slab without too much work. There is a bit of debris inside the building, including a vehicle which we have no title for. Remember that personal property is not included in the sale. This is a decent building, that could be finished up nicely. Indian Trail Road is a seasonal road, and not maintained year round by the county in this area. This parcel is accessible by a road that is believed to be a seasonal or non-maintained public road. While we make no representations or warranties as to the precise nature of such road access, our research suggests that this road is either 1) Not regularly graded; and/or 2) Not snow plowed in winters; and/or 3) Appears subject to fallen trees or other events which have not been addressed by the county road commission. You should conduct your own research into this issue prior to bidding.

title: 12+ Acres. Contaminated Lagoon Parcel On Darragh Road. Mancelona
comments: 12+ acre parcel sits to the rear/west of 9746 Darragh Road, which we sold a couple of years ago. It has road frontage on Darragh Road, but there is no improved driveway into the parcel from that road. It is listed in records as a "lagoon parcel" and topographical maps describe the west half of the parcel as an "Industrial waste pond". THIS IS A LISTED SITE ON THE STATE CONTAMINATION REGISTER: Site ID: 05000005. Pollutant(s): 1,2,4 TMB, 1,3,5 TMB, PCE, TCE, Xylenes, n-Propylbenzene, sec-Butylbenzene. Associated with 310 Palmer Park Road, Mancelona MI. 49659. LRUR Id: 11120107004, Facility Name: Dura Automotive/Wickes Effluent Pond. There are 15 different baseline environmental assessment impact statements that reference this site. A visual inspection of this parcel indicates potential environmental contamination. Visual indicators can include things like used tires, dirty soils, or chemically intensive former uses such as dry cleaning. Prospective bidders should carefully research the condition of this property prior to bidding. You may with to contact the Michigan Department of Environmental Quality or other relevant state agencies for additional guidance. Purchasers are strongly advised to obtain a Baseline Environmental Assessment (BEA). Some basic information about BEA can be found here. All sales are made as/is where/is without any representations or warranties. It is the sole responsibility of the purchaser to identify and appropriately handle any environmental contamination that may exist. Please do all necessary research before the auction.

title: 7.45 Acres On Elder Road At Us-131. Mancelona. Contamination Indicators.
comments: Parcel is irregular in shape. Fronts along the north side of Elder Road, beginning east of the railroad grade. It also has a small amount of frontage on Nelson Lake at the east boundary of the parcel. We noticed a dozen or more white pipes in this vicinity on a couple of different properties. It appears that this land was part of the North Tar Lake ETA 128(a) project of the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and was the location of groundwater contamination studies in 2007. If you're intersted in this parcel, you'll want to study the past use of this property carefully to determine whether there is any potential liability involved in acquiring it. The contaminated "lake" of chemicals, which is 4 acres in size, and up to 27 feet deep is not ON this parcel. It merely just the victim of its contamination nearby. On the bright side, there is municipal water service nearby, and you would not be reliant on groundwater as a source if you were to utilitize this parcel. See more information at: http://www.osti.gov/scitech/biblio/5208749 A visual inspection of this parcel indicates potential environmental contamination. Visual indicators can include things like used tires, dirty soils, or chemically intensive former uses such as dry cleaning. Prospective bidders should carefully research the condition of this property prior to bidding. You may with to contact the Michigan Department of Environmental Quality or other relevant state agencies for additional guidance. Purchasers are strongly advised to obtain a Baseline Environmental Assessment (BEA). Some basic information about BEA can be found here. All sales are made as/is where/is without any representations or warranties. It is the sole responsibility of the purchaser to identify and appropriately handle any environmental contamination that may exist. Please do all necessary research before the auction.

title: 5 Acres With Boarded Mobile Home. Rural Setting
comments: Paarcel is 4.92 acres in size, and measures 328 x 650 roughly. There is an older mobile home on the parcel that has been boarded up, and has not been used in some time. The value here is in the land, well and septic if they are functioning. There is a full scale farm operation across the street with chickens, swine and other critters, so you may wish to factor that into your analysis if that is a critical factor to you. The land here is sandy soils, level and fairly open, with a very wide assortment of vegetation sparsely scattered across the parcel. One or more structures was boarded when we conducted our assessment of this parcel. Properties may be boarded for a variety of reasons. For example, properties are often boarded to prevent trespassers from harvesting copper plumbing, wiring, and other fixtures. Buildings may also be boarded by fire or other officials when they present a safety hazard. We generally do not enter boarded structures and limit our observations to the building's exterior. Likewise, you should limit any inspection of this property to its exterior only. You are not permitted to remove any boarding to view building interiors under any circumstances. Public property records or polite inquiries to neighbors may reveal additional information about a property's history. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. Buildings which are dangerous, occupied, boarded, condemned, or otherwise difficult to enter are inspected from the exterior/curbside only. You are NOT authorized to enter these or any other buildings offered for sale. You should limit your inspection to that which can be made safely from the building's exterior.

title: 12.5 Acres North Of Mancelona. Open Lands.
comments: Parcel is open, level and sandy, dry soils. 12.5 acres more or less. General debris on the property. There is a group of mobile homes along Wetzel Lake Road here, and the road frontage belonging to this parcel is the stretch between the easternmost one, and the parcel containing the oil production facility futher east.

title: Beautiful Wooded Lot In Swiss Village East #5.
comments: Serene wooded lot in a very private setting in Swiss Village East #5. There are just a few homes near here, and most of the lots are still vacant. These are private roads and not likely to be county maintained. There is a POA here and likely fees for that purpose. Power and phone at the roadside. This parcel is likely subject to ASSOCIATION FEES which are assessed to cover maintenance and other costs associated with the development in which the parcel is located. Interested parties should verify the existence and extent of association fees and costs prior to bidding.

title: Vacant Building Site In Swiss Village East #4
comments: Nicely wooded building site in Swiss Village East #4. Paved roads. This area is probably about 15% built up, and it's still quite serene here. See the Swiss Village East website for POA information. This parcel is likely subject to ASSOCIATION FEES which are assessed to cover maintenance and other costs associated with the development in which the parcel is located. Interested parties should verify the existence and extent of association fees and costs prior to bidding.

title: Site Condo Lot At "hawks Eye" Golf Community
comments: Hawks Eye is a newer golf community east of the Schuss Mountain development in Kearney Township. Like most other projects of its vintage, it was slowed by the housing bubble bursting in 2008-10. These are very nice building sites on a golf course that weathered the downturn quite well. It has every outward appearance of being a thriving course at this time, and you may wish to check it out in person. These are site condo homesites, and they are subject to restrictions of record as well as condo association fees that you will want to investigate prior to bidding. This is a newer, well maintained development with very nice homes located in rolling hills. There are private, paved roads and well manicured grounds here. This parcel is part of a site condominium development. A condominium "unit" is a form of land ownership which is similar to a traditional subdivision "lot" but is also different in some important respects. Each condominium development is laid out in a document called the master deed which outlines the extent and nature of each condominium unit. The master deed also contains rules and restrictions related to construction and permitted use. Construction requirements can include everything from the size or design of buildings to color and orientation on the site. Condominium developments also include "common elements" like streets and sidewalks which are shared across all units. Some developments include amenities like golf courses, clubhouses, beaches, pools, and parks whereas others include only basic infrastructure like roads and sidewalks. Site condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Prospective bidders should carefully review and understand the master deed and investigate association fees prior to bidding.

title: Unbuilt Condo At "the Chief" Near Schuss Mountain
comments: We call them "air condos". Unbuilt units in development projects that were never finished. They're subject to the restrictions (and fees) of completed units, but they just don't exist. This "unit" sits at the bottom of the hill, off the end of the paved road on Spirit Drive. This lot is part of a condominium development. A condominium is a form of land ownership which is divided up into individual "units." Owners are required to be part of the applicable condominium association (COA) which includes rules and regulations related to the use and ownership of each unit. Additional restrictions will be spelled out in the development's master deed. Condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Some condominium units delegate things like exterior maintenance and repair to the COA whereas the owner remains responsible for the unit's interior. However, there are many varieties of condominiums including residential and commercial interior space, condo subdivision lots, condo boat slips, condo campsites and others. Prospective bidders should carefully review and understand the master deed, COA rules and regulations, and investigate association fees prior to bidding.

title: 4 Unit Residential Property At Schuss Mountain! Family Or Corporate Retreat ... Or Great Income / Investment Property!
comments: This property was built in the early 1990's and has been used its entire life as a timeshare rental property with literally dozens of investor-owners, but controlled by a timeshare management company. It is a 4 unit property, however they are individually deeded, and NOT condominium units. Thus, there is no existing agreement in place that would provide for the maintenance of the exterior or common elements of the property if each unit had a different owner. For that reason, we are offering this property as a single sale unit. Each unit is 2 bedrooms and 1 bath, with a kitchenette and balcony or patio. 2 units are "garden level" and two are on the second floor and have slightly vaulted ceilings. We are told that the property in the past was maintained by the resorts housekeeping and maintenance staff and underwent some substantial repair and refreshing within the last 3 or 4 years. It has been wholly vacant since about June of 2014. To our eyes, this building looks to be in overall excellent condition, though it is a wee bit dated and could stand some freshening up. There are furnishings in the units, but it is rather spartan, and on the grade of mid-line hotel furnishing. Each unit is separately metered for heat and electricity. If you have been looking for a family retreat for siblings or children, a corporate retreat, or an investment or income property, look no further. This is a seldom seen property type in our experience. The units are, by deed covenant, part of the Sudendorf Property Owners Association, at a cost of $184 PER MONTH PER UNIT. In other words, $732/month for the whole building (Note: The association dues were previously listed here as $314 per year in this description, which was incorrect). title: Great Townhouse At Schuss Mountain Resort!
comments: We have offered several properties at Schuss Mountain over the years, but this is the first time we have sold a detached, stand-alone unit in great condition. This is a single family unit on a private lot, and not a condo. No noisy TVs on the other side of the wall or people taking all the good parking spots like at the condos ... you have it all to yourself.This cottage has 3 bedrooms and 2 baths. Fireplace, private deck out back and a spiral staircase leading to the upper floor. In the past, this unit was involved with the rental program here as a timeshare, and it was regularly maintained and housekeeping duty was performed by resort staff. It was updated periodically, but this unit has never been anyones sole and exclusive unit, and as such it lacks the attention and character that a user-owner could create. The roof here is older, and is likely in the last few years of usefulness. The interior is merchantable, but as you'll see in the photos, it's a bit dated and worn. This offers offers great potential as an user-owner property, or as an investment vehicle if put into the rental management program. This unit has been out of the rental program, and unoccupied since the spring of 2014. We're not sure of the purposer, but the sign on the front of the unit says "3752" ... that's neither it's address or a unit number ... but could be a "room number" assigned by the resort. Last occupancy here was approximately June of 2014.This unit is, by deed covenant, part of the Sudendorf Property Owners Association, at a cost of $184 per MONTH (Note: The association dues were previously listed here as $314 per year in this description, which was incorrect). That covers use of the pool, snow removal, and firewood for the wood burning fireplace. This parcel is likely subject to ASSOCIATION FEES which are assessed to cover maintenance and other costs associated with the development in which the parcel is located. Interested parties should verify the existence and extent of association fees and costs prior to bidding.

title: Homesite In The Schuss Mountain Golf And Ski Community!
comments: Schuss Mountain and Shanty Creek resorts are both intertwined in this area of central Antrim County. This is a four-season destination resort spanning 4,500 acres and three distinct villages: Summit, Schuss and Cedar River, each with lodging, dining, golf and downhill skiing and cross country trails, located in Bellaire, Michigan, among the chain of lakes region, just 31 miles northeast of Traverse City. In winter Schuss and Summitâ€™s two mountain experience provides 53 downhill slopes, six terrain parks, 30km of cross country Nordic trails, and a six-lane alpine tubing park. In spring emerge four award-winning championship golf courses including Arnold Palmerâ€™s The Legend and Tom Weiskopfâ€™s decorated Cedar River GC, plus the acclaimed Schuss Mountain course, and the original Summit course. There is a pool for use of the membership. The grounds of the development are well maintained. There are 26 subdivisions and condominium groups here, and they are all members of the Schuss Mountain Property Owners Association (SMPOA) to which we have attached a link. You will find much information on the amenities of the resorts and the POA by surfing the web. Membership in the POA is currently $66 per year for owners of vacant parcels such as the one we are offering here. This parcel is likely subject to ASSOCIATION FEES which are assessed to cover maintenance and other costs associated with the development in which the parcel is located. Interested parties should verify the existence and extent of association fees and costs prior to bidding.

This is a "site condo" unit, which is a vacant homesite in the Cedar River Village development. Please see listing #306 for more details. This parcel is part of a site condominium development. A condominium "unit" is a form of land ownership which is similar to a traditional subdivision "lot" but is also different in some important respects. Each condominium development is laid out in a document called the master deed which outlines the extent and nature of each condominium unit. The master deed also contains rules and restrictions related to construction and permitted use. Construction requirements can include everything from the size or design of buildings to color and orientation on the site. Condominium developments also include "common elements" like streets and sidewalks which are shared across all units. Some developments include amenities like golf courses, clubhouses, beaches, pools, and parks whereas others include only basic infrastructure like roads and sidewalks. Site condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Prospective bidders should carefully review and understand the master deed and investigate association fees prior to bidding.

title: 3.97 Acres On Finch (Crow) Creek. Custer Township.
comments: This is an irregularly shaped parcel of land, with 330' on a seasonal road best left to 4WD vehicles. It is at the bottom of a sandy hill access road that AAA might not pull you out of, so be careful here if visiting. There is no power or other utility service here. Wooded in a mix of varieties with a healthy crop of Maples. Would make great rustic camping or hunting property. Roughly 330' on road (north boundary), 600'+ on east boundary, about 425' on west boundary. South boundary follows the thread of the creek. This parcel is accessible by a road that is believed to be a seasonal or non-maintained public road. While we make no representations or warranties as to the precise nature of such road access, our research suggests that this road is either 1) Not regularly graded; and/or 2) Not snow plowed in winters; and/or 3) Appears subject to fallen trees or other events which have not been addressed by the county road commission. You should conduct your own research into this issue prior to bidding. Our visual inspection indicated that electrical service was not available on or near this parcel. The nearest electric service appeared to be a considerable distance (hundreds or perhaps thousands of feet) from the property. As such, electrifying this parcel could be costly. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding.

title: Nice 6.24 Acre Homesite On Johnson Road. Mancelona.
comments: Parcel is roughly 440' along the west side of Johnson Road and runs about 640' deep. There is municipal water here at the road. A driveway runs in along the south boundary of the property through a stand of pines that gives a great natural privacy screen toward the road. A power line crosses the property midway up the driveway, which then climbs a rather steep hill to the location of (what's left of) a mobile home that we surmise was scrapped. The frame and axles remain for easy removal ... but you'll want new tires. Could also become a great float in the local parade. The top of the lot is nearly level with the tips of the trees at roadside. It's quite a scenic perch away from passersby on the road. There is a well and power service on this property, and we assume a septic too. You may wish to check with the district health department as to whether they meet current requirements for re-use. There is some general debris removal to do here, but its a great parcel with evergreen scenery year-round !

title: Commercial Building At Alba
comments: We sell every type of property sooner or later, and the time has come for yet another first ... a former Motorcycle Club clubhouse. This is the former HQ of the "Outlaws MC" in Alba, right next door to the legendary Green Lantern Bar, right on US 131. This is a high traffic commercial building. It doesn't get much more visible than this, with US 131 traffic north and south, and the "back way" traffic from Gaylord creeping in from the East off Alba Highway. Despite outward appearance, this is a pretty solid and clean building. The roof joists nearest the intersection corner of the building have been replaced in the not-too-distant past, and the roof does not appear to leak as far as we can tell. It has a bathroom that appears to be complete and in good repair. There is a full height basement under the section of the building toward the Green Lantern. With some cosmetic upgrading, this could be quite a terrific commercial office, retail or service business location.

title: 34' Wide Parcel In Alba.
comments: Parcel is 34 feet wide, and adjacent to the Village park and basketball court. Appears to contain a small garage structure that appears to be salvagable, but will need some attention to keep it in serviceable condition. This property appears as if it may be a side-yard parcel. Frequently homes are located on one parcel and the associated back or side-yard is located on a separate adjacent parcel. These side-yards are sometimes foreclosed while the home is not. This can create unfortunate situations where fenced boundaries, septic tanks, out buildings, garages, and other improvements that were previously associated with the home next door are sold on their own. Such parcels may have value to the adjacent owners but often have little to no value on their own. You should investigate this parcel carefully and understand what you are purchasing before you bid.

title: Charming Farmhouse In Downtown Cadillac Makes The Perfect Fixer-Upper!
comments: Close to all of your downtown ammenities, this home makes a great potential rental or starter home. With a large inviting covered front porch and corner triangular lot, this house just screams curb appeal. 4 bedrooms 1 bath, in need of some drywall repairs, however underneath the carpet are some beautiful hardwood floors ready to be touched up. Beautiful large windows throughout the home along with crown molding and plenty of charm.The exterior of the home has a faux brick shingle siding and a newer roof. On the backside of the home is an attached storage that could very easily be made into a one car attached garage. With a few cosmetic repairs this home could be brought back to life. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

This parcel has surface water, soil, or vegetation conditions indicating that it may include wetland habitat. Such habitat may comprise all or part of the parcel's area. However, it is possible that this parcel contains buildable areas as well. There are many environmental and building regulations related to wetlands which you should consult before bidding on this parcel. title: Vacant Lot In The Heart Of Merritt
comments: Vacant lot in Merritt.Friendly neighborhood. Has neighnors personal property on lot (no included in sale) This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

title: Vacant Parcel In Walkerville
comments: Double vacant lot lon North Street in Walkerville. Has a curb cut for a driveway, an address and a well pit with pump, so we assume a structure or trailer has been removed from this location. Nice maple trees line the lot.

title: Handyman Special In Walkerville.
comments: This one has some structural issues. It's a one story rancher that has some dips and weaves in the floor. Someone has opened up a part of the floor in the NE corner and attempted to sister up the joists ... and then apparently walked away from it. It has a newer roof ... and it used to have a newer front door, but they took it (and the breaker box and the water heater and the furnace ...) with them when they left. Also has a 1.5 car attached garage with a one car door ... This one will be a project, but probably also a bargain basement that you can buy for less than the cost of the lumber in a pile. This parcel has substantial structural issues caused by poor design, insufficient maintenance, or both. Such buildings may be subject to condemnation orders which we were unable to locate during our inspection. All such buildings should be brought into compliance with local building regulations prior to use. We strongly recommend that you contact the local building code official and consider consulting a competent structural engineer to assess the condition of this property before to bidding. This parcel appears to have been subject to harvesting of electrical, plumbing, mechanical systems, or other building components. Buildings are sometimes targeted by criminals that steal or "harvest" items such as copper plumbing, wiring, furnaces, water heaters, fixtures, hardwood flooring, etc. This building should be considered incomplete due to such harvesting and may require substantial investment to reequip.

title: 25 Foot Wide Parking Lot In Rothbury
comments: This parcel fronts 25' on US 31 BR, adjacent to, and south of the Rothbury Hardware store. It's been used as the parking lot for the store, but I'd guess they just didn't need it anymore ... so now it can be yours .... if the price is right !

title: Older 1.5 Story Home In Hart!
comments: This is an older, 1.5 story home in Hart that needs some restoration. It has vinyl siding, but looks like it is in need of a new roof sooner rather than later ... it's not leaking inside the house "yet". The side porch has significant deterioration in the eaves and fascia, and there are small trees growing out of the front porch roof. Inside, there is still some original fabric left (leaded glass window and some fancy trim), but a lot of low grade modernization has been done. Oooold furnace. No water heater (removed). Newer 100A electric service. Low grade kitchen and bath upgrades. This one is grubby, but generally solid with the exception of the two porches, which both need attention.

title: Two (5) Five Acre Parcels In Otto Township
comments: This sale consists of two, five acre parcels in Otto Township that connect corner-to-corner. The parcel to the SE of the two has a two track road that runs in to it from South 116th Avenue at the driveway marked "9155" on the mailbox. Watch for the sign on the north (right) side of the road about 1000 feet in. The second parcel lies to the northwest of the parcel, and they connect corner-to-corner. There might be road access to the second one across lands of other property owners, but it's gated and we did not trespass to find out. This is nicely wooded, level land. Ten acres total. Our visual inspection indicated that electrical service was not available on or near this parcel. The nearest electric service appeared to be a considerable distance (hundreds or perhaps thousands of feet) from the property. As such, electrifying this parcel could be costly. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding.

title: Nice Five Acre Parcel On Mckinley Road In Otto Township.
comments: Parcel fronts 330 feet on East McKinley Road, and runs 660 feet deep to the south. There are a lot of nice oaks on this parcel. The west line of this parcel is a shared easement drive that serves a parcel to the rear/south, and the SW corner of this property is 660 feet up that drive. There is an older cabin on the property that is generally solid and restorable, but it appears to have been unused for quite a while, is well boarded and the power service has been dropped. Nothing of value inside. There is a shallow well to the rear, but the pump is missing. Has some potential as a campspot or cabin project !!

title: Ten Acres On Cleveland Road. Otto Township
comments: This is a 10.02 acre parcel that is irregular in shape. Runs 341 feet north-to-south, and is over 1275 feet deep east to west. It is accessed off a two track ... off a two track. Maps and GPS will show other ways to get "in" to this parcel, but the only reliable way we found was off Wilke Road from the South and west, and then following E Ford Road, a winding shared easement road, 3/4s of a mile or so to another driveway-like two track that runs to the north and west of a mobile home and then continues in the woods to the north. Once you reach the property, there is a road that comes into it from the west about halfway up that boundary and runs to a couple of campspots toward the center of the parcel. We did not find any roads into the east half of the lot. There is a camper here that we do not have title to ... and its not a part of the sale. Power is over 500 feet away. The north line of this property (marked along the two track at the west boundary) is Federal National Forest property. Hundreds or even thousands of acres of it. So this is somewhat remote and you'll have little company stopping by because they were "in the neighorhood". A healthy crop of oaks and maples out here. Most are young, but heavy in the mix. Our visual inspection indicated that electrical service was not available on or near this parcel. The nearest electric service appeared to be a considerable distance (hundreds or perhaps thousands of feet) from the property. As such, electrifying this parcel could be costly. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding. This parcel is accessible by a road that is believed to be a seasonal or non-maintained public road. While we make no representations or warranties as to the precise nature of such road access, our research suggests that this road is either 1) Not regularly graded; and/or 2) Not snow plowed in winters; and/or 3) Appears subject to fallen trees or other events which have not been addressed by the county road commission. You should conduct your own research into this issue prior to bidding.

title: Triple Parcel Bundle
comments: This sale includes three adjacent parcels in the Tahoe Shores plat. There is an older mobile here, as well as an oversized 2 car steel garage/storage building. The mobile has some upgraded replacement windows, but its really filthy and difficult to assess its condition without having it emptied out first. Has had wood heat. The storage building is the best part of the deal. It is probably about 24x40 in size and appears to be solid. It too is just loaded with stinky, smelly food trash. They're well worth cleaning up, and appear to hold potential.

title: Vacant Building Site In Oceana Shores One Half Ownership
comments: This is a ONE HALF ownership interest in a vacant parcel in Oceana Shores. The lot is adjacent to the DNR riding and hiking trail that is on the old railroad right-of-way thru this part of the state. Reminder: An undivided interest requires ALL owners to approve improvements or construction on the lands. The interest which was foreclosed and which is being offered for sale is less than a 100% ownership interest in the total parcel. Fractional ownership of real estate presents issues related to each owner's ability to use and modify the relevant property. You should thoroughly research and understand issues surrounding co-ownership of property prior to bidding. It may be wise to consult a licensed real estate attorney to answer specific questions.

title: Side-By-Side Swamp Lots In Oceana Shores Plat.
comments: This sale consists of two adjacent lots in the Oceana Shores plat. If you're looking for cattails .... we have 'em here. This one is a swamplot and likely unduildable. Would make a great frog farm. This parcel has surface water, soil, or vegetation conditions indicating that it may include wetland habitat. Such habitat may comprise all or part of the parcel's area. However, it is possible that this parcel contains buildable areas as well. There are many environmental and building regulations related to wetlands which you should consult before bidding on this parcel. It is your responsibility to determine if this parcel is suitable for your desired use.

However, local zoning regulations may prohibit placing a new mobile home on this site despite the fact that one was previously located here. title: Occupied Mobile Home On 5 Acres. Ferry.
comments: This is a "long 5", being 165' feet along the west side of S 132nd Avenue, and running 1320 feet more or less deep. The property was occupied at the time of our visit in late June, and we did not have the opportunity to view it in detail. Older mobile on a foundation.

title: Classic Old Brick Schoolhouse! Shelby Township
comments: This is what everyone talks about. CHARACTER. We've got character by the bushel here. A brick version of the "Standard School" building from 100 years ago, located on a 165x132 foot (half acre) parcel on a quiet country road. The building appears to be VERY solid and merchantable. There has been some remodeling done, but a good deal of the original fabric (floors and trim) remains also. This is a bi-level design, with the side entrance running a half floor up or down. There is also a partially improved upper (3rd) floor witth unfinished attic to the rear. Don;t be afraid of this one ... it's solid. Has a newer 200A power service and panel, and a fenced rear yard. .

title: Vacant Parcel In Holiday Shores, Near Stony Lake!
comments: This is a nicely wooded, corner lot in the Holiday Shores plat ... just a few hundred feet from Stony Lake. At the intersection of Wisconsin and Georgia Streets.

title: 1+ Acre With Manufactured Housing Unit, North Of Walkerville.
comments: Parcel is 188.6' x 266.4' in size, and sits "third row" behind two other parcels on 172nd Avenue. There is a newer modular-type housing unit here that sits REAL CLOSE to the property line. We are fairly certain that it's "on" the property, but we did not enter it because we could not be certain. The property here is gently rolling and open. The access to this property is along the north line, and there is a wooden fence post and a barely used two track that follows the fenceline back to the parcel. The modular could use some repair, but does not look to ancient.

title: Storage Building In Hart Township
comments: Parcel fronts 112.5 feet along the east side of North 72nd Avenue, and runs 335 feet deep. Open, level, dry land here with a storage building that is in merchantable condition. Has a newer electric service and there is a well on the property. There is some assorted debris on the property to remove, and some titled vehicles that are not a part of this sale. Building is roughly 35x20 in size and is concrete block construction. Decent, non-leaking roof.

title: Forty Acres Near Silver Lake Sand Dunes Recreation Area!
comments: This is a "long 40", being 660 feet east-west, and 2640 feet north-south. Fronts on the south side of West Fillmore Road in Golden Township. The land here is rolling at the roadfrontage, but level toward the center of the parcel ... then dropping off to the rear ... especially at the SE corner of the parcel. We put a sign at the two corners of the parcel where it meets Fillmore Road, and one more in the center. The NE corner of the property is at the point where the powerline intersects the road ... and it runs west 660 feet from there. If you travel a few hundred feet up the powerline road to the south, there is a two track that enters the area through a gate. Beyond the gate, we have placed a sign at the east and west boundary lines along a well developed dirt road toward the center of the parcel that sweeps northwest. There is a circle turnaround and flags where the road crosses the west line of the parcel. There are lots of good looking maple and oak here, and it would not appear that this has been timbered anytime in the recent past. This would make a great campspot, home site, or family compound location.

title: 1  Acre Parcel With No Road Access - Golden Township
comments: Parcel has waterfront on Lambricks Creek, however it has no improved roadfront access. The former owner controls the land to the east and north of this parcel. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: 3.64 Acre Parcel In The Ruby Creek Area.
comments: This is the corner of 4 counties: Lake, Mason, Oceana and Newaygo. Our parcel lies about 1/2 mile west of that intersection. This is a nicely wooded parcel on a county maintained road in the Ruby Creek/Pere Marquette River recreational area. This is a generally a quiet place that is great for outdoor activities. About 5 miles from Big Star Lake. Lots of recreational opportunities in the area.

title: Mobile Home Site In Colfax Township
comments: Our eyes tell us there was a mobile home here in the past. Now all that's left is a pile of insulation, a sofa (with matching loveseat) and the well. There is likely also a septic here, tho we can't garn-tee the condition of anything here other than the sofa, which is upside down. The value here is in the land, and potentially well and septic. Might also make a great camp or RV spot depending on the zoning. 1.14 acres ... 237 along Rossell Lake Road, and runs 210 feet deep to the south. Level, open lands. This parcel appears to include an area where a mobile home was previously located. Such mobile home pads will frequently include well/water and septic/sewer connections as well as power hookups. However, local zoning regulations may prohibit placing a new mobile home on this site despite the fact that one was previously located here. Please check local zoning regulations carefully prior to bidding. We make no representations or warranties as to the suitability of this parcel for any purpose.

There are several outbuildings including a barn, and numerous titled vehicles (and parts thereof) that have been there long enough that you can see them in aerial photos of the property dating back several years. title: Multiple Parcel Bundle - Oceana County
comments: A "bundle" is created when multiple parcels are sold as a group. Sometimes they are adjacent (ie: a home on one lot and it's well or septic on another parcel) and other times they are bundled because they have issues that should be addressed prior to being sold individually. This group is from the latter category. In this bundle we have a gas station with ground contamination and underground tanks that need to be removed, parcels that are too small to build on, parcels that have no legal access and other problems. In order to be awarded the bid for this bundle, the successful bidder will be required to post a performance bond that assures FULL REMEDIATION of the contamination at the gas station property and the removal of the underground storage tanks. The site is listed with the MIDEQ Environmental mapper as "Facility #9017". There is an open file on contamination (Leak ID: C-0116-05) from the release of gasoline, and there are two tanks still in the ground, one being 2000 gallons and the other 6000 gallons. A bidder will be required to provide suitable proof of an issued performance bond and evicence of a plan to remediate and remove within 21 days of the auction, or the sale will be cancelled without refund, and no deed will be issued. No possession of the property will be granted until issuance of the deed on this sale. Please contact the auction house if you have further questions. This parcel may contain buried storage tanks from previous use as a gas station or similar enterprise. Our analysis is based solely on visual inspection of the property surface as further detailed in the lot description. The State of Michigan may require a new owner to remove any remaining tanks and remediate environmental concerns at their sole expense. Additional information may be available from the MDEQ Storage Tank Database. You should conduct careful and thorough research prior to bidding on this parcel. A visual inspection of this parcel indicates potential environmental contamination. Visual indicators can include things like used tires, dirty soils, or chemically intensive former uses such as dry cleaning. Prospective bidders should carefully research the condition of this property prior to bidding. You may with to contact the Michigan Department of Environmental Quality or other relevant state agencies for additional guidance. Purchasers are strongly advised to obtain a Baseline Environmental Assessment (BEA). Some basic information about BEA can be found here. All sales are made as/is where/is without any representations or warranties. It is the sole responsibility of the purchaser to identify and appropriately handle any environmental contamination that may exist. Please do all necessary research before the auction.

title: 1.5 Acre Building Site On Br Us31 Near Pentwater!
comments: This sale is two parcels, which when combined are about 1.5 acres in size. The combined parcel has an irregular footprint that you will want to verify with local tax maps to understand what you're buying. It should easily support construction.

title: Almost 5 Acres. Nice Property. No Road Access
comments: This is a group of 58 platted lots in "Pentwater Beach Addition #1", currently in three tax descriptions. They total 4.86 acres more or less. This is very scenic property, and its just a spitting distance to the shores of Lake Michigan. HOWEVER, the platted roads here were never improved, and the topography of the area (it's wooded dunes) is extreme, and improving the roads "as platted" could well be next to impossible even if you undertook that process. To prevent abuse from bidders that would try to resell these individually with no access, this sale will contain a deed restriction that the entire group will not be "split" unless legitimate, improved road access has been created. The property will revert to the seller if it is split without that improvement being made. These lots are being "combined" by the assessors office into a single tax ID parcel. The property does have the potential to be used for walk-in activities or adjoined to other adjacent parcels, but as it is currently configured, it is not accessible by road. The roads which are shown on plat or tax maps for this parcel do not appear to exist or may be located in a different location than shown on such maps. While a legal right to build such roads may remain, this construction would likely be very expensive. However, in some instances these unimproved roads have been vacated or abandoned by action of the local government and no such right to construct the roads remains. Issues surrounding unimproved roads can be complicated and expensive to resolve. You should investigate the existence of any roads and the ability to access this parcel thoroughly before bidding. This parcel appears to have challenging terrain. Challenging terrain can include steep hillsides, ravines, gullies, or similar topographical features as well as little to no buildable area. Such parcels often have no practical use. You should investigate this parcel's terrain and suitability for your desired purpose prior to bidding.

title: Cute, Well Maintained Home On A Corner Lot In Scottville!
comments: No clowning around on this one. This is a sharp little 1.5 story home on a corner lot in quiet Scottville. This has been occupied until very recently, and the former occupant, who lives nearby, still has some things here. The property is being watched by neighbors, so please do not make any effort to enter this one, or you will meet the local police :). Home has vinyl siding for low maintenance, but looks like a new roof is probably not too far in the future. There is a one car detached garage, and a small patio for outdoor gatherings or BBQ. 2BR/1BA. Full basement. Needs resurfacing (carpets) and a general cleanup. This would be a great starter or retirement home !

title: Two Story Ludington Charmer.
comments: Two story, light and bright home in Ludington. If you like lots of windows and natural light, this one is for you. Inside, there are lots of unfinished projects ... a general resurfacing is needed. The two story portion of the home is solid, though the rear windows (dining room) need attention. The doors and windows here are original wood sash units and there is some repair needed. The roof will need replacement sooner rather than later, especially in the one story side addition to the home where there is a "I can see daylight" opening right into the home. The one story area has suffered water damage and should be repaired immediately to prevent it going to mold. Older NG forced air furnace, 60A fuse electric. 5BR/2BA. This is a large, classic older home that needs a rehabber and a little elbow grease. Could be a great house in the right hands. One car, detached garage off the alley to the rear. And a great pine tree ! The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed.

comments: This one is still wrapped. It's covered in Tyvek, and not yet sided. Has a newer roof and fascia in spots ... a work in progress to be sure. Based on the garage and what we can see of the rear of the house, this is an older building that is part-way thru a remodel. We did not have a chance to view the interior or detail because it is still under the control of the former owners. This property is occupied.
