title: Older, Two Story Home In Ludington. Much Potential!
comments: This is an older two story home in Ludington, with a detached two car garage on the alley. The roof is older, but does not apper to be a leaker. Has the asphalt composition siding that covers what "might" be original wood siding that possibly could be restored, except for two additions ... one on each floor. The kitchen and bath are both low grade mid-century upgrades. This home contains a lot of the original trim, and could be a great restoration project for someone looking for a classic home is a great little community. The furnace appears to be very new. 4BR 1.5BA. 100 A electric service. The garage is salvagable, but could use some help. Has a fenced yard.

title: Cute Little Bungalow In Ludington!
comments: 50x60 lot on a quiet north side street in Ludington. This one appears small from the road, but actually has 3 bedrooms (albeit small ones) up top. This one is older in decor, but a straight and sturdy home overall. The roof is really soggy looking and should be replaced, but does not appear to leak inside. The front porch has been enclosed here, which distracts from the classic design of the building. Could be restored. Has space heat and an upgraded 100A electric service. Kitchen and bath are mid-century remodels.

title: Vacant Building Site In Ludington!
comments: If you're looking for a nice, buildable homesite in Ludington, we have one ! The parcel is 75' wide and runs 140' to the east of Delia Avenue on the north side. A nice quiet neighborhood of well maintained homes surrounds this parcel. Served with all city utilities and natural gas is available here as well.

title: Storage Unit Condo Space In Downtown Ludington.
comments: Sale 4119 and 4120 is two "condo units" in downtown Ludington. But before you call the movers, be aware that the view here isn't much. These units are better described as "the basement". This is storage space in the lower level of the "Lakewinds Centre West" building at 409 W Ludington Avenue. The units are numbered LL 6 and LL 8 ... being side-by-side areas within a common wall area secured by a door. The area is serviced by a passenger elevator and is roughly 25x70 in size. We strongly suggest obtaining a copy of the master deed and determining what the allowed uses and monthly condo fees are here BEFORE bidding on this property. The area has no windows or natural light. It is sprinklered. We are uncertain whether or not it has any separate utility service for heat or power, or if these are supplied by the association and included in fees. There are plenty of variables to this one that you will want to investigate prior to bidding. Entry is via the left (west) set of doors at the parking lot entrance, though they are routinely locked. This lot is part of a condominium development. A condominium is a form of land ownership which is divided up into individual "units." Owners are required to be part of the applicable condominium association (COA) which includes rules and regulations related to the use and ownership of each unit. Additional restrictions will be spelled out in the development's master deed. Condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Some condominium units delegate things like exterior maintenance and repair to the COA whereas the owner remains responsible for the unit's interior. However, there are many varieties of condominiums including residential and commercial interior space, condo subdivision lots, condo boat slips, condo campsites and others. Prospective bidders should carefully review and understand the master deed, COA rules and regulations, and investigate association fees prior to bidding. This sale has been combined with #4119. Please see that offering

title: Waterfront Cottage On Bass Lake Near Pentwater!
comments: We have a delightful WATERFRONT cottage on popular BASS LAKE near PENTWATER. Bass Lake connects to Lake Michigan through a small channel, and is the location of many nice, waterfront homes. Parcel fronts 58' on the lake. The home appears to be a modular/manufactured, "BOCA home" unit with an attached two cara garage. They don't get much closer to "move in ready" than this one. We believe the plumbing here was winterized. Has a crawlspace with concrete floor. 4 Bedrooms and 2.5 baths. Low maintenance vinyl siding and a newer architectural shingle roof. The only thing readily apparent here to be done is perhaps changing the carpet (worn, loose and stained in spots) and fresh paint. Other than that, this one doesn't need much. There is a good deal of personal property here that remains the property of the former owner. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

title: Vacant Dunes District Parcel Near Lake Michigan
comments: Parcel is 16 platted lots in the Nagasaki Park plat, and is 200'x250' in size. There are no improved roads into this area ... and two tracks here are not necessarily following the contours of the plat. Also be aware that much of the land in this area can be subject to Dune protection regulation and may be unbuildable. Likely has some access issues both legally and by virtue of topography. Make sure you know what you're bidding on here, folks. The roads which are shown on plat or tax maps for this parcel do not appear to exist or may be located in a different location than shown on such maps. While a legal right to build such roads may remain, this construction would likely be very expensive. However, in some instances these unimproved roads have been vacated or abandoned by action of the local government and no such right to construct the roads remains. Issues surrounding unimproved roads can be complicated and expensive to resolve. You should investigate the existence of any roads and the ability to access this parcel thoroughly before bidding.

title: Rural House And Outbuildings. Sugar Grove Area.
comments: parcel fronts 816 feet along the north side of Sugar Grove Road, and runs 291 feet deep to the north. Roughly 3.8 acres. There are several buildings here, including a "Biltmore" home, garage, several small sheds and a metal storage building that may be the best thing on the lot. There is a considerable amount of castoff here, and you'll be friends with the people at the dumpster company by the time you're done cleaning this one up. The nucleus of the residential unit is a modular/manufactured housing unit with several rambling additions. The decking is bowing and weaving and will probably need replacement, but the structure itself seems sound and restorable ... just lots of debris. Be aware, however, that they took part of it with them (breakers, some of the wiring has been "harvested"). 3 Bedrooms and a full basement here. The storage building is solid and has a concrete floor ... it too has lots of debris to be hauled off. All of the power services to this property have been dropped by the electric provider. This one has potential to be cleaned up and brought back to life. It has had some rough use, but has a lot of life left. This parcel appears to have been subject to harvesting of electrical, plumbing, mechanical systems, or other building components. Buildings are sometimes targeted by criminals that steal or "harvest" items such as copper plumbing, wiring, furnaces, water heaters, fixtures, hardwood flooring, etc. This building should be considered incomplete due to such harvesting and may require substantial investment to reequip.

title: Occupied Home Near Tallman Lake
comments: This is an OCCUPIED property located near Tallman Lake. It is a small, frame cabin one lot away from the lake. Has a thru-the-trees southermn exposure view of the lake. It appears to be in generally solid condition and quite merchantable. We did not have the opportunity to view it in detail, as it is rented. The former owner indicates that he will likely attend the auction in an effort to buy it back. This property is occupied. Please respect the privacy of current occupants and limit any inspection to what can be safely observed from the road. Some occupants may be upset or angry and may meet contact with aggression or violence. Please use discretion and caution when researching this or other occupied properties. Furthermore, although this property has been foreclosed for unpaid taxes, occupants have certain rights under Michigan law and must be formally evicted if unwilling to leave voluntarily. You may wish to consult a licensed attorney for more information. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. title: Vacant Parcel Near Tallman Lake
comments: This is a 60x132 lot just to the left after the end of "D" Street ... off N 34th Street. Level, wooded lands.

title: 3+ Acres With Deeded Access To Round Lake!
comments: This is a vacant parcel that includes 5 platted parcels that have deeded access to Round Lake. The parcel is irregular in shape, and fronts on the NE corner of the intersection of Stolberg Road and Elm Street .... 200' feet on Elm to the north, 330' on Stolberg to the east, and also abuts a shared two-track road at the north end that also is known as Elm Street. Sales 4110 and 4111 are adjacent to this parcel on the east, and you could combine them into a parcel that totals over 5 acres !

title: Older Modular Home On 1.23 Acre With Deeded Access To Round Lake!
comments: Hidden back off Stolberg Road in overgrowth, is this older mobile home, on a 99' wide lot that runs over 275' deep to the north. This one has been sitting abandon for a while, and there is some debris to eliminate not just inside the home, but also tucked into various corners of the yard. This is a mobile on a full height, walkout concrete block basement ... with additions. It actually has potential, but it will need attention sooner rather than later, as there is some broken glass allowing critters inside. The raccoons have foundd their way to the attic and are making lunch of the ceilings. Inside, the home seems sturdy and dry. Newer furnace (bottle gas) and older 60 amp electric service. This has DEEDED ACCESS to Round lake. Sale 4112 is to the west of this parcel, and 4110 to the east. Buy all three and have over FIVE ACRES plus deeded waterfront !

title: 2/3 Acre Lot On Stolberg Road
comments: This is a vacant parcel that fronts 119' on the north side of Stolberg Road. Sale 4111 is due west of this parcel, and 4112 just a little further west at the intersection with Elm Street. All 3 combined is over 5 acres. This lot has deeded access to Round Lake. Runs 279' deep along the west line, and 230' on the east. Level wooded lands.

title: Homesite In The Hamlin Lake Area.
comments: This is a large homesite property in the popular Hamlin Lake reort area, north of Ludington. This parcel fronts on two roads, West Hemlock Street to the north, and West Victory Drive to the south. parcel runs 160' along each road, and 260' deep in between, north to south. This is 8 platted lots in the Hamlin Lake Estates #1 plat, which can be seen on the linked plat map. Level, dry lands. It appears that something has been removed from this site, most likely a trailerhouse. Our review of this parcel indicates that the noted State Equalized Value (SEV) does not appear to reflect the current value of the property. This is often due to buildings or other improvements being demolished or fire damaged or other similar items included in the SEV being removed from the property. It can also be due to market changes in the area in which the property is located. It should be further noted that the SEV/assessed value of the parcel as noted in this listing may be several years old. You should consult a local real estate professional or appraiser to help you assess the current market value of this property before bidding and should not base your valuation on the stated SEV.

title: Vacant Parcel With No Improved Road. Hamlin Lake Area.
comments: Parcel is 100' (north-south) and 200' (east-west), which makes it just slightly less than 1/2 acre. Located on a platted road (Pine Street) that has never been improved. Unless the road was "vacated" (abandon), you stilk have legal access, just not by auto ... unless it fits between the trees ... The roads which are shown on plat or tax maps for this parcel do not appear to exist or may be located in a different location than shown on such maps. While a legal right to build such roads may remain, this construction would likely be very expensive. However, in some instances these unimproved roads have been vacated or abandoned by action of the local government and no such right to construct the roads remains. Issues surrounding unimproved roads can be complicated and expensive to resolve. You should investigate the existence of any roads and the ability to access this parcel thoroughly before bidding.

title: Classic Old Farmhouse Near Freesoil. One Acre
comments: This is a large, older wood frame home located on US 31 at Freesoil Road on a corner lot. Parcel is 126x343, roughly one acre, in size. This one has been "let go" for a few years, and is in dire need of a new roof and a paint job. We suspect that a commercial use of this property is permissable and you may wish to verify that potential. The structure has some missing and decayed siding that will require attention, and there is a noticeable deflection in the front, center second floor room ... which sags right over the front door (it's noticeable from the road). Inside, the structure seems solid, but has been neutered of most any original trim or finish and is poorly modernized. Has a newer electric service, and an older gas, forced air furnace. It is difficult to get a good look at the foundation because of overgrowth. Overall, this is a home with potential, looking for a person with some vision that is willing to trade elbow grease for a classic charmer !

title: Nice Hillside Lot With A View Of Gun Lake, Freesoil Area.
comments: Lot is 150 feet along the north side of North Poplar Road, and runs 120' deep. It is a triple-lot in the Indian Hills Resort plat. Some nice maples, oaks and pines on the lot. Sits about 5 feet above roiad grade, and has a through-the-trees view of Bass Lake. Would make a great spot for a getaway !

title: 2.5 Acres Without Improved Road Access. Freesoil Township.
comments: This is a square (330'x330') parcel, that does not have frontage on any improved, public road or two track that we could find. Easement rights are unknown and should be verified. The property is surrounded on all sides by thousands of acres of Federal lands. Level, wooded property that holds much recreational use. East of Hoags Lake in a scenic area. Nearest public road is Trufant Road / Forest Service Road 8560. Our visual inspection indicated that electrical service was not available on or near this parcel. The nearest electric service appeared to be a considerable distance (hundreds or perhaps thousands of feet) from the property. As such, electrifying this parcel could be costly. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: 60X132 Parcel With No Road Access. Branch Township.
comments: This is a small 60x132 parcel that is surrounded by thousands of acres of Federal lands. There are no improved roads, or even two tracks that run to this parcel. title: Modern Housing At Walhalla Shores! Beach And Lake Access On Long Lake!
comments: This sale parcel includes a 120x130 foot lot that contains a newer modular home on block crawlspace. This property is in a POA that has a waterfront access parcel on Long Lake !! (see photos for POA amenities). We notice a piece of the fascia is missing on the front, but otherwise, the interior appears to be in pretty solid condition. Inside, this one looks like they just packed up and didn't come back. We can't tell whether or not they winterized the plumbing, but this is very close to "move in ready" otherwise. Three bedrooms and one bath. This is a good solid property that we would not be afraid to bid on at all ! This property has a POA, and the fees help pay for the maintenance of the waterfront beach, boat launch, picnic pavillion and park ! This parcel is likely subject to ASSOCIATION FEES which are assessed to cover maintenance and other costs associated with the development in which the parcel is located. Interested parties should verify the existence and extent of association fees and costs prior to bidding.

title: Older Mobile On 2.24 Acres Near Walhalla.
comments: This is a triangular shaped parcel that fronts 500 feet on the SW side of Gibson Road, just 100 feet or so from its intersecttion with US 10. The west line is 390' and south line is 350' more or less. The parcel is dry, level and nicely wooded, including a few large oaks. We suspect it has been a few years since this one had regular maintenance, and the roof has been let go to the point where the inside has a pretty serious mold going on. The value here is in the lot, well, septic and natural gas feed. Move this mobile out and bring in a fresh unit, and you're ready to go !

title: 3+ Acre Wetlands Parcel In Branch Township.
comments: Parcel fronts 283 feet on Hansen Road, and runs a full 660 feet deep. USGS topographical maps indicate that this is a wetlands parcel, so we suspect that it would not support onsite sewerage.

title: Occupied Home Near Scottville
comments: This is an OCCUPIED home, west of Scottville on First Street. We did not have the opportunity to view the home in detail because of the occupancy. Parcel is one acre in size, being 165x270. There is a detached two car garage. The home appears to probably be a modern modular or manufactured housing unit on a block crawlspace. Appears to be a overall good condition. title: Two Hundred Feet On Portage Lake .... Onekama!
comments: This is the best thing happening in Onekama since the two Ernies were here. We have FOUR fifty-foot waterfront lots on scenic, popular all sports PORTAGE LAKE near Onekama. The total road and waterfront dimension is 200 feet, and the property runs over 250 feet deep. There are wetlands indicators here, and at least part of this property is subject to a CONSERVATION EASSEMENT with the State which you will need to review. It is possible that this could be used by an off-water homeowner for lake access, by improving a road or trail with permit. There is also the option of the development of a wetlands mitigation project, by which you would acquire .... and set aside an equal amount of wetlands property in permanent trust. If this property piques your interest, you may wish to consult with an expert in environmental regulation and wetlands permitting to see if they can determine a way to make it buildable or useful for your intended purpose. We made an effort to walk the parcel and discovered it to be ankle to calf deep water in some spots in late June. This parcel has surface water, soil, or vegetation conditions indicating that it may include wetland habitat. Such habitat may comprise all or part of the parcel's area. However, it is possible that this parcel contains buildable areas as well. There are many environmental and building regulations related to wetlands which you should consult before bidding on this parcel. It is your responsibility to determine if this parcel is suitable for your desired use.

title: Vacant Building Site In Manistee
comments: Parcel is located on St Marys Parkway, just a few blocks from the Lake Michigan beaches ! Parcel is roughly 60x100 in size. All municipal utilities and natural gas available here ! Our review of this parcel indicates that the noted State Equalized Value (SEV) does not appear to reflect the current value of the property. This is often due to buildings or other improvements being demolished or fire damaged or other similar items included in the SEV being removed from the property. One advantage to these parcels is that they typically have infrastructure nearby (water, sewer, power). It is your responsibility to determine whether a parcel is suitable for your desired purpose.

title: Older Mobile With Addition. Copemish.
comments: We have, available for your consideration, a well used mobile home with addition in Copemish. This is located on double, corner lot with alley access, so you have frontage on 3 sides. The mobile has been resided in rb&b plywood, and it has a few upgraded windows, but it's pretty "original" otherwise. Overall it is functional, but very cluttered. It's not the Ritz, but it could serve as basic housing if cleaned up and put back together. Has a newer 100A elecrric service and progas heat. This is actually a nice lot with some attractive trees. The adjacent homes are clean and well maintained.

title: 1+ Acre With A Fallin' Down Shack ... Near Copemish.
comments: This one is likely beyond any rational persons concept of repair. The garage roof has collapsed, the soffits and fascia are shot in several areas, and inside, the floors have collapsed. There would be mold here, except that the ventilation from the broken windows keeps it under control. You'd be way better off starting over here, than to try to repair this one. The value here is in the land, and possibly the well and septic depending on what, where and how they remain. This one fronts 165 feet along the west side of Healy Lake Road, and runs 330 feet deep. Level, dry, mostly open lands.

title: Occupied Home Near Thompsonville.
comments: This is an OCCUPIED home that sits on a little over 1.5 acres southwest of Thompsonville. Fronts 330 feet along Moore Road, and runs 250 feet deep. It is a fairly modern modular, and appears to be in merchantable condition. Because it is occupied we did not have the opportunity to inspect it in detail. Has a detached two car garage. title: 5 Acres On Portage Point!
comments: This parcel is 5.89 acres, currently taxed as 4 different parcels, to be combined with the assessor and sold as one parcel. It is 45 platted lots in Portage Park Addition and Portage Park Resort plats. There is visible surface water, many cat tails and clear swamplot marker all over this one. Of the entire parcel, there MIGHT be some solid land at the SE corner of the group, where a driveway and culvert exist. We'd recommend that you check with an environmental and wetlands specialist for your development options. Would also make an excellent wetlands mitigation swap parcel for the redevelopment of another parcel where wetlands are impacted. This parcel may be sold with a prohibition against splitting into smaller parcels by deed restriction (reverter clause) at the option of the seller. This parcel has surface water, soil, or vegetation conditions indicating that it may include wetland habitat. Such habitat may comprise all or part of the parcel's area. There are many environmental and building regulations related to wetlands which you should consult before bidding on this parcel. It is your responsibility to determine if this parcel is suitable for your desired use.

title: 50' X 100' Lot On Portage Point
comments: This is a 50' x 100' deep parcel on the north side of Seymour Street where it meets Ferndale Drive. Cedar trees indicate a high water table nearby, however there are other homes constructed here. A perc test by the district health department would be a good idea here. Nice location near popular Portage Lake and Onekama.

title: 50X125 Wetlands Parcel On Portage Point.
comments: 50 foot on Portage Point Drive ... runs 125 feet deep. Sits well below road grade and has lots of visual wetlands indicators.

title: Biltmore Home In Wellston
comments: This one started out as perhaps 3 different buildings ... the house on the front ... and two small cabins to the rear (one converted to a garage) and they were tied together. Some unusual roof lines. Inside, the building seems structurally solid, and has maple hardwood flooring in spots as well as knotty pine walls in some areas. 3 bedrooms (1 down, two up). Dated kitchen and bath. Basement is a partial, "Michigan" cellar. There has been some "remodeling" done here, but the workmanship is sketchy ... with a could of windows scabbed in without proper framing. In the proper hands, this one could be finished properly and would be a great northern retreat. Located in Wellston, just a few miles east of Manistee off M-55. Lot size is 100 feet on Pine Street by 150 feet on Eighth Street. Has a newer electrical service panel, and modern progas forced air furnace. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed.

title: Offroad Swamplot Near Wellston
comments: Parcel does not have improved, public road frontage. We found no "two tracks" in to the parcel. USGS topographical maps indicate that this is marshland and unbuildable. Parcel is 132'x660' (2 acres). Best use: recreational/hunting stand property. Or a frog farm. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: Mobile Home Setup On Forest Road. Wellston
comments: This was a roofover mobile home ... but they left and took the mobile with them (that must have been a trick). Now what is left is the roofover, a steel carport structure (with debris piled up) and a couple of boats that probably will never float again. With some cleanup, we suspect there may be functioning well (pump gone) and septic here, and the power service is still live, so there is good value here just in land and improvements. It could serve nicely as a RV campspot depending on local zoning. The roofover needs a new deck and roofing, but the rest of the structure looks solid ... just torn up and it's been exposed to the elements for a while. Parcel fronts 220 feet on the north side of Forest Road, and runs 150 feet deep more or less. This parcel appears to include an area where a mobile home was previously located. Such mobile home pads will frequently include well/water and septic/sewer connections as well as power hookups. However, local zoning regulations may prohibit placing a new mobile home on this site despite the fact that one was previously located here. Please check local zoning regulations carefully prior to bidding. We make no representations or warranties as to the suitability of this parcel for any purpose. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed.

title: 1+ Acre Parcel, Off Baker Road. Wellston Area
comments: Parcel is irregular in shape, and has no frontage on any improved public road. Sits to the rear of 367 Baker Road (which says 368 on the house by mistake ... I guess the store was out of 7's that day) and appears to have no improved access road to it. We recommend verifying legal easement exists prior to bidding unless you have adjacent lands. Parcel is dry, level, and wooded. There are actually two parcels here adjoined. One is 90 (north-south) x 400 (east-west) and then there is a 30 foot wide strip that runs 145 from the SW corner, to the property at 367 Baker Road. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: Resort Area Motel Property Near Wellston
comments: Looking for a retirement business opportunity ? Want to live where the great outdoors is just steps from your back door ? The BLACK BEAR INN might be just the option you've been looking for. The property is just a wee bit over an acre in size, and is located in the High Bridge area on M-55, about a dozen miles east of Manistee and just a couple of miles from Wellston. The Stockade Bar, a local landmark, is next door and currently listed with a Realtor in case you're looking for a multi-faceted undertaking. This is an older 4 unit motel property with two addittional cabins to the rear and an owners/managers quarters up front, that has all had a facelift in recent years, and presents itself well from the road. The clientele was substantially outdoors entheusiasts, hunters and fishermen. The units are knotty pine interior and have a modern, rustic decor. Most units have a kitchenette, and the larger cabin to the rear is two bedroom. Propane wall heaters in each room. We don't see any leaking roofs, but the motel section roof is older and would probably be well served by a steel roof that matches the area over the office. You can tell that someone really loved this place and took care of it not long ago. Paved parking. We're looking for someone that wants to take that tradition over.

title: Vacant 5.18 Acre Industrial Park Site Near East Lake.
comments: This is a commercial/industrial park parcel located on the east side of Manistee Lake near the village of East Lake. There is municipal water and sewer here, as well as three phase power. The parcel measures 430' (east-west) x 500' (north-south), and there is a Consumers Energy easement that traverses the southwest corner. It fronts on East Lake Road, as well as (unimproved) White Oak Street within the interior of the industrial park. Parcel is mostly wooded and level. This is within a renaissance zone, and there are some significant tax advantages to building your new business here !

title: Sharp Two Story Home In Filer City!
comments: Well kept, older, two story home in Filer City, south and east of Manistee. Right across the street from a bluff view of Manistee Lake. Home has a newer architectural shingle roof and is vinyl sided for lower maintenance. Has some upgraded windows and doors. Inside there is some fabulous oak trim, including ornate fretwork in the archway and stairway that is intact and never painted. The living room has cove molding with an egg and dart detail. There are some issues here with plumbing, as it appears the baasement has had perhaps as much as a foot or water in it at one time (now receded). We assume there is freeze damage which probably took the hot water boiler (heat) and water heater with it ... so plan on those repairs or replacements. This is a square, solid house that has great potential in the right hands. Lot is 60' on the street and runs over 150 feet deep. We are told that city sewer lines will likely be run in this area in a year or two.

title: 5+ Acres On Highbridge Road! Dickson Township. Near Kaleva.
comments: Parcel is irregular in shape, and weighs in at 5.6 acres or so It fronts 546 feet along the east side of Highbridge Road, and runs 530 feet deep, with a 208x321 parcel removed from thge SE corner. USGS topographical maps indicate that the eastern portion of this property is marshland/wetlands. There was some sort of a camp or trailker at the NW corner of this parcel at one time according to maps, but there is only a driveway grade and a little bit of rubble left there to prove it. We see a fair number of oaks here of middle age and younger. Could be a nice norhtern homesite location with wildlife right out your back door in the popular High Bridge recreational area.

title: 5+ Acres Near Copemish!
comments: This offering is of two large platted lots in the Northwoods Havens subdivision east of Copemish. One lot fronts on M-115 with 165' of frontage, and the lot that sits to the south and west of it fronts on Erwin Road with 160 feet of frontage there. This property sits high and dry above the road on both sides. Probably some gravel on this one worth more than the cost of admission to the show.

title: Triangular Parcel With 429' On M-115 Near Copemish
comments: Parcel is about 1.5 acres in size, and fronts 429' along the southwest side of M-115 just a few miles SE of Copemish. It is triangular in shape, with a east-west dimension of 524', 429 from NW to SE along the south side of the road, and a SW to NE line that measures 300 feet. Highly visible location on a busy state hiway, and its also deep enough to find purpose as a homesite.

title: Six Acres With 1000' On M-115!
comments: This parcel is triangular in shape, and fronts 1000 feet along the southwest side of M-115, about half way between Mesick and Copemish rright on top of the Wexford-Manistee County line. Measures as follows: 1000' from NW to SE along the south side of M-115, then 1320' west along the south line, and 400' north to where we started. Highly visible property along a well travelled corridor. Subject to power line r/o/w ... be sure you take this into consideration.

title: Earth Shelter Home On 10 Acres! Brethren Area.
comments: This is a "square 10" ... 660x660 feet in size, that at first blush seems to only have a new outbuildings on it. But once we got up close, we found a surprise ... an underground house ! This one is real spartan ... and it has an issue with mold/dampness that will need to be rectified, but it is built like a bomb shelter. There is a lot of poured concrete here ... it will be here after we are all long gone. Has an attached solarium/greenhouse room that will also need some work. It is difficult to say whether this moisture issue can be controlled by HVAC, a water collection system around the perimeter, or whether excavation and re-sealing will be required. The land here is mostly open, but brushy. It rolls downhill steeply to the rear of the "bunker". This could be a stellar hideaway in the right hands. There is some work to be done, but this one is built like a fort.

title: Double Lot At Bear Lake!
comments: Corner lot at South Shore Drive and 12th Street, just west of Bear Lake Village. 122' along South Shore Drive and 132' deep along 12th. Level, dry, open lands here.

title: Homesite Near Bear Lake With Deeded Waterfront Access
comments: Parcel is 118' on the west side of 3rd Street, and runs 132' deep. Level, sandy, open lot with a nice green screen between it and the home to the north. This property has a DEEDED WATERFRONT ACCESS to Bear Lake over a 40' easement that is just a couple hundred feet away.

title: Currently Being Demolished And Cleaned!
comments: The value here is in the land. Triple lot in Thompsonville that has a current demolition and cleanup in progress to remove the old trailer pictured. The minimum bid for this sale will be increasing when the final demolition and cleanup costs are determined, which is not likely to be known until the day before the sale.

title: Betsie River Waterfront!
comments: Sales 906 and 907 are adjacent WATERFRONT lots on the Betsie River near Thompsonville ... and just 5 minutes from Crystal Mountain ! The raodfrontage for these two parcels is narrow ... and sits between the homes at 13896 and 13932 Leisure Drive. You may wish to consider combining these two for a quiet, private homesite ... or have a friend or relative next door ! The two parcels are at the end of a small peninsula that has water on 3 sides. This is a popular stretch of the Betsie with recreational users. Buy one ... or both !!

title: Fallin' Down House In Bendon. Two Parcels Here ...
comments: There are two parcels included in this sale, one contains a house with more holes than swiss cheese and a matching two story barn/garage type of structure... both beyond rational economic repair. The second parcel sits to the north and west across an alley, and runs to Kent Street on the north. Both parcels are lightly wooded and brushy. This parcel is being sold with #903. Please see that listing.

title: Crystal Lake Views: Very Nice Building Site Outside Of Beulah/benzonia
comments: This is a nice building site in the Orchard Hill/Crystal Lake Country Club area. There are some views of Crystal Lake from this parcel. Paved, county maintained roads, and the CCG&CC clubhouse is right across the street ! An area of very nice, well maintained, late century homes.

title: Vacant Parcel On The Benzie-Grand Traverse County Line.
comments: Parcel fronts 132 feet on the south side of Clay Road (private), and runs 99 feet deep. Part of this parcel appears to be wetlands. Check it out in person. There is a white/orange marker at what we believe is the NE corner/east line of this property.

title: Thirty Acres At E 11 Mile And N Birch Road.
comments: This is a partly wooded, 30 acre parcel, at the SE corner of the intersection of East 11 Mile Road and N Birch Road. Roughly 990x1320 feet in size. This lot is owned by the Michigan Department of Natural Resources and is offered for sale as part of the Department’s surplus lands disposition process. Surplus lands have been identified as being of little public recreational value for reasons such as small size, lack of legal access, lack of adjacency to other state lands suitable for recreation, or other similar deficiencies. The funds generated from these sales help DNR purchase and consolidate new state lands that are more suitable for public recreation and use.

title: Five Acres Without Legal Access.
comments: Rectangular 5 acre parcel. Landlocked by private ownership; Forested. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress. This lot is owned by the Michigan Department of Natural Resources and is offered for sale as part of the Department’s surplus lands disposition process. title: One Square Acre. Suttons Bay Township. No Road
comments: This is a "square acre", surrounded by the lands of the Grand Traverse Band and Cherry Bay Orchards Inc. You may wish to research records to determine if there are easement rights to access this parcel, as it does not front on any public road, nor does there appear to be any private road to get to it either. 208.75' x 208.75' in size. If you can get to it, it's a secluded location in a really desirable area. Nicely wooded lands here. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: 40 Acres In The Solon Swamp!
comments: Looking for a gift for that person that has everything ? How about 40 acres in the heart of the Solon swamp ? This is a square 40, 1320x1320, and the most efficient way to get to it is probably by water ... as it is about 1500 feet from South Lake Leelanau. There are no roads into this area (you'd sink), and power is thousands of feet from here. It is unlikely that there is any buildable portion of this property ... so its highest and best use is recreational and hunting land. There is likely a small fortune here in cedar (pun intended), but you'd be challenged getting it out of there. Also, it is quite likely that the property has no access. We would strongly suggest a detailed investigation of easement rights. This parcel has surface water, soil, or vegetation conditions indicating that it may include wetland habitat. Such habitat may comprise all or part of the parcel's area. However, it is possible that this parcel contains buildable areas as well. There are many environmental and building regulations related to wetlands which you should consult before bidding on this parcel. It is your responsibility to determine if this parcel is suitable for your desired use. Our visual inspection indicated that electrical service was not available on or near this parcel. The nearest electric service appeared to be a considerable distance (hundreds or perhaps thousands of feet) from the property. As such, electrifying this parcel could be costly. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: Forty Acres In Leelanau County!
comments: Bring your checkbooks, folks. This one will be highly sought after ! 40 acres near Gilbert Lake, 1.5 miles north of the Benzie County line in Kasson Township. The property has no direct road frontage on maintained streets, but has a 33' shared driveway easement off South Gilbert Road. The easement road is along the north line of the properties that share it, an just north of a fenced orchard area. The approximate west line of the parcel is most of the way down a steep hill on this rroad ... which was deeply rutted and not passable by vehicle ... when we were there in late June. The lands here are wooded and rolling ... with a maximum terrain change of about 30m (100 feet) from its highest points near the north line to the lowest at the SE corner. USGS topographical maps do not indicate there being any marshlands here. This is a VERY private location and would make a stellar camp or hunting spot in additional to much potential as an estate parcel. Property is well wooded and someone spent some moolah putting a gravel road in here that, with proper maintenance, will be sufficient access for this parcel. 39.9 acres calculated. Power is over 1000' feet away as a FYI ...

title: Older 1.5 Story Home In Maple City.
comments: This bundle of 4 properties has the following requirements for purchase: The purchaser will be required to demolish the house and garage located on parcel 007-002-035-00 at their own cost within 60 days of the sale. Prior to deed delivery, the purchaser will be required to furnish a personal guarantee and performance bond in the amount of $35,000 to assure this demolition or the land will revert back to county ownership. The performance bond and personal guarantee funding can be used for the demolition costs. Please contact the Treasurers office or auction house for complete details. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed. This property appears to lie within (under) the right-of-way of North Manitou Trail, which is also known as "North Omigisi Beach Road" locally. It is roughly 66' wide (the width of a road) x 625+ feet east to west.There are two things we can tell you based on that: (1) You can't build on a parcel that others have a r/o/w over, and (2) You can't prevent those with that right, from using it. Short version is that this parcel is probably only really of value to those who use the r/o/w over it ... and they can do that without paying the taxes ... so that's probably why we have it ! It may hold some other limited potential (bird houses ? laundry line ? outdoor bowling ?) but we'd urge you to consider the investment carefully prior to bidding. This parcel is too small to be practically useful under most circumstances. Many times such parcels are the result of survey or property transfer errors which create small orphaned slivers of land. These parcels are frequently too small to allow construction or any other practical use. They often have no road frontage or legal means of access. These parcels can often lead to adverse claims or encroachments by neighboring land owners which can be complicated legal issues to resolve. Please investigate this parcel thoroughly prior to bidding. This parcel is what we refer to as a 33'/66'. We frequently see foreclosed parcels that are either 33 or 66 feet wide. These parcels are often a result of existing or former road rights of way. A common road right of way is 66 feet wide. Half of that is 33 feet. There are two common scenarios that we see. Scenario 1: A land owner splits a tract of land and creates a common easement parcel for access. They might then quit paying taxes on the parcel with road frontage knowing that the easement would remain even after foreclosure. Such easements are generally either 33 or 66 feet wide. Scenario 2: Rural land generally runs to the center of any public road on which it fronts whereas subdivided land usually runs to the edge of the road right-of-way. Sometimes during surveys or other splits, half of the right-of-way (usually 33 feet) can become orphaned, effectively turning to no-man's-land. Potential bidders should be aware that 33 and 66 foot wide parcels are very likely to include easements. That means that there are people who have a right to use the property even though they do not own the land. It is unlawful to cut off access over a 33 or 66 foot parcel where an easement already exists. Even if an easement doesn't already exists, courts will frequently create such an easement to prevent a neighboring parcel from becoming landlocked. Potential bidders should consider that this parcel likely has little value and cannot be used to landlock a neighboring parcel when there is no other path for ingress and egress. This is a vacant parcel of irregular shape, and part of an abandon railroad r/o/w on the north cul-de-sac end of N. Dawn Haven Road. It may or may not have legal access from that road. 102' feet on the south, east and west lines, and 51' feet on the north side. Located just south of Northport, off M-22. There is a powerline r/o/w at the north end, and we see some wetlands indicators, but it rises in topography away fom the road. That being said, this is also an old railroad right-of-way, and there may be further impact of setbacks under zoning on a 51' parcel .... If you're interested in this one, walk it carefully and maybe consider having it surveyed or otherwise "make sure you know what you're bidding on". This is a parcel of land that lies to the west/southwest of South Ridgeview Trail, west of the Nabawnaga Shores plat. It is hillside topography and may have no legal access from the road depending on its exact location and the road r/o/w path. We'd suggest close investigation and perhaps a survey if you are interested in this one.

title: Mobile Home And 4.5 Acres In Empire Township!
comments: Adjacent parcels on Bow Road in Empire Township.This is a 4.51 acre parcel containing an older mobile home that has some issues, but appears to have *some* potential ... depending on how much elbow grease you're willing to put into it. The porch addition is shot, but the trailer itself seems solid ... just grubby and torn up. There is also a shed toward the center of the lot that likely was used for critters and was fenced once-upon-a-time. The lands roll downhill away from the road, and the rear quarter is likely marshy. Combined, these two parcels are 5 acres, with 330' feet along the west side of Bow Road, and running 660' feet deep. Adjacent parcels on Bow Road in Empire Township. This is a 100' (roadfront) x 183' deep parcel right next door to the 4.51 acre parcel bundled with this. There is a concrete slab and power service here that scream "mobile home". We could not find a separate well from the one to the north, so it's possible they may share well and septic ... which you will want to consider if you had not already. The lands roll downhill away from the road. Combined, these two parcels are 5 acres, with 330' feet along the west side of Bow Road, and running 660' feet deep. This parcel is the 100'x183' foot part out of the NE corner of that combined parcel. This parcel appears to include an area where a mobile home was previously located. Such mobile home pads will frequently include well/water and septic/sewer connections as well as power hookups. However, local zoning regulations may prohibit placing a new mobile home on this site despite the fact that one was previously located here. Please check local zoning regulations carefully prior to bidding. We make no representations or warranties as to the suitability of this parcel for any purpose.

title: Parcel In Fife Lake. Access Issues.
comments: This parcel is in the center of a block in Fife Lake, that is bordered by 2nd Street to the north, and Pierce Street to the west. Streets which were platted to the south and west were never improved. This parcel does not appear to have any improved access to it from either 2nd or Pierce across other properties as a stated right on the face of conveyance documents, but there may be rights that a deeper title search or an action for prescriptive easement might uncover. The parcel was split from another in 2006, so you should be able to gain access through that parcel. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: Nice Building Site On Cedar Run Road
comments: Unplatted lands with no POA or deed restrictions, west of Traverse City on Cedar Run Road. Fronts 160 feet along the road and runs 360 feet deep. Has a nice pine grove to the rear, and a few large oaks here at the front also. A great building site in one of the fastest growing communities in the State. Build your new home here !

title: Vacant Parcel Near Duck Lake At Interlochen!
comments: Parcel is at the intersection of Strawberry Point Road and Strickland. This parcel is about 1/2 acre in size, and walking distance to the north end of popular Duck Lake. Soils here are "moist" and you will want to check with building and health department officials regarding suitability for construction, if that is your end use. This property is subject to a SPECIAL ASSESSMENT that you will wish to investigate. The balance due is added to the annual property tax bill in equal installments until paid. This property includes an outstanding special assessment. Local units of government often borrow money for projects such as streets, water/sewer, lighting, and other public infrastructure improvements. These costs are then assess to the owners of affected property over a period of years in installments added to the annual tax bill. All past installments of these assessments are included in the minimum bid price. The purchaser assumes liability for all future installments of these assessments. We would advise prospective bidders to investigate the balance due on all special assessments as well as the ongoing annual cost before bidding.

title: Single Lot In Peninsular Shores Plat. East Side Of Duck Lake. Interlochen.
comments: This parcel is located on the Duck Lake peninsula in the Peninsular Shores plat. Roughly 1/3 acre in size. There is standing water to be seen on this parcel, and USGS topographical maps indicate that it is marshlands. There is a driveway cut in to the lot, and there may have been improvements here in the past that have been removed. You will want to consult with a specialist in wetlands development science and law if you're considering building here. It may also have value as a wetlands mitigation program parcel. This parcel is subject to a SPECIAL ASSESSMENT, which balance is addedd to annual tax bills in equal installments until paid in full. This property includes an outstanding special assessment. Local units of government often borrow money for projects such as streets, water/sewer, lighting, and other public infrastructure improvements. These costs are then assess to the owners of affected property over a period of years in installments added to the annual tax bill. All past installments of these assessments are included in the minimum bid price. The purchaser assumes liability for all future installments of these assessments. We would advise prospective bidders to investigate the balance due on all special assessments as well as the ongoing annual cost before bidding.

title: Allllmost An Acre. Karlin
comments: 4 lots in the original plat of Karlin, located just south of Interlochen. This measures out at over 3/4 acre. This is probably not a maintained road, but there are several other residents on it. Level, dry, nicely wooded property, less than 30 minutes from popular Traverse City.

title: Double Lot In Delormes Subdivision Near Interlochen And Karlin.
comments: We have roughly 1/4 acre here, located right on the Karlin Road, a couple miles south of Duck and Green Lakes. This is really nice, dry, level wooded lands that should be a great building site. Oaks, poplar and ferns are in abundance here. On a county maintained highway, and walking distance to downtown Karlin !!!

title: Vacant Parcel In Canterbury Woods Near Traverse City !!
comments: Sales 2303, 2304 and 2305 are three lots in the well established "Canterbury Woods" subdivision, and front on Garfield Road, across the street more or less from Wrights Furniture. The approach to these lots is hillside, and you'll need to consider how to best get a driveway in considering the terrain and somewhat unforgiving speed of the traffic here. Sale 2304 and 2405 are *adjacent* lots, and there is potential for purchasing both for a nice, large homesite! The parcels sit about 10 feet above road grade. This lot sits to the rear of the home at 1953 Lardie Road, and is nicely wooded, and in the Forest Lakes area south east of Traverse City. Natural gas here. Possible POA active. Buy one or both !!

title: Lot In Canterbury Woods Near Traverse City !
comments: Sales 2303, 2304 and 2305 are three lots in the well established "Canterbury Woods" subdivision, and front on Garfield Road, across the street more or less from Wrights Furniture. The approach to these lots is hillside, and you'll need to consider how to best get a driveway in considering the terrain and somewhat unforgiving speed of the traffic here. title: Vacant Lot In Canterbury Woods, Traverse City !
comments: Sales 2303, 2304 and 2305 are three lots in the well established "Canterbury Woods" subdivision, and front on Garfield Road, across the street more or less from Wrights Furniture. The approach to these lots is hillside, and you'll need to consider how to best get a driveway in considering the terrain and somewhat unforgiving speed of the traffic here. Sale 2303 is a single lot, and is irregular in shape. Of the ones we are offering, it has the most difficult driveway approach expectation, as it sits close to 20 feet above road grade. The topside of the lot is irregular in shape, and it sits to the rear of the home at 1923 Lardie Road. The parcel is 34,000 square feet, which is roughly 3/4 of an acre. Nicely wooded, and in the Forest Lakes area south east of Traverse City. Natural gas here. Possible POA active here.

title: Mobile And Large Garage Near Grawn
comments: This is an older roofover mobile and detached oversized garage neear Grawn in Blair Township. It is in the Brentwood Place plat, and is situated on a corner lot nicely wooded in pines. It has a secluded setting, well screened from neighbors. The mobile is cluttered, but appears to be solid other than some ceiling panels that need to be reattached. The unit is dated and a little dirty, but nothing a weekend of cleaning would not remedy. It does not appear that this was winterized, and there is some visible evidence of freeze damage to plumbing. The last occupancy here may have been 2009 according to dated materials we found inside. Has 2 bedrooms and one bath, plus a decent enclosed porch. The garage is roughly 24x36, with an 8x8 and a 10x12 overhead door which would accomodate a small RV or boat. There is a newer 100A electrical service in the mobile. Natural gas here, and the property is served by a local PRIVATE water system instead of a well or municipal system. Overall, this is a solid property which could be restored with a minimum of effort. It is also one of the few mobiles in this subdivision and you could remove it and upgrade to a modular or stickbuilt home.

title: Vacant 2.2 Acre Parcel Just East Of The Gt County Fairgrounds
comments: Parcel is 198 feet (north-south) x 465 feet (east-west), which = 2.2 acres, more or less. To access it, take Blair Town Hall to Cone Tree Road (a private road, which runs along the east boundary of the fairgrounds fence). Take Cone Tree 850 feet to the north, and then go east about 800 feet on the first of two "two track" roads to reach the parcel. This is a private, shared road with 2 other properties. The parcel is level and nicely wooded in pines and maples, with a nice fern floor. This is a nice, secluded parcel with several potential uses including residence or storage based upon zoning. We saw wild turkey here ... and assume that wildlife is abundant

title: 1.82 Acre Parcel In Hoosier Valley !!
comments: Hoosier Valley has long been a recreational gem, not on the radar of many folks. We have a hillside lot here, that currently contains a mobile, which could be updated, or removed and replaced with a new home. This parcel is surrounded by large tracts of land, including 116 acres of state land that is adjacent all along the south line of this parcel. This parcel has an east line that runs 400 feet or so from the road, and the south line perhaps about 420 feet, measuring out to about 1.82 acres more or less. Hoosier Valley crosses the parcel from the SW to NE corner. The trailer here is old, and plain, but solid. The front door is in disrepair and will need some work, but otherwise, it's already pretty much empty and ready to rock. We did not see a well, but there is plumbing, inferring that mayyybe the well is under the trailer. This is a sharp hillside lot with hard and soft woods, and is in a very serene setting. Do not miss this one !

title: Two Story Home Off 41St St In Allegan.
comments: This house sits on approx 2 acres. Mostly grassy with a few large trees. Two bedroom one bathroom home. Small wood patio on front entrance. There is a basement entrance on the side of home. Large wood patio wraps around side of home and ends on the other side. House is in good shape however the second story floors are warped in certain areas. There is a broken window which has allowed some birds to take up residence. Vinyl siding looks good. Small shed at the end of dirt driveway. There is also a second shed/storage building that looks as though it was used as a workshop. Some pine trees in the back yard. Nice quiet area for a small family. Overall this is a decent house that would not take much work to fix up. A little TLC would go a long way.

title: Nice Two Story Home That Sits Next To Beautiful Pond In Allegan
comments: Abandoned house that has been empty for many years sits on approx 10 acres. Three bedrooms, two bathrooms. Vinyl siding looks good. Large wood deck on front and back of home. There is a small storage shed on the property thats in decent shape. This house has a long dirt driveway that runs through the woods giving the house some privacy from the road. Very peaceful location. The back porch looks out on a beautiful pond. WIldlife all around. I spotted a fox and a few herrings while i was there. There is a some grafitti on the home. Someone spray painted "Toxic Mold" on the doors. The house does have mold but it hasnt ravaged the house yet. It is in the early stages. when the power was shut up the sub pumps were unable to run and the basement flooded. You can tell there was about 2-3 feet of water in the basement at one time but has since drained out. I dont believe to much damage was caused by this. AC. Mix of carpet and linoleum. This is a nice house that will need a few repairs done but the location is phenominal. This building contains evidence of mold. Mold is an indication of excess moisture which can come from a variety of sources including high ground water, improper sealing of foundation walls, damaged roofs, and other conditions which can be expensive to correct. Mold can pose significant health risks and, if extensive, may require a complete renovation which could exceed the value of the building. Please conduct your own research and bid accordingly.

title: Vacant Lot With Foundation Of Old House.

title: Large Abandoned Commercial Building In Hartford.
comments: This large commercial building sit on approx 3.83 acres that touches County Road 687 and Territorial Road in Hartford. A third party told me this was once a winery. There are three metal barn/storage buildings on the east portion of the property. They contain a lot of debris but look to be in fair condition. The size of the main building is quite substantial. It takes a few minutes to complete a circle around it. There is an office type section in the front of the building. Old gas station hook ups in the back. Most of the windows have been broken out. The ceiling has collapsed in certain areas allowing nature to run its course. This is a very interesting building to walk around but it is dangerous. Wood deck on the side of home with slider doors. Kitchen is in poor shape. Ceiling has caved in. Food and garbage all through out house. Basement is damp and has mold growing on portions of the drywall. Block foundation looks good Except for one small portion on back of home. Dirt driveway runs long side of home and leads to a dettached one car garage. Roof on the garage is in poor shape. House sits on approx 0.20 acres One or more buildings on this parcel has a roof which is either leaking to the interior or appears close to failure. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: One Story Building That Was Once A Church Off N Westnedge Ave In Parchment.

The block foundation/walls have been repaired with what looks like cement. It has one large open room. One half bathrom and a clost. Large lawn on the north section of property. Building will need some repairs but is in decent condition.

title: One Story Building Off 6Th St Near Alamo Elementary School.
comments: One story home that sits on approx 0.17 acres.It looks like the front of this building was an addition built onto the home. Dirt driveway on front of property. A few trees on proeprty. There has been alot of poor construction work done on this home. There are signs that they were growing "something" inside. One of the rooms has been turned into a grow room. Large garage front. Poor roof conditions. Part of the garage ceiling has fallen in. Wet inside. Mold is starting to grow on walls. This parcel has been posted as "Condemned" by the local building authority. Properties are generally condemned when they are deemed substandard, unsafe, or otherwise unfit for use and habitation. Condemned property must be rehabilitated to meet local building codes prior to use or occupancy. A building is not automatically slated for demolition when condemned. However, this does not necessarily mean that demolition will not also be pursued by the local unit. Please check with the local building official before bidding to determine the specific status and requirements for this property. This building contains evidence of mold. Mold is an indication of excess moisture which can come from a variety of sources including high ground water, improper sealing of foundation walls, damaged roofs, and other conditions which can be expensive to correct. Mold can pose significant health risks and, if extensive, may require a complete renovation which could exceed the value of the building. Please conduct your own research and bid accordingly.

This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

title: Two Story Home On Illionios St In Residential Neighborhood.
comments: This two story home has four bedrooms and two bathrooms. The basement is finished and has a living room, kitchen, bedroom, and bathroom. Smelled a bit damp but there wasn't and visible mold. The main floor has a living room sporting two fireplaces. Two bedrooms a bathroom and kitchen. The second story floor has a one large bedroom that's separated by a door in the middle. Cement driveway runs along side of home and leads to a mudroom/storage room. The roof has collapsed in this room. Fenced in grassy back yard that has a storage shed in the middle. There is a roofed in cement patio that gets natural light with some plastic sections of the roof. A little TLC would go a long way with this one. Give this house a deep clean and do some small repairs and this would be a good home for a larger family or a good rental. Electric was still on.

title: Three Story Home On Marjorie St
comments: This house has a condemnation notice and a notice that this house had drugs manufactured in it at one time. Large home with beautiful wood work through out. Large living and dining room on main floor. Two bedrooms and a bathroom on the second floor and one large room on the third floor. Basement is full height and has studs built to create separate rooms. Cement driveway runs along side of home and leads to a detached one car garage. Its a shame this house was abused by the last residents because it really is a beautiful home. Some one with a little money could fix this home up and bring it back to its former glory. foundation sound. Roof showed no leaks. Enclosed windowed mud room on front entrance. Nice neighbors that came to say hello. Fenced in back yard. This parcel has been posted as "Condemned" by the local building authority. title: Nice Commercial Property On Corner Of Goguac St And 28Th St.
comments: This is a nice commercial building that has some offices built in the front and a large cement floor work area on the other side. Over all this is a really nice commercial building. Good place for a car repair store.

Good starter home for small family.

title: Two Story Home Off Burr Oak Street In Albion. Nice Neighborhood.

title: Large Two Story Brick Home (4 Apartments) Off W Center St In Albion
comments: This large brick building sits on approx 0.14 acres near downtown Albion. There is a notice stated that this building is dangerous. This house have been renovated into 4 separate units. They very in condition. There are two apartments on the second floor and main floor. APT 2A on the second floor has a large living room, one full bathroom and two bedrooms. One of the bedrooms has a door that leads to the attic. breaker box is in the living room. There is debris through out the apt and the kitchen has food and other garbage dumped about. This apt is in fair shape not much danger here. APT 2B next door has one bedroom and one bathroom. There is debris from the last tenants such as beds and other home materials. The breaker box is in the living room. This is a smaller apt in fair condition no large warning signs. The ceiling in the hallway on the second floor has partially collapsed. APT 1B has one bedroom and one bathroom. The closet in this apt has a bit of mold. Full bathroom only has a shower. This apartment is in decent shape but the mold is a concern. APT 1A on the back of the home has one large one bedroom and one bathroom that only has a stand up shower. There is a large living room that leads to the bedroom which has a smaller room to the side of it. This could be considered a room since it has a closet but it is very small. Large kitchen. The entrance to the basement is in this apartment. The basement seemed a little wet. There is some mold starting to form. The main floor wood structure is starting to blacken in certain areas. The breaker boxes for the main floor apartments are in the basement. Debris through out basement. The water heaters have been removed. The apartments have their own individual room heaters so there are no furnaces in the basement. There is a cement parking spot on the back of the property that could fit two vehicles. 4 of the 5 gas meters have been removed. This house isn't in to bad of shape. The mold needs to be addressed and I suspect some of the roof needs to be repaired. The brick exterior looks nice. This could be a nice building for someone looking to rent. title: Nearly 200,000 Square Feet Of Commercial Space In Marshall! Includes Warehouse And Office Complex With Lighted Parking Areas!
comments: ATTN: NO ONLINE OR ABSENTEE BIDDING FOR THIS PARCEL. Eligible bidders must provide a $50,000 certified funds deposit made out to Title-Check LLC Customer Escrow Account in order to register the day of the sale. Registration will begin at 10AM on-site followed by a tour before the auction begins (ONLY registered bidders will be allowed to tour the facilities). There are substantial mold issues inside these buildings, so it is suggested that bidders bring a face mask or respirator with them. This lot consists of a bundle of 5 separate parcels in Marshall. The properties together were formerly an office/warehouse complex for State Farm Insurance. The bundle includes a large commercial warehouse, a large office building, and several paved and lighted asphalt parking lots. The commercial warehouse building (53-001-961-00) is in pretty decent shape. About 1/3 of this building formerly housed a call center. This portion of the building is outfitted with cubicles and appears to be wired for a large-scale telecommunications operation. Much of the telephone infrastructure appears to be intact but its conditions/operability is unknown. The call center portion of the building is a little musty from being vacant for an extended period of time but appears to have stayed relatively dry. Some mold may be present. The electrical system is still intact and appears to be functional. The lights were working during our inspection. The boilers and air handling system have not been removed but their functionality could not be verified. The building's security infrastructure also appeared to be in place but its functionality also could not be verified. The warehouse space comprises approximately 2/3 of the overall space in this building and is substantial. This portion of the building appears to have remained dry and doesn't have any lingering odor suggesting otherwise. This space contains a vast grid of shelving units approximately 20 feet in height that apparently housed inventory at one point. There is a loading bay with several overhead doors that appear to be fully functional. The parking lot portions of this lot (53-001-963-00, 965-00, and 966-00) appear to be in relatively good shape. There were no glaring signs of frost heaving or large-scale breakup of the asphalt. There is some cracking as is typical of older pavement and some plant growth throughout. Overall, though, the parking lots are decent. All of the parking areas appear to be lighted. The functionality of the outdoor lighting was not verified but most if not all of the parking lighting appeared to be intact. The second building (53-002-270-00) was formerly used as an office and executive complex. This property includes a reception area, abundant office and cubicle space, training rooms, conference space, an equipped kitchen and cafeteria, and a loading bay. Most of the building infrastructure appears to be in place. The electrical system appears largely intact and has not been stripped. The lights were working during our inspection. The boilers and air handling system also appear to be in place and have not been removed. However, their functionality and condition could not be verified. This space has been vacant for a significant period of time and has seen significant water intrusion. Mold is prevalent, particularly in the eastern portion of the building where it is abundant. Damp carpeting and floors were observed in some portions of the building and there is a noticeable odor. The basement has also experienced significant water damage. Despite the water damage, the bones of this office building appear to be in relatively good shape. We didn't notice any significant decay to the building facade or foundation. However, the roof clearly needs repair to address the water issue and significant work would be required to rehab the interior. NOTE: If this lot is not sold on the September 30th auction, it will be offered at the Calhoun County no-minimum auction on October 31st. However, if sold at the no-reserve auction, the buyer will be required to furnish a $750,000 performance bond to the Calhoun county treasurer in order to assure that the north property identified as parcel number 53-002-270-00 is demolished or renovated/ redeveloped by 12/31/18. A complete demolition project will be signified by total site clearance and a final permit inspection and sign off by the City of Marshal. Likewise, a finalized renovation/redevelopment project will be demonstrated by obtaining a certificate of occupancy from the City of Marshall. This building contains evidence of mold. title: Downtown Storefront In Ontonagon
comments: This is one half of the building that formerly contained the "Captains" Restaurant and Lounge. We are offering ONLY THE LOUNGE half of the property ... even though they are connected on the interior ... This property has a weak floor back in the kitchen, and it looks as though roof issues may be starting on the one story flat roof. This property has been vacant for probably nearing a decade now, and the two halves have been through a parade of owners, some of whom only bought it to remove its contents and then let it go again. It may be a worthwhile project for someone to acquire the other half ... as well as the building to the right/east, and re-establish a business here. The building is still restorable, but will require some elbow grease and investment. This is a very visible location in Ontonagons Central Business District. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.
