title: Vacant Lot In Presque Isle Harbor
comments: ATTN: NO ONLINE OR ABSENTEE BIDDING FOR THIS BUNDLED PARCEL. Presque Isle Harbor is a resort and recreation paradise nestled in a bay located not far north of Alpena.In this area, dozens of subdivision plats were laid out in the last half of the 20th century. There are thousands of lots in these subdivisions. It was a very optimistic venture that anticpated hundreds of vacation and retirement homes. Growth here did not meet the expectations of the original developers, and while the lots sold briskly, construction of homes lagged at a relatively slow pace for much the last 30 years.Many of the roads in the subdivisions have few homes and a good number have none at all. Those closest to the water and amenities are understandably the most populated and improved, and buyers would be well advised to study the aerial maps available on this website to determine those areas in the development that have attracted the most construction.But for those seeking solitude, this development has plenty of that to offer as well. There are numerous pockets in these subdivisions, where you can quite literally have the entire neighborhood to yourself if that is to your liking. The area is served by county maintained roads, mostly paved, and a private water system that provide water utility to most every lot.There is a strong and ambitious property owners association (POA) here, which offers a clubhouse with pool, beach access, a campground and many other assets to members. We have linked to the POA website, where you can find much information relating to both the area and the associations benefits. The website is located at http://presqueisleharbor.org/association.shtml<p>+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++<p>We should note that these lots are not suited to "flipping" experiments. The association and water authority are quite serious about collecting their dues and quarterly water fees. Buying lots here is recommended for those who have an intention to keep and use them personally, and not for speculators. <p>++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ </p><p> PLEASE NOTE: In addition to the final bid price and summer taxes, a purchaser will be required to post a CASH BOND within 10 days of the sale in the amount of $20,000.00 for the purpose of assuring payment of the summer and winter property taxes for these parcels for the period 2016 to 2020. The purchaser shall be allowed to draw against this bond for purposes of making the annual property tax payments for all of the lots in this bundle with the permission of the seller during that time period. The bond shall require express authority of the seller to make any draws, payments or other debits against its balance. The cash bond shall be created to the satisfaction of the seller within the 10 days period following sale, or the sale will be cancelled, no deed issued, and no refund made of the purchase price or summer tax payment. </p> If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information. This sale includes one or more parcels which are considered nuisance, contaminated, potentially contaminated, unkept, obsolete and/or blighted properties. In the public interest, the Foreclosing Governmental Unit ("FGU") has determined that these nuisances require abatement as a condition of sale. In order to bid on this auction lot any prospective purchaser MUST submit a detailed written plan to the office of the FGU (County Treasurer) not later than close of business five business days prior to the date of auction. In this written plan the offeror must identify the deficiencies it recognizes in EACH parcel offered. Specify what abatement plan it has for EACH property specifically, the timetable of this abatement, and the identity, contact information and qualifications of the person(s) who will perform the work. This auction lot will ONLY be available to auction bidders that have submitted such a written plan to the FGU prior to the time and date noted, and whose plan is ACCEPTED by the FGU, in its sole discretion, as being in the interest of the public in abatement of the nuisance(s). Lot # 8240 contains 148 properties in this bundle will be required to be demolished by the purchaser. Estimated cost of demolition is $904,000.00, which a performance bond must be posted to cover. The offeror should also consider offering a personal guarantee or other surety to assure completion of the proposed work in its written plan. If there are no satisfactory proposals, then no bids will be accepted and the property will be deemed as offered but unsold. All decisions of the FGU are final. There will be no negotiation of terms or plans. Please make your plan as parcel-specific and detailed as possible. Incomplete or insufficient proposals shall be rejected without detailed comment.

title: Cottage In The Woods
comments: Charming older block home in a nice wooded setting. This cottage is open to the elements. There are extensive personal items and debris needing to be removed. Bundled with adjacent parcel. It is the responsibility of the bidder/buyer to have researched the property prior to auction. You should check with your local unit for any Notices of Condemnation, Dangerous Bldg. or Unsafe Structure, requirement to rehab structure, assessments not forgiven due to foreclosure.

title: 25X135 Lot In Nichols Point Subdivision. Bois Blanc Island !
comments: Nichols Point subdivision is southwest of the Plaunt Ferry dock on the Southeast side of the island at Rosie Point. The individual lots here are typically 25x135 feet in size. Lands are generally dry and buildable, and have primitive roads. We suggest checking the county GIS mapping system for location assistance at http://www.mackinaccounty.net/departments/gis/ and then "fetch the online map viewer" Note: GPS coordinate is not exact. It indicates the approximate location of the parcels in this bundle. For Reference Only. This lot is owned by the Michigan Department of Natural Resources and is offered for sale as part of the Department’s surplus lands disposition process. Surplus lands have been identified as being of little public recreational value for reasons such as small size, lack of legal access, lack of adjacency to other state lands suitable for recreation, or other similar deficiencies. The funds generated from these sales help DNR purchase and consolidate new state lands that are more suitable for public recreation and use.

title: Older, Well Used Home In Onaway
comments: Older 1.5 story home on a corner lot in Onaway. Aluminum sided, will need a good cleanout and overall repair. The the front door is weathered and should be replaced, and the siding will need a good power washing. Someone has begun a remodel here, and then stopped. A new window has been framed into the front. Needs a general resurfacing and decor enhancements ... as well as general mechanical system overhaul. The structure appears to be solid and straight, but very grubby. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. Buildings which are dangerous, occupied, boarded, condemned, or otherwise difficult to enter are inspected from the exterior/curbside only. You are NOT authorized to enter these or any other buildings offered for sale. You should limit your inspection to that which can be made safely from the building's exterior. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed. Older mobile home with a well constructed steel roofover. Has a detached 2 car garage that appears to be in solid overall condition and newer overhead doors. We see broken windows, the yard has overgrown, and there are other various signs that this property has not been occupied in a while. There is still personal property belonging to the last owner here, and you'll want to make an effort at contact to see if they lay claim to any of it.The property appears to be in reasonable condition for what it is, and it probably would not be a huge task to make it merchantable again. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

The siding is warped and in need or replacement in several areas. There are some newer windows and doors. We would characterize this one as grubby, but restorable. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. Buildings which are dangerous, occupied, boarded, condemned, or otherwise difficult to enter are inspected from the exterior/curbside only. You are NOT authorized to enter these or any other buildings offered for sale. You should limit your inspection to that which can be made safely from the building's exterior.

title: Small Parcel On Spens Road Near Cr 646
comments: This is a small, vacant parcel that fronts on the Spens Road, just south of County Road 646. It is 30x80, and likely not big enough to build on ... however you could always approach neighboring property owners and see if they would sell. It also may make an interesting, low budget camp spot near Lake Huron and Ocqueoc. Unlike most of the other parcels we get in this area, this one actually fronts 30' on a "real" road ! There is a trail that runs right through the middle of this lot where it meets the road, and a culvert has been installed. Because of the small size of the lot, we can't be sure without a survey, but it appears this parcel is just south of the culvert. This parcel is too small to be practically useful under most circumstances. Many times such parcels are the result of survey or property transfer errors which create small orphaned slivers of land. These parcels are frequently too small to allow construction or any other practical use. They often have no road frontage or legal means of access. These parcels can often lead to adverse claims or encroachments by neighboring land owners which can be complicated legal issues to resolve. Please investigate this parcel thoroughly prior to bidding.

title: Parcel With No Road Access - Hammond Bay Area
comments: This parcel is 30x80 in size, but has no improved road to it. It may have some "legal access", but you'll have to walk in. Check local records to see if any un-vacated, platted roads or easements may exist to this parcel. This is several hunderd feet off CR 646 This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: Cruddy Old Mobile Near Posen
comments: This mobile is probably best repurposed as scrap metal. It has been vacant for several years and has not been maintained. It has a solid looking roofover, however the leanto front porch is visibly decayed and weak and should be removed. The value here, if they're still good, is in the well and septic. The lot is 150x280, level, open and dry. Would make a a nice spot for a new home or replacement mobile if zoning permits. This parcel appears to include an area where a mobile home was previously located. Such mobile home pads will frequently include well/water and septic/sewer connections as well as power hookups. However, local zoning regulations may prohibit placing a new mobile home on this site despite the fact that one was previously located here. Please check local zoning regulations carefully prior to bidding. We make no representations or warranties as to the suitability of this parcel for any purpose.

title: Parcel With No Road Access - Partly Submerged.
comments: This parcel is 1/4 acre in size and irregular in shape, but has no improved road to it. It may have some "legal access", but you'll have to walk in. Check local records to see if any un-vacated, platted roads or easements may exist to this parcel This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: Parcel With No Road Access - Maccombers Island
comments: This parcel is about 1/2 acre, and irregular in shape, but has no improved road to it. It may have some "legal access", but you'll have to walk in. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. title: Occupied Older Country House Near Posen
comments: This is an older home near Posen that was OCCUPIED when we were near there in May. It has been modernized with vinyl siding and a newer roof, both of which appear to need some repair. Some of the siding has either blown off ... or may not have been completed. Because it is occupied, we did not have the opportunity to view the home in detail. We suspect it is not more than 2 bedrooms. It's a fairly small structure. Parcel is 137x238 in size. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property. This property is occupied. Please respect the privacy of current occupants and limit any inspection to what can be safely observed from the road. Some occupants may be upset or angry and may meet contact with aggression or violence. Please use discretion and caution when researching this or other occupied properties. Furthermore, although this property has been foreclosed for unpaid taxes, occupants have certain rights under Michigan law and must be formally evicted if unwilling to leave voluntarily. You may wish to consult a licensed attorney for more information. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. Buildings which are dangerous, occupied, boarded, condemned, or otherwise difficult to enter are inspected from the exterior/curbside only. You are NOT authorized to enter these or any other buildings offered for sale. You should limit your inspection to that which can be made safely from the building's exterior.

title: Vacant Lot In Presque Isle Harbor
comments: Presque Isle Harbor is a resort and recreation paradise nestled in a bay located not far north of Alpena. In this area, dozens of subdivision plats were laid out in the last half of the 20th century. There are thousands of lots in these subdivisions. It was a very optimistic venture that anticpated hundreds of vacation and retirement homes. Growth here did not meet the expectations of the original developers, and while the lots sold briskly, construction of homes lagged at a relatively slow pace for much the last 30 years. Many of the roads in the subdivisions have few homes and a good number have none at all. Those closest to the water and amenities are understandably the most populated and improved, and buyers would be well advised to study the aerial maps available on this website to determine those areas in the development that have attracted the most construction. But for those seeking solitude, this development has plenty of that to offer as well. There are numerous pockets in these subdivisions, where you can quite literally have the entire neighborhood to yourself if that is to your liking. The area is served by county maintained roads, mostly paved, and a private water system that provide water utility to most every lot. There is a strong and ambitious property owners association (POA) here, which offers a clubhouse with pool, beach access, a campground and many other assets to members. We have linked to the POA website, where you can find much information relating to both the area and the associations benefits. The website is located at http://presqueisleharbor.org/association.shtml We should note that these lots are not suited to "flipping" experiments. The association and water authority are quite serious about collecting their dues and quarterly water fees. Buying lots here is recommended for those who have an intention to keep and use them personally, and not for speculators. This parcel is likely subject to ASSOCIATION FEES which are assessed to cover maintenance and other costs associated with the development in which the parcel is located. Interested parties should verify the existence and extent of association fees and costs prior to bidding.

title: Vacant Building Lots At Rainbow Lake!
comments: Sale parcels 7705 and 7706 are vacant, wooded building sites at Rainy Lake, which is a private association in south-central Presque Isle County. Roads and other amenities here are for the use of members only, and there is a waterfront access area shared by the offfwater membership. The lots are level, wooded and dry. This is a nice, serene spot. Each parcel is roughly 60x300. Buy one or both ! See parcel 7705 for most of the photos. Level dry wooded lands, almost right across the street from the public boat launch !! The adjacent lot is for sale as # 7704. Buy one or both !!

title: Lane 52: Vermillion Lane.  Surf Park
comments: This is a vacant, wooded parcel in Surf Park. It is the resort home area north of Grace and the Hammond Bay Refuge Harbor where the lanes are numbered. Vermillion Lane is #52. This is the first (corner) lot on the left/north side of the road after you cross Pine Tree Lane, which connects all of the lanes east of US 23. Generally there is access to Lake Huron at the road end of these lanes for pedestrian and beach walking purposes.

title: Vacant Building Site In The Grace/hammond Bay Harbor Area.
comments: This is a 1/4 acre building site just up the road from the Hammond Bay Refuge Harbor and boat launch on Lake Huron. The lot is nicely wooded, generally level and appears dry from a cursory examination. This is a quiet, resort area near the Lake Huron shoreline.

title: Parcel With No Road Access Off 6 Mile Highway - Allis Twp
comments: This parcel is 264x165 in size, but has no improved road to it. It may have some "legal access", but you'll have to walk in. Check local records to see if any un-vacated, platted roads or easements may exist to this parcel This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: Vacant Lot In Alpena
comments: 0.2 acres. 66' on the road x 132' deep. Brushy. There is an overhead utility easement along the east line of this parcel. Parcel is directly across the street from 2363 LaForest Avenue.

title: Cute Classic Home In Alpena.
comments: Cute older home in Alpena. Vinyl sided, with a roof that appears to be mid-life. White picket fence. Looks like a place Opie and Aunt Bea would live. There is a one car detached garage. The home "looks like" a 1.5 story, but is just one floor and an unfinished basement. Inside it is dated, with a substandard amateur kitchen and bathroom rehab. However it still has the riginal claw foot tub which could be reused. There is much of the original wood trim here under many layers of paint, and the wood flooring is pine under the old warn carpet which is all pretty well shot. The basement is full height, dry, clean and unfinished. This would be a great little starter or retirement pad that would be great for someone with an interest in stripping all the woodwork and bringing it back to its original glory.

title: Alpena Rehabbers Special
comments: Special Assessment #119 114.49 due this year, contact the City of Alpena for calculation of the total balance to be assumed. 0.07 acres There is evidence posted which indicates that a lender may be attempting to foreclose upon this parcel after such parcel was foreclosed for delinquent property taxes. A purchaser may encounter future contact from this lender. Tax foreclosure supersedes the rights of mortgage holders. If a mortgage holder does not foreclose upon their mortgage interest prior to tax foreclosure, their right to do so is generally lost. Typically such mortgage holders were provided all necessary notice of tax foreclosure but failed to act in a timely fashion to preserve their interest. In rare instances it may be necessary to cancel a sale if a deficiency in notice to such a lender is discovered. Please contact us or ask questions at the sale if you have concerns about this issue. This property includes an outstanding special assessment. Local units of government often borrow money for projects such as streets, water/sewer, lighting, and other public infrastructure improvements. These costs are then assess to the owners of affected property over a period of years in installments added to the annual tax bill. All past installments of these assessments are included in the minimum bid price. The purchaser assumes liability for all future installments of these assessments. We would advise prospective bidders to investigate the balance due on all special assessments as well as the ongoing annual cost before bidding.

comments: Site of a former home that has been demolished and is now a vacant lot. (SEV subject to change after purchase) Offers opportunity for adjacent property owners to expand their yards. title: 4.58 Acres In Industrial Park. Some Marshlands.
comments: 4.58 acres, located in an Industrial property use area north of Alpena. The front portion of this lot is a FROG FARM and is roughly 2 acres of nothing but muck and cat tails. The balance of the property may contain some uplands, but you'll need to probably have this parcel reviewed by a wetlands consultant to determine what you can do with it. It holds excellent potential as a swap parcel for a wetlands mitigation proposal if you are a land developer looking for such a property. This parcel has surface water, soil, or vegetation conditions indicating that it may include wetland habitat. Such habitat may comprise all or part of the parcel's area. It is your responsibility to determine if this parcel is suitable for your desired use.

comments: 2.15 acres. Contains an older mobile that is in pretty decent age for its age. One car garage. Fuel oil heat. Parcel is 417.42' x 225.21' in size. The lands in this area are "moist", and we saw some surface water in the area. Setting is a quiet country road, great wildlife area. title: Home On 1 Acre Parcel Near Alpena.
comments: 2 bedroom, 2 bath house with tons of potential on a 1 acre lot less than 10 miles from town. Features a large rec room, attached 2-car garage, partially finished basement, and pole barn on property. This is a great opportunity not to miss! The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. title: Country Home, Pole Barn, Ten Acres In Sanborn Township!
comments: 10 acres square here. Mid century 1.5 story home is tidy and efficient. Vinyl siding and a newer architectural shingle roof. Interior is dated and in need of updating. Coved ceiling in living room, and some wood flooring. Basement is partly finished and second level has a finished room in the front. We suspect there is freeze damaged plumbing here. Outbuilding is open to the elements in the rear, but has potential from dry storage if finished. Older mechanicals could use updating. Probably the original kitchen and bath. Has tons of potential as a starter or retirement place for someone looking for a country setting. Located on a paved, maintained county road. There are the remnants of an old barn here, that could probably just be burned. The quonset type structure is open to the elements at the rear and should probably get some "beefing up" if you plan to keep it. This property contains physical indications that one or more water lines have frozen, ruptured, and leaked for a significant period of time prior to being shut off. Such indications can include damage to ceilings and floors and visibly damaged pipes and fixtures. Damage from freeze bursts can be substantial including significant harm to structural components such as framing and foundations.

title: Double Lot With Campspot Just Outside Hubbard Lake Village. Waterfront.
comments: 0.36 acres. We are selling two adjoining lots (113 and 114) on Second Street, just west of Hubbard Lake village. There is a power service here and we assume it has been used for camping in the past. The lots, together, are roughly 100' wide and 300' deep. This property fronts on the lower south branch of the Thunder Bay River, which is a tributary of Hubbard Lake. Gravel roads. A quiet resort area. Walking distance to the village of Hubbard Lake, where you can find general stores and other amenities. 0.31 acres

title: 130' Riverfront Home And Parcel On The Thunder Bay River Near Alpena!
comments: 0.55 acres. Sits on the Thunder Bay River SW of Alpena in Ossineke Township. Mid century one level home with 2 car attached garage and seperate workshop or studio building. We noticed cracking and heaving of concrete in the garage and sidewalks, indicating some unstable ground, but the home itself did not have any glaring signs of settling. There are signs of the chimney leaking near the woodstove location. Fuel oil heat. Shop/studio building needs some attention to the overhang supports and entry ramp, but appears to be generally solid and square otherwise. Riverfront is rustic and slow moving. This is the south branch of the Thunder Bay. Lands here are moist, which is very common in this part of Alpena County. We suspect this home has been vacant for about 5 years.

title: Gutted Mobile On Lot At Thunder Bay Village.
comments: The mobile here is gutted, and mighty rough, but the value here, is potentially in the lot ... and the well and septic. If you can find them. This Thunder Bay Village location may permit a new mobile to be brought in, so if you're looking for such a spot, this could fit your needs. We'd suggest you'd check with zoning and health department folks regarding the allowance for a new unit here, and whether the well and septic here are sufficient. We looked for the well ... we assume there is one here ... but it must be under the trailer or somewhere else that escaped our detection. 0.21 acres This parcel appears to include an area where a mobile home was previously located. title: 4 Parcels With Water Assessments On Us 23, And 8 Lots In Thunder Bay Village, Alpena
comments: This sale lot includes 15 parcels, that are not adjacent to each other.4 front along the west side of US 23 south of Alpena, and 11 others are in the "Thunder Bay Village" area East of town.The US 23 parcels have outstanding water assessments which, based on previous efforts to sell them, exceed their value. We have sold these parcels numerous times, only to have them re-revert when the purchasers learn of the outstanding balance due on the assessments.The outstanding assessment balance due on these lots is approximately $50,000 as a round number. Rather than sell these parcels AGAIN and have them become delinquent and be foreclosed in 2 years AGAIN, this time the parcels are being offered as a group, with the condition that a purchaser will be required to pay the assessment balances in total PRIOR TO CONVEYANCE, or the sale will be canceled and no deed issued.We encourage any interested party to contact Alpena Township, and have the total payoff calculated for parcels 018-045-000-420-00, 018-250-000-012-01, 012-02, and 037-00. The assessment for these parcels is roughly $5500 per year, and the assessment has another 10 years to run. So the amount necessary to retire these assessments in full and purchase the property is approximately $50,000 in addition to the winning bid and summer tax amounts due for 2016.If you are unwilling to pay the assessments in full, you should not bid on these parcels.In addition, this sale (the "bundle") includes eight parcels in the Thunder Bay Village subdivision(s). We have sold these lots, and others like them, numerous times, and we keep getting them back like the proverbial bad penny. The reason is pretty simple. Most of these are swamplots, and will not support construction or a septic system. They're not good for much except mosquito farming and (not) paying property taxes.The successful bidder for these 15 properties will have to pay the summer taxes in addition to the bid price, and the Thunder Bay Village parcels will include a deed restriction that stipulates tha they cannot be reconveyed to any third parties without the approval of the seller within 10 years, or all of the lots will revert to the seller without refund.These 15 parcels are sold as one unit, with the conditions noted above as requirements of sale:1) The US 23 assessments must be paid in full prior to the issuance of the deed or the sale will be cancelled, and;2) The Thunder Bay Village lots cannot be reconveyed within 10 yeas without the written consent of the Alpena County Treasurer, or title to all 8 parcels will revert to the seller without compensation to the purchaser or assigns. This will be included as a deed restriction at the time of this sale. 023 us-23 s water assessment - $1020.72. 0.14 acres. This property includes an outstanding special assessment. title: 1+ Acre Parcel Near Hillman With A "dozer Bait" House.
comments: This one has had a bad roof for quite some time. There are large holes and dozens of spots where there is deflection, indicating that the wood under the shingles is rotten. That is probably redundant into the roof joists as well. Inside, floors have decayed to the point of localized collapse from rot as well. It has been full of critters as well. Is it repairable ? Perhaps. But the economics of that are likely prohibitive. That being said, this is a nice one acre country lot with a submersible well and probably a septic system that has potential for reuse. The power service here has been dropped. This parcel includes a structure which should be considered DANGEROUS. This building has suffered structural damage which creates substantial risk of harm from falling through damaged areas or collapse from above. It may also contain extensive debris which could fall or collapse, rusty nails, broken glass, and other hazards. You are not permitted to enter this or any other structure offered at tax sale. Parcel 4417 is being sold with 4416. See that listing.

title: Waterfront Acreage. 5+ Acres On Grass Lake!
comments: This sale includes two adjacent parcels (4416, 4417) that total about 5.86 acres. One parcel contains the access driveway and the other the waterfrontage. We did not find any improvements here other than an older driveway. There is roughly 841 feet of waterfrontage on Grass Lake along the traverse line. This is not "beach" frontage ... it is recreational fishing type frontage that lends itself to a rowboat and dock. The property is nicely wooded in softwoods and is generally level and dry. There is a driveway cut in, but a tree has fallen across it, and someone took a scoop out of the end of the trail with a backhoe to keep folks from driving in. If you're headed out to look for this, come in from the north and east. If you follow your trusty GPS unit from the south, you're gonna need a tow truck. This is remote property and power lines (and year round neighbors) are a long way up the road ... we saw a power pedestal and a house with a meter about a half mile or better closer to civilization. Grass Lake is a very nice sportsfishing spot. There are a goodd number of homes at the north end of the lake, and this property is tucked into a cove on the SE corner of the lake. We estimate Grass Lake to be roughly 800 acres in size. Our visual inspection indicated that electrical service was not available on or near this parcel. The nearest electric service appeared to be a considerable distance (hundreds or perhaps thousands of feet) from the property. As such, electrifying this parcel could be costly. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding. This parcel is accessible by a road that is believed to be a seasonal or non-maintained public road. While we make no representations or warranties as to the precise nature of such road access, our research suggests that this road is either 1) Not regularly graded; and/or 2) Not snow plowed in winters; and/or 3) Appears subject to fallen trees or other events which have not been addressed by the county road commission. You should conduct your own research into this issue prior to bidding.

title: Hunt Camp. 10.08 Acres Of Recreational Property!
comments: Parcel is irregular in shape and runs on both sides of West Sandy Trail. The easternmost half of the property appears to drift into marshlands. Would be great hunting property. There is no electricity in this area, however the property has a flowing artesian well ... which while very slight in production, IS electricity-free water ! There is a hunt shack here that we believe lies on this parcel (not guaranteed) and it is of little value as it is collapsing and has critters living within. This is likely a private, non-maintained road. We did not see any year-round inhabitants within at least a mile. If anyone has ever told you to GET LOST, this would be the place they were talking about. This parcel is accessible by a road that is believed to be a seasonal or non-maintained public road. While we make no representations or warranties as to the precise nature of such road access, our research suggests that this road is either 1) Not regularly graded; and/or 2) Not snow plowed in winters; and/or 3) Appears subject to fallen trees or other events which have not been addressed by the county road commission. You should conduct your own research into this issue prior to bidding. Our visual inspection indicated that electrical service was not available on or near this parcel. The nearest electric service appeared to be a considerable distance (hundreds or perhaps thousands of feet) from the property. As such, electrifying this parcel could be costly. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding. Our review of this parcel indicates that the noted State Equalized Value (SEV) does not appear to reflect the current value of the property. This is often due to buildings or other improvements being demolished or fire damaged or other similar items included in the SEV being removed from the property. It can also be due to market changes in the area in which the property is located. It should be further noted that the SEV/assessed value of the parcel as noted in this listing may be several years old. You should consult a local real estate professional or appraiser to help you assess the current market value of this property before bidding and should not base your valuation on the stated SEV.
Parcels 4413 and 4414 are being sold as a group. See 4413 for details.

title: Cute Rustic Cabin Near Hillman
comments: We are selling parcels 4413 (driveway/access) and 4414 (cabin) as one group. This cabin sits a couple hundred feet off the road, at the end of a shared driveway. We suspect that multiple properties likely have an easement to use this driveway parcel. This is an old timey cabin west of Hillman in an area of older mid century cottages. The roof exhibits some bows and weaves, and a tree has fallen across the front yard, taking out the power service. The soils here are soft sandy loam. When this cabin was built, they probably skipped putting in real footings and just poured a slab. Over time it has settled, unevenly, and the roof reflects what has happened to the walls. The front door does not open because of the settling. The fireplace has cracked and efforts have been made in numerous spots to "foam" cracks and seperations where the walls and other surfaces are diverging. Can it be repaired ? Maybe with much effort. But this one needs someone with lots of talent and patience ... or a lot of duct tape. The foundation of one or more buildings located on this parcel appears to be failing. Correcting foundation issues can be very expensive and issues are often more complex than they initially appear. You should research this issue thoroughly prior to bidding on this parcel.

title: Wooded Lot With Stored Mobile Near Hillman
comments: There is an older mobile located on this lot, but it has never been "fully installed". We did not see evidence of a well or septic here, but there is an electric service. We do not have title to this mobile, and it is clearly to be considered personal property, which could be removed by a title holder if they chose to. There is a bit of a junk yard to the south, but that is not a part of this parcel. Mobile homes (and some modular homes) can be separately titled and considered personal property. In these instances, there may be third parties that have the legal right to remove that mobile home from the parcel whether or not it has been assessed as part of the property in the past. We make no representations or warranties as to whether such mobile or modular homes are included with the real property offered for sale. It is the buyer’s responsibility to conduct their own research as to the state of title. As a preliminary step, it may be useful to determine if an Affidavit of Affixture of Manufactured Home has been executed and recorded as outlined in MCL 125.2330i. You may wish to consult a licensed attorney or title company to assist in this research.

title: One Story Mid-Century Home With Attached Garage Near Hillman.
comments: This one has not been used much in some time, tho it has a SatTV dish (?!). Sits a hundred feet or so back off Parker Road at its dul-de-sac, and the driveway has overgrown and there is a fallen tree and pile of brush blocking easy entry. Home is vinyl sided and would appear to be mid-century construction. It is generally straight and solid, but its condition is difficult to fully assess, because it is FULL of cast-offs. Once emptied, this house may finish up pretty decently. The roof does not seem to be leaking overall, but we noticed some ceiling issues at the south end of the building that are likely the result of either a localize roof issue, or perhaps attic dwelling critters. There is an auto in the garage that we do not have title to and it is not a part of this sale. Overall, this home seems to hold good potential for the talented rehabber looking for a fixer upper that they can redo on a reasonable budget. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

title: Mobile Home Location ? Well And Septic Are In! Atlanta.
comments: A mobile has been removed from this location near Atlanta on Culver Road. There is an existing well and septic are on site, and you may wish to consult with the district health department as to whether or not they would be allowed to be reused for a new housing unit. Level, open, dry lands, jjust a hop skip and jump from the Thunder Bay River ! This parcel appears to include an area where a mobile home was previously located. Such mobile home pads will frequently include well/water and septic/sewer connections as well as power hookups. However, local zoning regulations may prohibit placing a new mobile home on this site despite the fact that one was previously located here. Please check local zoning regulations carefully prior to bidding. We make no representations or warranties as to the suitability of this parcel for any purpose.

title: Vacant Parcel Just Outside Of Atlanta
comments: 2.25 acre parcel west of Atlanta on Woodland Avenue off M-32. Lands are rolling and generally dry. In the Barger Creek/Big Rock area. Wooded in middle aged softwoods and evergreens. County maintained gravel road.

title: Vacant Building Site Near Crooked Lake. Atlanta
comments: Parcel is just under 1/2 acre. Dry, level lands at the end of a cul-de-sac in a very serene setting. Neighboring homes appear to be well maintained, seasonal homes.
Parcels 4404, 5, 6 & 7 are being sold as a group. See 4404 for full description.
Parcels 4404, 5, 6 & 7 are being sold as a group. See 4404 for full description.
Parcels 4404, 5, 6 & 7 are being sold as a group. See 4404 for full description.

title: Former Restaurant Property In Atlanta.
comments: Parcels 4404,5,6 and 7 are being sold as one unit, but includes 4 different tax parcels.. Property has been previously used as a restaurant, but has multiple other potential uses that could include office, retail, storage or even residential. Jerome Street runs at a tangent off M-32/33 when approaching Atlanta from the East and this property is quite visible from that highway. There are three buildings here all painted essentially the same color, but this is ONLY the west one ... the other two are not on these parcels. The sale includes FOUR parcels of land, and is roughly 240x100 more or less. The original portions of the building are slab-on-grade and solidly floored. The "kitchen" addition to the rear is over a cellar and the floor is frame and a little spongy. It is also low ceiling space. The septic system here is modern and substantial. It is a "mound" type, and we assume to be fairly recent. We would check with the district health department on its attributes. We believe this is city water. Natural gas is here. We saw roof leaks in the kitchen room, but not elsewhere. The parcel to the west of the building is a vacant lot and could serve as parking.

title: Waterfront! Vacant 60 Foot Parcel On The Thunder Bay River In Atlanta!
comments: Parcel is 60 foot at the road, and roughly the same at the frontage on the Thunder Bay River. Just "across the bridge" from downtown Atlanta. This is a nice, scenic setting and would make a great spot for a northern cabin. Natural gas is available here.

title: Older Frame Home And 2 Car Garage East Of Atlanta.
comments: This home and garage are located next to sale parcel 4401, on a 69x373 lot. It includes a modern construction frame home and detached 2 car garage that are a little torn up, but very restorable. It will need a new roof and a good thorough cleaning. Most likely the mechanical systems will need to be upgraded.

title: Permalog! Almost 3 Acres With Home And 2 Car Garage.
comments: Permalog concrete log cabin replica homes were produced by a Mio-based company in the latter half of the last century. They are an iconic symbol of NE Michigan history. This one has suffered a little from neglect, but its pretty tough to put a concrete wall down. There appears to have been some effort undertaken to repair the bottom portion of the wall around the east end of the house, as they trenched an area next to the house ... and then did nothing further. It may have been below grade. We can't be sure without first hand knowledge. The structure will need a new roof, and some repair to the front wall near the footing in one area, but this is a pretty maintenance-free exterior. The interior is mostly slab-on-grade. There is a woodburning fireplace. Overall it appears to be fairly solid, but is decor-challenged. We assume that the mechanicals in this one will need substantial upgrading. NOTE: Sale 4402 is right-next-door, in case you are looking for a vacation place for your in laws. There is a detached, 2 car garage that is in very good overall condition. It will need an overhead door repair or replacement, but it is probably less than about 30 years old and pretty solid. We don't see many Permalog cabins. Don't miss this one !

title: Vacant 50X500 Parcel On County Road 489, Lewiston
comments: 50' on County Road 489 x 500' deep. Located just south of Lewiston. Level wooded lands on a paved, maintained county road. Great recreational area.

title: Vacant Swamp Lot Near Wolverine.
comments: Vacant lot in the Wildwood Valley Subdivision #2. Parcel has substantial wetlands indicators. Cat tails, open standing water at the road. There is a culvert draining water from this lot to a waterway across the road. Would make a good wetlands mitigation program swap parcel for a developer. This parcel has surface water, soil, or vegetation conditions indicating that it may include wetland habitat. Such habitat may comprise all or part of the parcel's area. However, it is possible that this parcel contains buildable areas as well. There are many environmental and building regulations related to wetlands which you should consult before bidding on this parcel. It is your responsibility to determine if this parcel is suitable for your desired use.

comments: Nice rolling wooded lot in the Wildwood Hills plat near Wolverine. We believe there is a voluntary property owners association in this area that you may wish to investigate. Gravel public roads.

title: Vacant Parcel In Timberline Estates Near Wolverine
comments: Building site in Timberline Estates, a quiet recreational subdivision east of Wolverine. There are two cruddy old trailers on this lot that we do not have title to, but we have sold this same parcel 2 or 3 times previously, so it is unlikely anyone is coming to get them. There has been a power service here in the past, but we did not see evidence of a well or septic system of any kind.

title: Nice Wooded Lot In Timberline Estates
comments: A driveway has been cut into this parcel in Timberline Estates. It is nicely wooded in softwoods and is otherwise unimproved. Gravel county maintained roads.

title: Vacant Site Condo Lot At Mont Gabriel Near Wolverine
comments: Parcels 1628 and 1629 are two side-by-side SITE CONDO lots in the Mont Gabriel subdivision near Wolverine. We believe there is a voluntary condo owners association here, that you may wish to investigate. Gravel public roads. Buy one or both ! Two would give you a nice large lot ! This parcel is part of a site condominium development. A condominium "unit" is a form of land ownership which is similar to a traditional subdivision "lot" but is also different in some important respects. Each condominium development is laid out in a document called the master deed which outlines the extent and nature of each condominium unit. The master deed also contains rules and restrictions related to construction and permitted use. Construction requirements can include everything from the size or design of buildings to color and orientation on the site. Condominium developments also include "common elements" like streets and sidewalks which are shared across all units. Some developments include amenities like golf courses, clubhouses, beaches, pools, and parks whereas others include only basic infrastructure like roads and sidewalks. Site condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Prospective bidders should carefully review and understand the master deed and investigate association fees prior to bidding.

title: Vacant Building Site In Pine Trails #2 Sub, South Of Indian River
comments: Vacant building parcel in Pine Trails #2. Sites below road grade, making a great location for a walkout basement home. Sub is about 1/2 built up.

title: Unfinished Construction Project Near Indian River
comments: This is an older manufactured housing unit that appears to have been moved to a fresh block foundation on this lot, and rehabbed started ... then fizzled. While the general structure appears solid, it has numerous openings to the elements and critters. We would consider this a "shell" from which to start, rather than a "flip" house. It has electric service and a 4" submersible well. Needs siding, probably some work on the unfinished roof, and overall resurfacing. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed.

title: Hot Deal In Indian River. Vacant Parcel 1/2 Mile From Burt Lake!
comments: Parcel is just shy of an acre, and is west of Chippewa Beach Road on Mohawk Trail. Mohawk is a barely improved (two-track) platted road that more resembles a driveway. There structure here burned, and has been knocked down into a pile, but most of what burned is still here. The yard is littered with debris as well. There is a submersible well and septic here that may offer promise for reuse. You will want to check with the district health department to see if they have record of their installation for sizing and age characteristics. The garage on Chippewa Beach Road is *not* part of this property.

This is 1/2 mile west of Black Lake. Wooded. We did not walk the property because of unknown access rights. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. title: Cute Little Chalet Style Home With Shared Lake Huron Access!
comments: This sale contains a cute, modern Chalet style home on two lots. It is modern construction and has been well maintained from appearances. This is located in the Cordwood Point Property Owners Association and has shared access and a clubhouse on LAKE HURON about an hour east of the Mighty Mac. Membership POA fees apply here. Home has two bedrooms plus a second floor loft and appears to be in ready-to-use condition after some freeze damage is repaired. We discovered a crack in the turlet, so we assume there is some freeze damage to the water supply lines. It has been vacant since about August 2015, when the power was turned off. This will be a very popular parcel in this condition, so bring your checkbook and be prepared to bid !! Please note that this property was furnished with personal effects when we visited in May. Personal property is NOT INCLUDED in this sale and remains the property of the former owner or occcupant of this property. This property contains physical indications that one or more water lines have frozen, ruptured, and leaked for a significant period of time prior to being shut off. Such indications can include damage to ceilings and floors and visibly damaged pipes and fixtures. Damage from freeze bursts can be substantial including significant harm to structural components such as framing and foundations. title: 425+ Acres And Cabin! Private Estate Type Parcel Near Hammond Bay, Off Us 23. Gravel Quarry Potential.
comments: Parcels 1607, 1608, 1609 and 1610 are 4 adjoining acreage parcels that total 425+ acres. 1607 = 232.54 acres. 1608 = 120.87 acres. 1609 = 40.28 acres. 1610 = 32.25 acres. Access is off a gated, shared road off US 23 just across the street from Lake Huron. Parcel 1607 is the largest parcel, the farthest back off the road, and is predominately recreational/hunting land. It contains significant wetlands areas, and a small stream. We did not see any improvements here other than deer blinds. Parcel 1608 is the most developed parcel. The parcel has an excavated area that is rich in nice gravel and sand, which is a hot commodity along the lakeshore in this area. There is a modern cabin here with cedar and pine interior, a detached 2 car and a gutted mobile home. The cabin is quite nice, has electric baseboard heat, and would appear to be ready-to-use. Parcel 1609 is a "square 40" without improvements that appears to be generally dry, level and mostly open. Parcel 1610 is 32.25 acres, and is the parcel that entry is first made upon when passing through the gated entry drive. There is a modular-type unit here which appears to have been used in the past as an office, but has the pontential to be converted to a residential use. This parcel was originally a "square 40", but a parcel has been sold from the center to a third party, of roughly 8 acres, that contains a cell phone communications tower. The tower is NOT a part of the lands being sold. This parcel also contains a 30x60 pole barn west of the tower parcel. This is a terrific recreational or estate property in a *very* secluded and private setting. It appears that one or two other land owners further back, and the communications tower operator share access over the road through these parcels, and there are daisy-chained padlocks that permit reciprocal access. We are offering the 4 parcels as a combined sale only. Don't miss this one !!! This parcel has surface water, soil, or vegetation conditions indicating that it may include wetland habitat. Such habitat may comprise all or part of the parcel's area. However, it is possible that this parcel contains buildable areas as well. title: Vacant Parcel Behind Walmart. Cheboygan.
comments: Vacant parcel is just under an acre in size. At the intersection of Stempky and Chelsea Lane. Level dry lands. May have commercial or office use potential. Municipal utilities and natural gas in this area. Our review of this parcel indicates that the noted State Equalized Value (SEV) does not appear to reflect the current value of the property. This is often due to buildings or other improvements being demolished or fire damaged or other similar items included in the SEV being removed from the property. It can also be due to market changes in the area in which the property is located. It should be further noted that the SEV/assessed value of the parcel as noted in this listing may be several years old. You should consult a local real estate professional or appraiser to help you assess the current market value of this property before bidding and should not base your valuation on the stated SEV.

title: Older 1.5 Story Home In Cheboygan.
comments: This is a simple, older home in Cheboygan that has seen some updating. It has been raised onto a new block foundation, and vinyl sided. It has been steel roofed and has newer vinyl doors and windows. The inside, however, will need a rehab. It is a mix of old and new, and poorly executed. It may be worthy of a complete strip and re-do based on your analysis of the cost-benefit. Messy and grubby, but a basic shell that has potential for the handyman. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed.

title: Vacant Parcel On Dresser Street In Cheboygan.
comments: Vacant parcel on a side street just west of downtown Cheboygan. It appears there was a home here in the last based on improved driveway. Appears generally level and dry. This parcel is located within a municipality which monitors property maintenance and condition. You may be assessed fees and fines if you fail to mow the grass or do not otherwise properly maintain the property after purchase. One advantage to these parcels is that they typically have infrastructure nearby (water, sewer, power). However, you should confirm the availability of such utilities as well as the connection costs prior to bidding. It is your responsibility to determine whether a parcel is suitable for your desired purpose.

title: Older Home In Need Of A Complete Rehab. Cheboygan.
comments: This is an older home that has had a bad roof for a few (4ish) years since the former owner died. There is some heaving of flooring from moisture, and the beginnings of mold. The siding is asbestos shingle. Newer windows and doors. This home has potential and appears to be structurally worthy of a rehab, but the economics of that may be prohibitive. Older (original) plumbing and wiring. Level, dry yard. 1 car attached garage. One or more buildings on this parcel has a roof which is either leaking to the interior or appears close to failure. Failing roofs often indicate substantial structural decay inside the building. You should investigate the integrity of this structure(s) prior to bidding. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

title: Handyman Special In Cheboygan.
comments: Turn-of-the-last-century 1.5 story home on the east side of Cheboygan. Double corner lot. Home is small and efficient. Interior is dated and will need some updating. Vinyl siding and an older roof. Soffits and facia will need some attention. Inside, there are 2 small bedrooms up, and one down. Kitchen and bath are older and/or unfinished. Electric has a newer service panel, but the workmanship appears to be a DIY effort. A sign on the door indicates that the plumbing was winterized, but we can't be certain of the results of that. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed.

title: Triangular Shaped Parcel On Pries Road Near Us 23. 2+ Acres
comments: Parcel has a US 23 address, but the frontage on that road is subject to the highway right-of-way and the riding and hiking trail (former railroad r-o-w) that runs parallel to it. So the physical access to the parcel runs from Pries Road to the SW of the trail. It is triangular in shape. We noticed wetlands indicators here, tho there appear to be uplands available as well. Nice wooded, gently rolling lands between Mackinaw City and Cheboygan, just steps off US 23. This parcel has surface water, soil, or vegetation conditions indicating that it may include wetland habitat. Such habitat may comprise all or part of the parcel's area. However, it is possible that this parcel contains buildable areas as well. There are many environmental and building regulations related to wetlands which you should consult before bidding on this parcel. It is your responsibility to determine if this parcel is suitable for your desired use.

title: Handyman Special In The Soo
comments: This is an unfinished project. It has some newer windows, and what is left of some years-old Tyvek that never saw siding .... But for the most part, this one just didn't get done. The roof is old and cruddy, but miraculously, we didn't see any substantial leaks. There are a couple of dumpsters worth of goodiess to haul off here before you can really get a good assessment of this one. The front entryway is soft in the floor, but otherwise it seems generally straight and solid. Just very decor challenged and incomplete. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed.

title: Almost An Acre!
comments: This is a site where a building has burned in the past. It has a moat and drawbridge, but no castle anymore. The lot is cleared and open. The lands to the south of this are all vacant woodlands for several hundred feet. A private setting. Our review of this parcel indicates that the noted State Equalized Value (SEV) does not appear to reflect the current value of the property. This is often due to buildings or other improvements being demolished or fire damaged or other similar items included in the SEV being removed from the property. It can also be due to market changes in the area in which the property is located. It should be further noted that the SEV/assessed value of the parcel as noted in this listing may be several years old. You should consult a local real estate professional or appraiser to help you assess the current market value of this property before bidding and should not base your valuation on the stated SEV.

title: Vacant 50X100 Lot In The Soo.
comments: Parcel fronts 50 feet on the north side of Gros Cap Avenue, and runs 100 feet deep to an alley at the rear. We'd surmise that a structure was here in the past and has been removed. This is a somewhat commercial/industrial/warehouse district with a sprinkling of older homes as well. Located due west of downtown.

title: Older 2 Story Home In The Soo.
comments: This is an older 2 story frame construcction home on the east side of the Soo. The structure appears to be in generally solid condition, but she's really, really grubby and stinky, and in need of a good cleaning. It has vinyl siding, and a nice large yard. Inside this one is really "ripe" and has that special odor that only a closed up pile of raw food garbage and a couple generations of chain smoking can really gift. But under that pungent odorbomb, this house has some real potential. There is original hardwood trim, dual stairways, hardwood floors and more that are certainly worth restoring. This house is very original, just very dirty. The roof is basic and not horribly old. Clean up and clean up ! NOTE: Since inspection, this house has been mostly cleaned out. This property is unsanitary and poses a potential health hazard because of raw food garbage, backed up sewer lines, or other similar waste. Such conditions can attract rodents, wild animals, and other vermin. You should bid accordingly and be prepared to mitigate the situation immediately upon purchase.
