title: Two Story House In The Soo!
comments: Two story home in the Soo with hardboard siding. Could use a coat of paint. Has an attached one car garage to the rear. Lot is narrow. This one is plain, but simple and straight. Would not take a lot of updating to make it into an attractive family home. Natural gas heat. All municipal utilities are here.

title: 2 Story Frame Construction Home On Easterday Avenue
comments: This one is right in the center of town, and a hop, skip and jump to downtown. It is an older two story, frame construction home that is rather plain and unadorned on the outside. White vinyl siding and a few newer windows. The rooof is alsso newer, and basic ... it should provide years of servicce, however the facia and soffits are going to need some attention, as they were not upgraded with the siding, and are looking a little ragged. The interior is grubby and a basic rental-grade updating has been done, but the kitchen and bath are old and tired. There is a detached one cara garage on the parcel that has an ancient roof on it. The yard here is tiny, and upkeep would be a snap.

title: Ten Acres In Da Soo.
comments: Parcel is at the south Soo city limits, but has no improved roads to it. Parcel runs 1320 feet north to south, and 330 feet east to west. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: Most Of A City Block .... With No Roads .... Detour.
comments: Detour sits at the Drummond Island ferry dock at the far eastern end of the UP. This is a group of eleven lots on Block 12 of the Dawson subdivision, where the roads were platted but never improved. Our topograhical maps tell us that this land is level and dry, and our eyes tell us that it's densely wooded and a brushy walk in. This could be a very private, secluded spot if you had a way to cut your way in. Right in Detour Village. The roads which are shown on plat or tax maps for this parcel do not appear to exist or may be located in a different location than shown on such maps. While a legal right to build such roads may remain, this construction would likely be very expensive. However, in some instances these unimproved roads have been vacated or abandoned by action of the local government and no such right to construct the roads remains. Issues surrounding unimproved roads can be complicated and expensive to resolve. You should investigate the existence of any roads and the ability to access this parcel thoroughly before bidding.

title: Lake Superior Waterfront Log Cottage In Paradise!
comments: This is exactly what everyone says they are looking for. That rustic, old time log cabin on the big water ! Watch the freighters off your front porch and relax in the summer heat with Lake Superiors cool breeze wafting through the windows. No A/C needed here ! Tahquamenon Falls and Whitefish Point are easy day trips from here. Parcel has 150' on the lake, x 120' deep on a private road off M-123 within walking distance of Paradise village shops !! The cottage is very authentic Yooper, and matches the one next door which was probably built simultaneously. There have been upgrades here, including a newer electrical service, and someone started (but did not finish) repairs to the rear facade. The cottage seems solid overall, but all log structures are an ongoing process of maintenance. Inside, the second floor of the original part of the building has been braced with a timber truss that could probably be aesthetically improved upon with steel and made less conspicuous. There is a shallow well pit in the garage. and a small outbuilding here in addition to the garage. Rear kitchen area is over a recent block foundation improvement. The frontage here is bluff frontage and probably in excess of 20 feet to a stony shoreline. We would strongly suggest that the new owner check with other in the are to determine the pace of erosion here, and whether any steps can be prudently taken to slow its crawl. This is a magnificent opportunity to get that "place up north" that you have always dreamed of ... do not miss this one !!!

title: Cabin Near Whitefish Bay On Lake Superior!
comments: Low maintenance cabin and detached 2 car garage, located on a 100x200 lot across the street from Lake Superior ! This is in the popular Whitefish Bay resort area. Cabin has shingle siding and a steel roof, and appears to be in pretty darn solid condition ! Inside, it is dated and "cosmetically challenged", but very worthy of a redo. There is a partial basement under the 1.5 story part of the house that is unfinished but has that potential. The second floor sleeping area will be popular with the kids. Outbuilding is steel and seems solid.

title: Gift Shop Or Trinket Building In Paradise!
comments: This is a small frame construction building in Paradise that has been used as a gift shop, and more recently a food concession. It is in the central shopping district of Paradise village, and very visible to passing traffic. Commercial uses are the norm here. The property here is narrow and shaped like a slice of the pie. 75' wide on the road, 15' feet wide at the rear, and over 200 feet deep. The building is small, perhaps 600 to 800 square feet, and according to a neighbor (who voiced clear intention to bid on it himself) has no bathroom, and that without one, it cannot be used. He claims that there is not sufficient property to put a septic system on, but that has not been verified with the health department, who usually accomodate requests if at all possible. Given that this has been recently licensed as a food service operation, some of this claim seems dubious. There is a well on the property, and the food operation used sinks in their food prep, so there is clearly *some* sort of existing waste disposal system in place here. Our experience is that some systems are now engineered with a single pipe field, and there may well be room for this type of disposal onsite with proper engineering. You will want to check with the district health department on this if you're interested in the property. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. Buildings which are dangerous, occupied, boarded, condemned, or otherwise difficult to enter are inspected from the exterior/curbside only. You are NOT authorized to enter these or any other buildings offered for sale. You should limit your inspection to that which can be made safely from the building's exterior.

title: 200' Of Waterfront On Frenchman Lake Near Trout Lake!
comments: Vacant parcel has 200' of frontage on Frenchman Lake, which is located at the east edge of Trout Lake Village. This is about 30 minutes north of the bridge, and easily reached by M-123. Parcel is located in a gated, private association with deed restrictions and membership fees that you will want to investigate prior to bidding. Frenchman Lake is a "fishing" type lake moreso than a "swimming" lake, and the shoreline areas here are reeds not sand. It's a small fishing lake that connects to a river running up to Big Trout Lake. Small outboard motors are allowed here, but jet skiis and large power boats are way out of place here. Public lake access is located at the entrance to the lakes near M-123 as is a small family resort with swimming beach area. The very south side, where this parcel is located is part of the Wegwas Association and accessed through a private road and gate.This is a very nice seasonal resort area, and having the village nearby is great for basic needs and recreation. The lot is level, dry and wooded in a mixture of evergreen and softwoods. There is an older foundation here from a cabin that has long since been removed. This parcel is likely subject to ASSOCIATION FEES which are assessed to cover maintenance and other costs associated with the development in which the parcel is located. Interested parties should verify the existence and extent of association fees and costs prior to bidding.

title: Vacant Lot In Trout Lake Area.
comments: Vacant parcel in Trout Lake, at the north end of South 5th Street. The platted road ends about where the lot starts, and the lot runs to the northeast of the road end. Topographical maps indicate this area quickly becomes swampland on the other side of the railroad r/o/w, and we saw some wetlands indicators in the area., however there is also a modern house within 100 feet, so it's in the transition area. You'll want to see the plat of the subdivision on the state plat map website (see link) ... this is the entire "Block 4" in the plat, which is essentially a triangular parcel of under an acre, which abuts the old abandon railway r/o/w.

title: 2 Parcels ... 15 Acres ... Superior Township Near Brimley!
comments: Parcels 1730 and 1731 are adjacent to each other. Neither front on a public road, so we are offering them as a unit so that one owner can determine and/or negotiate their access. 1730 is a 660' x 660' square 10 acre parcel that lies 660' north of the "right of way" for W Mills (8 Mile) Road, which shows on maps as a public road in this area. 1731 is a 330' (north-south) x 660' (east-west) parcel that lies directly south of 1730 and is 330' north of the public road. 8 Mile Road coming into this area from the west has been intentionally blocked with felled brush and trees by some nemesis, and the same road is gated at the east side when you try to come in that way. We did not find any two-tracks into these parcels that suggest an easement has been utilized by former owners, so you'll want to do some investigation into legal access here. What we *can* tell you, is that the last owners acquired this by a tax deed foreclosure over 35 years ago, and it does not appear that they ever made any effort to access the property during that time, so adverse possession of a road does not appear to be a viable remedy .... however prescriptive easement probably is. You'll want to consult with a real estate attorney on this one if the title record contains no specific mention of an easement. Our visual inspection indicated that electrical service was not available on or near this parcel. The nearest electric service appeared to be a considerable distance (hundreds or perhaps thousands of feet) from the property. As such, electrifying this parcel could be costly. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress. Parcel is being sold with #1730. See that parcel for descriptions.

title: Parcel In Brimley Right Across From The State Park!
comments: Parcel sits right across the street from the State park campground property in Brimley in west-central Chippewa County. It has about 700 feet on Six Mile Road, and has a west line depth of 91 feet and an east line depth of 269 feet. You will want to confirm these measurements if that is critical to you. The lands here are densely wooded in a variety of evergreens and softwoods. It looks a little on the low side of the scale, but it is not overtly a wetlands parcel and we'd think there should be buildable lands here based on the suggestions of the USSGS topographical maps for the area that show it as uplands. Parcel is due east of the Superior Pizza and Subs shop on Six Mile Road, and just down the road a piece from the Kewadin Brimley casino.

title: Waterfront On Sugar Island And Lake George. Hello, Canada!
comments: Canada is your view across Lake George from these waterfront lots on Sugar Island. Sales 1727 and 1728 are adjacent waterfront lots, with 1727 having 90 feet of frontage and 1728 having 96 feet more, giving this combined sale 186 feet of frontage !. The lots run 450+ feet deep from the road to the waterfront. The lands here are level and mostly open, with some brush cover. There are signs of wetlands indicators, but the neighbor to the south has mowed him lot all the way to the waters edge and it seems to be pretty firm and does not appear filled. So we presume that could be done here as well. The structure on the lot, which seems to be on sale 1727 but could run across the lot line, is a "goner". It has collapsed and is simply beyond reasonable repair. The roads here are likely seasonal, or at the very least wayyyyy down the plow list. Most of the homes right in this area seem to be vacation/second home uses. This parcel includes a structure which should be considered DANGEROUS. This building has suffered structural damage which creates substantial risk of harm from falling through damaged areas or collapse from above. It may also contain extensive debris which could fall or collapse, rusty nails, broken glass, and other hazards. You are not permitted to enter this or any other structure offered at tax sale. You should limit your inspection only to what can be safely observed from the building's exterior. Trespassers are subject to prosecution. See sale 1727 for the details on this parcel. A collapsed structure here may cross the lot line(s) and the same buyer should control both parcels.

title: One Acre Camp On Sugar Island!
comments: This is an older, trashed mobile on a square acre lot on Sugar Island. Views of Lake George and Canada are right out your front door ! The one thing this property doesn't seem to have is a driveway. We're not quite sure how they got the mobile onto the lot, as there is a large drain that runs along the road, but no culvert, driveway or bridge across it. So that will probably be the first task for the new owner of this one. The mobile and old cabin here are shot and beyond economic sense to repair. There is a hand pump and a "bath with a path". This is a camp spot and not really something repairable beyond the most spartan of uses.

title: 100X217 Lot On Nicolet Road ... Just South Of The Soo!
comments: Parcel fronts 100' on the west side of Nicolet Road, and runs 217' deep to the west. Level, densely wooded lands in an area of modest, well kept homes. County maintained, paved road.

title: Ten Acres On 5 1/4 Mile Road In Soo Township.
comments: This is a "long 10", with 330' of frontage on the south side of 5 1/4 Mile Road. Runs 1320 feet deep more or less. This is a paved, county maintained road, and there are homes on both sides and across the street. The lands here are rolling and wooded. Nice country side feel to the area here. The growth here is younger, and mostly softwoods and brush. We did not see any sort of culvert or drive into the parcel from the road.

title: The Beacom Building. Rudyard.
comments: This was at one time a proud apartment house in Rudyard. The years and lack of attention have taken their toll, and it is now in serious disrepair. It has been vandalized and the roof has been leaking for some time. We've sold it before .... more than once ... and each time it's a little worse for wear the next time we come back. This would take some commitment and deep pockets to bring back to life. We did not venture inside this trip, as it's beginning to look like it's beyond economic feasibility to restore. Our recollecion of past visits is that this is multiple apartments, with the menaces of outdated mechanicals, lead based paint, and a bad roof. We'd recommend a structural engineer be retained if you're serious about this one.

title: 74+ Acres! Rudyard Area Riverfront Acreage.
comments: This parcel is mostly fenced, and is level, open lands east of Rudyard and I-75. There is what remains of a liquid waste transfer apparatus on-site. There are 2-3 steel tanks here, and one of them is marked "Superior Sanitation Inc", and alongsaide it is a derrick of some kind. There is also a manmade lagoon/pond that was used as a part of this processing. in other words, this appears to have been the emptying station for a septic tank cleaning company. The lands here are not swampy, but they're certainly "moist". We saw some furrows, that would indicate someone has tried to direct surface waters here at least seasonally if not more often. If you're interested in this parcel, we'd recommend checking into its prior use, to be sure of what you're buying. This would likely make excellent cropland for hay, which is a common commodity in this area. Fronts on the Munoscong River, which is a tributary of the St Marys river.

title: Steep Hillside/ravine Parcel In Rudyard.
comments: Parcel sits on the bend on W 1st Street in Rudyard, and it quite literally disappears below the road grade a couple dozen feet into a ravine. We like to refer to these parcels as "terrain challenged". This parcel appears to have challenging terrain. Challenging terrain can include steep hillsides, ravines, gullies, or similar topographical features as well as little to no buildable area. Such parcels often have no practical use. You should investigate this parcel's terrain and suitability for your desired purpose prior to bidding.

title: Ravine Parcel On The Pine River. Rudyard
comments: This is a triangular parcel between Trout Lake Road and the railroad tracks, west of the Pine River in Rudyard. The portion of the lot adjacent to the river is a dozen feet or two below road grade and we're not sure how you'd get to it without a bungee cord or canoe. This parcel appears to have challenging terrain. Challenging terrain can include steep hillsides, ravines, gullies, or similar topographical features as well as little to no buildable area. Such parcels often have no practical use. You should investigate this parcel's terrain and suitability for your desired purpose prior to bidding.

title: 3.53 Acre Waterfront Parcel, North Of Rudyard.
comments: This parcel sits primarily off the road, to the rear of a home. The road frontage is in the area of a small white shed that we're not certain is on or off the parcel. This is 3.5 acres with frontage on the Pine River, and is located a mile or so north of Rudyard on Tilson Road. It is quite irregular in shape, with the north boundary following the thread of the river.

title: 8.3 Acres In Pickford Township!
comments: Parcel is irregular in shape, and sits about 10 feet below road grade behind a guardrail. You'd need to have a survey done to find the 187.19 feet of this parcel that front on M-129 and see if there is any physical way to drive into it. There may be access to the north of the guardrail, but we could not be certain of that boundary without some survey detail. The property runs roughly 1320' deep to the west from the road, and is rolling. There are lilely some low lands here, but we expect it has buildble area as well.

title: Platted Lot On An Unimproved Road. Kinross Area
comments: This is a subdivided lot on a road that was never improved. There is a two track that veers off South Fair Road (look for directional sign), and following that trail, tjhis lot is on the right hand side just a couple hundred feet in. There are no utilities up this road, but they could probably be brought in at not a horrible expense. You're just 200 feet or so off Fair Road. Keep in mind that this is an unimproved (and non-county maintained) road that is best considered private. The roads which are shown on plat or tax maps for this parcel do not appear to exist or may be located in a different location than shown on such maps. While a legal right to build such roads may remain, this construction would likely be very expensive. However, in some instances these unimproved roads have been vacated or abandoned by action of the local government and no such right to construct the roads remains. Issues surrounding unimproved roads can be complicated and expensive to resolve. You should investigate the existence of any roads and the ability to access this parcel thoroughly before bidding.

title: Commercial Income Property In Kincheloe!
comments: This is a large, modern, commercial duplex property in Kincheloe. It was the location of the Family Dollar and Sky McFlys Bar and restaurant, the bar is closed and gone, and Family Dollar has moved across the street. It is apparent that maintenance has been let go here, and both buildings show evidence of bad roofs. Inside, the buildings are structurally sound, with concrete slab-on-grade floors. There has been some demolition inside, and ceilings are down inside both units from roof leaks. The restaurant side of the building is roughly 35x80 and the Family Dollar side of the building is about 60x160 feet deep, including a couple of additions to the rear. The rear addition to the building has a good, useable basement space with exterior stairwell. The ceilings there are over 8 foot, and it was dry. The total square footage here is in the neighborhood of 12,000 square feet. See the photos for more detail on condition and attributes.

title: Single Family Home In Kincheloe Location.
comments: This is a single family home, originally built for service members at the Kincheloe AFB by the Federal government. The base was closed and housing converted to civilian ownership a couple decades ago. This home is a tri-level design with an attached one car garage. This is a solid house with functional mechanicals aas best we can tell, but needs a complete resurfacing and new kitchen. It appears that a lender repo'd this one and then abandon it. It has been vacant since at least 2013 according to paperwork we found posted on the door. Roof isn't new, but doesn't leak. Sofffits and facia boards could use some work. Siding is vinyl and in reasonable shape. It is posted as "winterized", but the date was January ... so we cannot guarantee that some damage had not occured already if it was vacant and unheated prior to that time. There is evidence posted which indicates that a lender may be attempting to foreclose upon this parcel after such parcel was foreclosed for delinquent property taxes. A purchaser may encounter future contact from this lender. Tax foreclosure supersedes the rights of mortgage holders. If a mortgage holder does not foreclose upon their mortgage interest prior to tax foreclosure, their right to do so is generally lost. Typically such mortgage holders were provided all necessary notice of tax foreclosure but failed to act in a timely fashion to preserve their interest. In rare instances it may be necessary to cancel a sale if a deficiency in notice to such a lender is discovered. Please contact us or ask questions at the sale if you have concerns about this issue.

title: Irregular Shaped Parcel On Mackinac Trail And I-75
comments: This parcel is irregular in shape and the legal description is quite complicated, with it describing a 9 acre parcel, and then excepting a smaller parcel from it. It is situated west of Mackinac Trail (Old US 2) and the back boundary is the old railroad right-of-way. We believe the net acreage here is probably in the range of 2-3 acres. Soils are a bit moist.

title: Nice, Newer Construction Home And 2 Car Garage Near Kinross. On Ten Acres.
comments: This is newer construction, with a two car detached garage, just outside of Kinross in central Chippewa County. You have your own TEN ACRES right out the back door! It appears to have been built with barrier free access in mind. It is in generally good repair, but will need resurfacing, as the floor ccoverings have all been removed or are stained and soiled. The basement level is not connected to the upper floor by an interior stairway, but is accessed by an outside stairway. The garage is connected to the house by a breezeway, and the yard is deep and private, with the house setting back off the road over 100 feet. With some TLC, this could be a great family or vacation home. Has a three sided gas fireplace, master suite with jacuzzi tub, and a large eat-in kitchen.

title: 40 Acres Of Recreational Property Near Hulbert!
comments: This is a remote 40 acre parcel several hundred feet off the nearest public road. Topographical maps suggest that the west 1/2 of this property is marshlands. We could not find a two track that would get us back into this locale, but we did notice that the area in general has a healthy growth of maple trees ! If you're interest in this parcel, you'll want to do some homework to determine easement and access rights, or you'll need a helicopter ! Aerial photos infer that this property is fully wooded, but we did not have the opportunity to get back in to verify that because of unknown access rights. Our visual inspection indicated that electrical service was not available on or near this parcel. The nearest electric service appeared to be a considerable distance (hundreds or perhaps thousands of feet) from the property. As such, electrifying this parcel could be costly. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: One-Plus Acre Parcel Near Detour. Campspot!
comments: This parcel measures 271 feet (east-to-west) by 185 feet (north-to-south) and fronts on the west side South White Pine Row, north off M-134. The road here is probably a private one, and not county maintained. It is more like a good quality two-track. The lands here are level and dry, and wooded in evergreens and soft woods. The signs we placed is in an area where someone has cleared a slight campspot opening and is only estimated. It could be situated a little to the south of that sign. There is power here, and dropping a service to the property would be a snap. There are 4-5 other cabins on the lane, but none appear to be year round in use except one right on M-134. This parcel is accessible by a road that is believed to be a seasonal or non-maintained public road. While we make no representations or warranties as to the precise nature of such road access, our research suggests that this road is either 1) Not regularly graded; and/or 2) Not snow plowed in winters; and/or 3) Appears subject to fallen trees or other events which have not been addressed by the county road commission. You should conduct your own research into this issue prior to bidding.

title: 100X213 Parcel Near Detour
comments: Parcel fronts on Polaczyk Road near Detour, and is 100' on the road x 213' deep to the west. Our measurements take us to a lot that contains (what's left of) an old mobile home and an old school bus, as well as some other odd and ends. You may wish to confirm this location with other resources, but the property has an address, and it's the only thing in this locale that would probably apply to. The lands here are mostly open, and there is some brush and a few younger growth trees of various varieties. There is a shallow well here, age and condition unknown. Paved, county maintained road.

title: Building Site On Mackinac Trail.
comments: This is a nicely wooded 200x179 building site on Mackinac Trail, a mile of so south of M-28. The lands are level and dry here, and wooded in a variety of evergreens and softwoods. The township has listed "Hazardous Substance 970-1244" on this property. We suggest the purchaser conducts a Baseline Environmental Assessment (BEA) within 45 days of purchase to avoid fines for potential further contamination.

title: Vacant Parcel Near The St Marys River!
comments: Parcels 1704 and 1705 are adjacent vacant building sites, on Scenic Drive, across the street from the St Marys River. Each parcel is 100' on the road x 200' deep to the west. Nicely wooded in younger softwoods.

title: Vacant Parcel Near St Marys River!
comments: Parcels 1704 and 1705 are vacant building sites, on Scenic Drive, across the street from the St Marys River. Each parcel is 100' on the road x 200' deep to the west. Nicely wooded in younger softwoods.

title: Waterfront! West Neebish Channel Of The St Marys River!
comments: This is a loooooong narrow parcel of land, roughly 66 feet (north-south) x 1500 feet or so (east-west). Approaches to this parcel by two track roads from the southwest (off 11 Mile Road) are really the only way to get to it, as the access from 10 Mile Road to the north, then Klier Road ends at a gate that protects state marshlamnd preserves from motor vehicle access. If you come in to the property off 11 Mile Road, continue until you have reached a point where you are confronted with a gate dead ahead, and another to the right at 90 degrees .... and the far west end of this parcel is now ahead of you about half way to the gate. But if it's the waterfront you want to see ... you'll either have to come in by boat, or walk in through almost half a mile of dense brush. Either way, use of the waterfront here will require an investment in roadwork ... or perhaps negotiating a shared drive easement with the neighbor to the south who has that gated drive to your right at the end of 11 Mile Road. Topo maps of this area do not list this as wetlands, but visually, at least at the west end of the parcel, that is the appearance. This parcel is probably about 2 acres in size. It will likely require a survey to nail that down, as the waterfrontage could have a meander line as a boundary. Shorter version ? "Chefs surprise!" It appears that this parcel actually has road access to the far west end, but not to the waterfront area. The photois are of the general waterfrontage character and taken from the shoreline on another property to the north.

title: The Historic Ransonville Schoolhouse!
comments: We are offering the historic Ransonville Schoolhouse building on M-129. This is a charmer but it has some structural issues that will require attention. It is built of brick, but was constructed on unstable, soft soils that just are not dealing with the weight very well. The front right corner of the building has some very obvious cracks from the settling of the building, and the front wall has an area of deflection that is probably 6 inches or more. The brick also shows decay along the bottom 4 feet or so all the way around, likely from absorbing ground water and then freezing and flaking off. This building looks good "from the neck up". It's the foundation that has issues. Inside, you'd never know there were issues outside. Floors are level and the walls are straight. Obviously, someone has compensated for the exterior condition which is likely to have been a longstanding condition. It has a newer 200 amp electric service and other than being cosmetically challenged, has a lot of potential. We would have a structural engineer take a good hard look at this one and make some recommendations. Parcel is 221x241.75 in size and just over 1 acre. Has a small frame storage building to the rear ... sort of an undersized one car garage. We found 3 lock sets inside the front door ... so this one has been in the repo system for a while. It is listed as "winterized" but we cannot guarantee that work. There is evidence posted which indicates that a lender may be attempting to foreclose upon this parcel after such parcel was foreclosed for delinquent property taxes. A purchaser may encounter future contact from this lender. Tax foreclosure supersedes the rights of mortgage holders. If a mortgage holder does not foreclose upon their mortgage interest prior to tax foreclosure, their right to do so is generally lost. Typically such mortgage holders were provided all necessary notice of tax foreclosure but failed to act in a timely fashion to preserve their interest. In rare instances it may be necessary to cancel a sale if a deficiency in notice to such a lender is discovered. Please contact us or ask questions at the sale if you have concerns about this issue. The foundation of one or more buildings located on this parcel appears to be failing. Correcting foundation issues can be very expensive and issues are often more complex than they initially appear. You should research this issue thoroughly prior to bidding on this parcel.

title: 1+ Acre Industrial Use Property Off M-129
comments: This is an industrial park type property that sits to the rear of a propane gas operation on M-129 south of the Soo. The lands are level and open. It is roughly 200 (east-west) x 670 (north-south) in size, and fronts on a private, shared road.

title: 2.9 Acre Parcel In Bruce Township
comments: Parcel is 264' (north-south) x 478.5' (east-west). Fronts on the east side of M-129 at the Donaldson mark on the map, and sits below road grade about 5 feet. Mostly open with a gentle roll to it. Buildable lands on a county maintained highway.

title: Vacant Lot
comments: Vacant lot in the City of Jackson. Check with local unit to determine if this lot is buildable. It is the responsibility of the bidder/buyer to have researched the property prior to auction. You should check with your local unit for any Notices of Condemnation, Dangerous Bldg. or Unsafe Structure, requirement to rehab structure, assessments not forgiven due to foreclosure.

You should conduct your own research prior to bidding on this parcel. This parcel appears to have been subject to harvesting of electrical, plumbing, mechanical systems, or other building components. Buildings are sometimes targeted by criminals that steal or "harvest" items such as copper plumbing, wiring, furnaces, water heaters, fixtures, hardwood flooring, etc. This building should be considered incomplete due to such harvesting and may require substantial investment to reequip.

title: Small Parcel On Spens Road Near Cr 646
comments: This is a small, vacant parcel that fronts on the Spens Road, just south of County Road 646. It is 30x80, and likely not big enough to build on ... however you could always approach neighboring property owners and see if they would sell. It also may make an interesting, low budget camp spot near Lake Huron and Ocqueoc. Unlike most of the other parcels we get in this area, this one actually fronts 30' on a "real" road ! There is a trail that runs right through the middle of this lot where it meets the road, and a culvert has been installed. Because of the small size of the lot, we can't be sure without a survey, but it appears this parcel is just south of the culvert. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. title: 4 Parcels With Water Assessments On Us 23, And 8 Lots In Thunder Bay Village, Alpena
comments: This sale lot includes 15 parcels, that are not adjacent to each other.4 front along the west side of US 23 south of Alpena, and 11 others are in the "Thunder Bay Village" area East of town.The US 23 parcels have outstanding water assessments which, based on previous efforts to sell them, exceed their value. We have sold these parcels numerous times, only to have them re-revert when the purchasers learn of the outstanding balance due on the assessments.The outstanding assessment balance due on these lots is approximately $39,361.98. Rather than sell these parcels AGAIN and have them become delinquent and be foreclosed in 2 years AGAIN, this time the parcels are being offered as a group, with the condition that a purchaser will be required to pay the assessment balances in total PRIOR TO CONVEYANCE, or the sale will be canceled and no deed issued. We encourage any interested party to contact Alpena Township, and have the total payoff calculated for parcels 018-045-000-420-00, 018-250-000-012-01, 012-02, and 037-00. The assessment for these parcels is roughly $5500 per year, and the assessment has another 10 years to run. So the amount necessary to retire these assessments in full and purchase the property is approximately $50,000 in addition to the winning bid and summer tax amounts due for 2016. If you are unwilling to pay the assessments in full, you should not bid on these parcels.In addition, this sale (the "bundle") includes eight parcels in the Thunder Bay Village subdivision(s). We have sold these lots, and others like them, numerous times, and we keep getting them back like the proverbial bad penny. The reason is pretty simple. Most of these are swamplots, and will not support construction or a septic system. They're not good for much except mosquito farming and (not) paying property taxes.The successful bidder for these 15 properties will have to pay the summer taxes in addition to the bid price, and the Thunder Bay Village parcels will include a deed restriction that stipulates tha they cannot be reconveyed to any third parties without the approval of the seller within 10 years, or all of the lots will revert to the seller without refund.These 15 parcels are sold as one unit, with the conditions noted above as requirements of sale:1) The US 23 assessments must be paid in full prior to the issuance of the deed or the sale will be cancelled, and;2) The Thunder Bay Village lots cannot be reconveyed within 10 yeas without the written consent of the Alpena County Treasurer, or title to all 8 parcels will revert to the seller without compensation to the purchaser or assigns. This will be included as a deed restriction at the time of this sale. 023 us-23 s water assessment - $1020.72. 0.14 acres. title: Wetlands Parcel Near Long Lake
comments: This is a platted 50x100 lot just a couple hundred feet from Long Lake. Some of the roads that are shown on the plat of this subdivision have never been improved, most likely because a good deal of this area is wetlands. And some of the roads that *have* been improved, are not where the plat suggests they should be. We do not believe that this property fronts on an improved road, and appears to be a few feet "offroad". It may well require a survey to be certain its exact location. title: 1+ Acre Parcel Near Hillman With A "dozer Bait" House.
comments: This one has had a bad roof for quite some time. There are large holes and dozens of spots where there is deflection, indicating that the wood under the shingles is rotten. That is probably redundant into the roof joists as well. Inside, floors have decayed to the point of localized collapse from rot as well. It has been full of critters as well. Is it repairable ? Perhaps. But the economics of that are likely prohibitive. That being said, this is a nice one acre country lot with a submersible well and probably a septic system that has potential for reuse. The power service here has been dropped. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. title: Beautiful Homesite At Birchwood Farms Gcc Near Harbor Springs
comments: This season, we are offering 3 different homesite in the Birchwood Golf and Country Club development west of Harbor Springs. This is, simply put, a BEAUTIFUL development, The roads and woods here look like someone vacuums them daily. This place is spotless and on point, and the homes here are manicured. This is a fairly exclusive residential community, and there MAY BE some substantial FEES that are mandatory for membership in the POA in addition to the deed restrictions and other covenants that attach here. These are not lots to be purchased for speculation unless you have short term plans to construct a home here. The "buy in" and annual membership fees here can runs well into the thousands of dollars, and they're quite intent on collecting them. We strongly suggest that prospective purchasers do their due diligence on these potential costs and restrictions prior to purchase. Please see the legal description for the identification of the specific lot being sold. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

title: Beautiful Homesite At Birchwood Farms Gcc Near Harbor Springs
comments: This season, we are offering 3 different homesite in the Birchwood Golf and Country Club development west of Harbor Springs. This is, simply put, a BEAUTIFUL development, The roads and woods here look like someone vacuums them daily. This place is spotless and on point, and the homes here are manicured. This is a fairly exclusive residential community, and there MAY BE some substantial FEES that are mandatory for membership in the POA in addition to the deed restrictions and other covenants that attach here. These are not lots to be purchased for speculation unless you have short term plans to construct a home here. The "buy in" and annual membership fees here can runs well into the thousands of dollars, and they're quite intent on collecting them. We strongly suggest that prospective purchasers do their due diligence on these potential costs and restrictions prior to purchase. Please see the legal description for the identification of the specific lot being sold. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. title: Vacant Building Site In Misty Acres Site Condo Near Alanson.
comments: Misty Acres is a small site condo (subdivision condomunium) between Indian River and Alanson, south of M-68. In this form of ownership, the condomunium association could control some elements of maintenance and control (roads and such) and the unit owner has other rights and responsibilities. These are laid out in the Master Plan documents which should be obtained from the Register of Deeds in Petoskey and understood prior to bidding. We are told that the developer of this project failed, and that there is no active association or fees. You may wish to verify that information if interested. In this site condo, there are 8 lots. 2 have homes on them and have been previously sold. We are selling the 6 remaining vacant lots. There are horses here, behind unit 8. No horses included in the sale. Sorry. This sale is for one unit only. See the legal description for identification. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. title: Vacant Lot On Otis Drive, Just Outside Of Mancelona.
comments: Building site just south of Mancelona and north of Elder Road on Otis Drive. A trailer has been removed from this site, and it still contains a natural gas service in the center of the lot. There is municipal water here, so you can save on the cost of having to drill a new well too ! title: Homesite In The Lake Of The North Development!
comments: Lake of the North is an expansive development of residential resort homes in eastern Antrim County, not far from Gaylord and Grayling. There are hundreds of home sites here, interspersed between 20 different subdivisions. Amenities include restaurants, a private landing strip, campground, horse stables, golf course, winter sports area and a clubhouse with pool. Parcels here are subject to restrictive deed covenants and HOA membership fees. We did not find the annual fee amount listed on the HOA website (see link) but we believe them to be around $350 per year for the first parcel with a discount for adjacent lots. You may wish to check that with the HOA office if it is a critical detail for you. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

title: 12+ Acres. Contaminated Lagoon Parcel On Darragh Road. Mancelona
comments: 12+ acre parcel sits to the rear/west of 9746 Darragh Road, which we sold a couple of years ago. It has road frontage on Darragh Road, but there is no improved driveway into the parcel from that road. It is listed in records as a "lagoon parcel" and topographical maps describe the west half of the parcel as an "Industrial waste pond". THIS IS A LISTED SITE ON THE STATE CONTAMINATION REGISTER: Site ID: 05000005. Pollutant(s): 1,2,4 TMB, 1,3,5 TMB, PCE, TCE, Xylenes, n-Propylbenzene, sec-Butylbenzene. Associated with 310 Palmer Park Road, Mancelona MI. 49659. LRUR Id: 11120107004, Facility Name: Dura Automotive/Wickes Effluent Pond. There are 15 different baseline environmental assessment impact statements that reference this site. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

title: 7.45 Acres On Elder Road At Us-131. Mancelona. Contamination Indicators.
comments: Parcel is irregular in shape. Fronts along the north side of Elder Road, beginning east of the railroad grade. It also has a small amount of frontage on Nelson Lake at the east boundary of the parcel. We noticed a dozen or more white pipes in this vicinity on a couple of different properties. It appears that this land was part of the North Tar Lake ETA 128(a) project of the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and was the location of groundwater contamination studies in 2007. If you're intersted in this parcel, you'll want to study the past use of this property carefully to determine whether there is any potential liability involved in acquiring it. The contaminated "lake" of chemicals, which is 4 acres in size, and up to 27 feet deep is not ON this parcel. It merely just the victim of its contamination nearby. On the bright side, there is municipal water service nearby, and you would not be reliant on groundwater as a source if you were to utilitize this parcel. See more information at: http://www.osti.gov/scitech/biblio/5208749 If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

title: Site Condo Lot At "hawks Eye" Golf Community
comments: Hawks Eye is a newer golf community east of the Schuss Mountain development in Kearney Township. Like most other projects of its vintage, it was slowed by the housing bubble bursting in 2008-10. These are very nice building sites on a golf course that weathered the downturn quite well. It has every outward appearance of being a thriving course at this time, and you may wish to check it out in person. These are site condo homesites, and they are subject to restrictions of record as well as condo association fees that you will want to investigate prior to bidding. This is a newer, well maintained development with very nice homes located in rolling hills. There are private, paved roads and well manicured grounds here. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

It has every outward appearance of being a thriving course at this time, and you may wish to check it out in person. These are site condo homesites, and they are subject to restrictions of record as well as condo association fees that you will want to investigate prior to bidding. This is a newer, well maintained development with very nice homes located in rolling hills. There are private, paved roads and well manicured grounds here. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

title: Homesite In The Schuss Mountain Golf And Ski Community!
comments: Schuss Mountain and Shanty Creek resorts are both intertwined in this area of central Antrim County. This is a four-season destination resort spanning 4,500 acres and three distinct villages: Summit, Schuss and Cedar River, each with lodging, dining, golf and downhill skiing and cross country trails, located in Bellaire, Michigan, among the chain of lakes region, just 31 miles northeast of Traverse City. In winter Schuss and Summit's two mountain experience provides 53 downhill slopes, six terrain parks, 30km of cross country Nordic trails, and a six-lane alpine tubing park. In spring emerge four award-winning championship golf courses including Arnold Palmer's The Legend and Tom Weiskopf's decorated Cedar River GC, plus the acclaimed Schuss Mountain course, and the original Summit course. There is a pool for use of the membership. The grounds of the development are well maintained. There are 26 subdivisions and condominium groups here, and they are all members of the Schuss Mountain Property Owners Association (SMPOA) to which we have attached a link. You will find much information on the amenities of the resorts and the POA by surfing the web. Membership in the POA is currently $66 per year for owners of vacant parcels such as the one we are offering here. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

title: Vacant Homesite In The Cedar River Village Site Condo
comments: The Cedar River Village site condo is a newer residential development that is intertwined into the Schuss Mountain / Shanty Creek community in central Antrim County not far from Bellaire. There are exciting golf and other activities here, and the entire Schuss Mountain resort is at your doorstep here. Homesites here are "site condominiums", that is a condo form of subdivision planning where unit owners contribute to the maintenance of common areas. The units we are offering this year are all vacant buildings sites which can be located on the aerial map on our main page. Please see the link to the Cedar River Village Condo Association website, which we have provided for uyour perusal. Be aware that these units are subject to the restrictions of the Master Deed, and condo association fees. title: Oldie Moldy Biltmore Cottage Nw Of Cedar Lake Near Lake Huron
comments: Older resort area cottage, has had a two story add-on to the rear side, connected by an enclosed breezeway/hall structure. There is natural gas to this property, and a submersible well. The front/original portion of the property has some facia and sofffit issues and will need some help. There are broken windows, and surface water has been coming in the sliding glass door track along the backside of the structure, which has now developed a substantial mold situation that will require thorough cleaning and remediation. Or maybe you simply knock it down, and start over. This isn't a weekend flipper. title: Bundled Lots. No Improved Road Access. Manistique
comments: This is a "bundle". A group of adjacent parcels being sold as one unit. There are 6 separate parcels being sold in this offering. There is no improved public road to these parcels, and USGS maps identify them as swamplands. These parcels will will sold with a DEED RESTRICTION that this group of lots shall not be "split" (conveyed in any group smaller that the 6 lots being sold together), unless roads to each of them are first built, that meet the criteria of County road commission and/or City officials as public streets. The sale of these parcels in any configuration less than the whole, without roads first being built, will result in the title to the lands reverting to the Foreclosing Governmental Unit (FGU) without any compensation or refund due. So ... you can buy them. And you can use them. And you can sell them. But you canot SPLIT them back into smaller groupings without installing roads ... or title reverts to the seller. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information. title: Handyman Special In Manistique
comments: This one has been "let go" for a while and will need a commitment to return to productive use. It has hardboard siding which is delaminating, especially near the foundation. Older doors and windows that need upgrading. Has an old stone foundation that has been veneered with a thin coat concrete which is beginning to "go south" as well. Inside, the roof here has been leaking for eons, and it has caused a lot of damage to floors and structural members. The front porch is rotten to the core, and the rest is not far behind. This will take some courage and hard work. Bad roof needs immediate replacement. title: Dozer Bait Shack In Germfask
comments: The value here is in the property. This is an old frame structure that has had a couple of additions tacked on, and some of those are now fully collapsed. This one has been sitting, without much maintenance, for a long time. Facia boards, siding near the ground and soffits have visible rot and decay. Inside, floors have fallen into the crawlspace in a couple of areas, and while the roof might be good, whats under it is suffering from a combination of construction issues and decay. The parcel here fronts about 100 feet on the road and runs 300 feet to the east. 3/4 of an acre. We assume there is a well here, but could not find it. It may be in a collapsed area of the building. title: 1.5 Acre Swamplot In Dalliba
comments: This group of parcels has been "bundled". In order to buy any of the parcels in this group, you must buy ALL of them. ATTENTION: NO ONLINE BIDDING FOR THIS PARCEL. It is a requirement of of this sale that a purchaser must demolish, remediate,rehabilitate or repurpose this property as follows: 1) ALL STRUCTURES must be secured and made un-enterable within 15 days of sale at auction, at the purchasers sole expense, or the sale shall be cancelled and no refund or deed issued. 2) Any visible refuse, garbage, trash or other cast off shall be removed from lands within 15 days of the sale at auction, at the purchasers sole expense, or the sale shall be cancelled and no refund or deed issued.. 3) The conditions required in (1) and (2) above shall be maintained against further entry or blight for a period of 12 months following the execution of a deed. 4) Those properties that are beyond reasonable repair or economic vitality to repair must be demolished at the sole expense of the purchaser. The cost of such work shall be at the sole expense of the original purchaser and shall not be assigned, delegated or otherwise transferred to third parties through sale or conveyance until complete. All such demolition must be performed within 6 months of deeding, by a licensed, insured demolition contractor acceptable to the code official of the local unit of government where the property is located. All proper permits for demolition and the removal and disposal of volatile debris (asbestos, contaminants etc) must be obtained. 5) Those properties which appear to either the purchaser, FGU or the code enforcement official of the local unit of government to be potentially contaminated, shall be the subject of a Baseline Environmental Assessment (BEA) at the sole expense of the purchaser. The cost of such BEA(s) shall be at the sole expense of the original purchaser and shall not be assigned, delegated or otherwise transferred to third parties through sale or conveyance until complete. The BEA(s) shall be conducted by an insured environmental consultant licensed in the State of Michigan within 45 days of purchase, and shall be fully complete and filed with the proper authorities within 90 days of purchase. The level of the BEA to be conducted shall be determined by the findings of the initial phase(s) of the BEA at each parcel subject to such study. Where contamination is evident, the purchaser shall indemnify the FGU with a separate performance bond (issued on the same terms as others herein required) in an amount equal to the full cost of remediation of the contamination at each such site, and for a period of twenty (20) years, unless remediation is undertaken and completed during that time period. If the site is remediated to a level satisfactory to state officials charged with such determinations, the requirement for a performance bond shall be removed for that site. 6) Those properties which can be rehabilitated or repurposed shall be brought into compliance with all construction, occupancy, zoning and other use codes of the local unit of government within 12 months. Construction and/or mechanical permits must be obtained prior to performing such work. Occupancy permits must be obtained by the expiration of that term. All construction and rehabilitation work at these properties shall be carried out by contractors that are licensed and insured, and acceptable to the code enforcement officer of the local unit of government. The cost of such work shall be at the sole expense of the original purchaser and shall not be assigned, delegated or otherwise transferred to third parties through sale or conveyance until complete. In pursuance of those requirements and their costs and timelines, the FGU is requiring the posting of a performance bond in the amount of $150,000. The performance bond shall be made out in favor of the Office of the Marquette County Treasurer (acting as the Foreclosing Governmental Unit). Evidence of the issuance and full payment for such bond shall be presented to the FGU within fifteen (15) days of the acceptance of the purchasers bid at auction. In the event evidence of issuance and full payment is not tendered within fifteen (15) days of sale, the sale shall be cancelled outright, and the purchaser considered non-responsive to a necessary condition of the sale. Such bond shall be issued by an underwriter licensed to do business in the State of Michigan, who is not the subject of any pending disciplinary action by the State of Michigan or any department, bureau or commission thereof. It shall be payable, in full amount, to the FGU in the event of either whole or partial non-performance of the terms above written for its entire duration. It shall run as effective and be fully pre-paid, for the entire term of twenty-four (24) months. Any overage or refund shall be payable to the purchaser upon earlier termination of the bond because of full performance hereunder. This 24 month time period is not applicable to those performance bonds required for contaminated parcels noted in (5) above. The original of such bond(s) shall be held by an escrow agent satisfactory to the FGU, fully prepaid, at the expense of the purchaser. In the event any purchaser is a corporate or other entity, the principals of such entity must also execute full-recourse personal guarantees that assure payment of the amount(s) due under performance bonds in the event they are not honored for any reason. Compliance with the terms of the requirements hereof shall be at the sole discretion of the FGU. Please contact the auction house or Marquette County Treasurers office for additional detail. title: Boarded House And A Spare On The North Side Of Escanaba.
comments: **NOTE: This property is subject to a voluntary demolition order. The purchaser will be required to demolish the structure at its own cost within 6 months of the sale. Prior to deed delivery, the purchaser will be required to furnish a personal guarantee and performance bond in the amount of $25,000 to assure this demolition. Please contact the Treasurers office or auction house for complete details.** There are two units on this lot. The larger, front one has been boarded up to keep all the goodness inside. Or maybe to keep the pigeons out. Either way, we did not view the interior and she is closed up tight ... probably by local authorities. We assume this has been condemned by the city building offficial, and that reuse would require it be brought to current building code, which could be a formidable task. The structure is a "Biltmore", and has several additions to the rear and side, some of which are leaning and weaving suggesting foundation issues. To the rear is a one story "mother in law" unit that is actually in pretty decent overall condition, but could still use some cosmetic updating to the exterior. Inside it has knotty pine, and has an updated (90's-ish) bath and kitchen. Newer forced air natural gas heat. Roof is not new, but does not appear to be a leaker. This is a two-for-one deal, but you have to demolish both of them. title: 1.95 Acre Parcel Near Isabella
comments: This is being sold as VACANT LAND. There is a modular home here that we do NOT WARRANT TITLE TO. At one point in the past, a third party claimed ownership of this unit outside of the property tax foreclosure process. It may ... or it may not ... be a part of the fee simple estate to the underlying lands and is sold without any representation. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information. Mobile homes (and some modular homes) can be separately titled and considered personal property. In these instances, there may be third parties that have the legal right to remove that mobile home from the parcel whether or not it has been assessed as part of the property in the past. We make no representations or warranties as to whether such mobile or modular homes are included with the real property offered for sale. It is the buyer’s responsibility to conduct their own research as to the state of title. As a preliminary step, it may be useful to determine if an Affidavit of Affixture of Manufactured Home has been executed and recorded as outlined in MCL 125.2330i. You may wish to consult a licensed attorney or title company to assist in this research.

title: One Acre Camp On Sugar Island!
comments: This is an older, trashed mobile on a square acre lot on Sugar Island. Views of Lake George and Canada are right out your front door ! The one thing this property doesn't seem to have is a driveway. We're not quite sure how they got the mobile onto the lot, as there is a large drain that runs along the road, but no culvert, driveway or bridge across it. So that will probably be the first task for the new owner of this one. The mobile and old cabin here are shot and beyond economic sense to repair. There is a hand pump and a "bath with a path". This is a camp spot and not really something repairable beyond the most spartan of uses. title: The Beacom Building. Rudyard.
comments: This was at one time a proud apartment house in Rudyard. The years and lack of attention have taken their toll, and it is now in serious disrepair. It has been vandalized and the roof has been leaking for some time. We've sold it before .... more than once ... and each time it's a little worse for wear the next time we come back. This would take some commitment and deep pockets to bring back to life. We did not venture inside this trip, as it's beginning to look like it's beyond economic feasibility to restore. Our recollecion of past visits is that this is multiple apartments, with the menaces of outdated mechanicals, lead based paint, and a bad roof. title: Commercial Income Property In Kincheloe!
comments: This is a large, modern, commercial duplex property in Kincheloe. It was the location of the Family Dollar and Sky McFlys Bar and restaurant, the bar is closed and gone, and Family Dollar has moved across the street. It is apparent that maintenance has been let go here, and both buildings show evidence of bad roofs. Inside, the buildings are structurally sound, with concrete slab-on-grade floors. There has been some demolition inside, and ceilings are down inside both units from roof leaks. The restaurant side of the building is roughly 35x80 and the Family Dollar side of the building is about 60x160 feet deep, including a couple of additions to the rear. The rear addition to the building has a good, useable basement space with exterior stairwell. The ceilings there are over 8 foot, and it was dry. The total square footage here is in the neighborhood of 12,000 square feet. See the photos for more detail on condition and attributes. title: Commercial Storefront In Ewen.
comments: This is a retail storefront with some mechanical updates in Ewen. The building has been dormant for nearly a decade, and unfortunately has been sitting with a basement full of water all of that time (No power = no sump pump). It is difficult to know if it has suffered any foundation issues from this malady, but the upper frame structure still seems straight and square at our most recent observation. It is vinyl sided and has what still appears to be a good roof. Some damage has been done to the doors by various people entering the building illegallky, but it is superficial and can be repaired. This building will require a pump out and then some restoration of mechanicals that live in the basement (furnace etc). This will be a super deal IF you have a productive end use for the building. This is NOT a "flip" property. Several people have tried, and failed to do that already. It probably also has potential for conversion to a spacious one floor residence. title: Large, 24 Unit, Multi-Family Housing Unit At White Pine
comments: Sales 5109 and 5110 are reminders of the mining boom days in White Pine. These buildings first served as housing for mine workers, their families, and those in supporting local business during the last half of last century. When the mine closed, they transitioned to rental housing for those who stayed behind ... and then gradually fell vacant and into disrepair. The buildings are substantial, having almost a military housing grade of infrastructure to them. The floor decking on the main level is reinforced concrete, and the mechanical systems are hefty and elaborate for their time in this place. Each housing unit is separately wired to its own individual panelboard, but each building only has one power service. Because the individual units are fed from the basement level (which is underwater) we can't be sure if it is individually sub-metered. Sale 5110 is the more "original" of the two buildings, and we suspect it has been vacant longer, perhaps well over a decade. Unlike 5109, the roof has not been leaking for an extended period time, but we trust that is a short term situation at best. We aren't sure of their exact age, but we do know these buildings predate 1978. There is a high probability that the buildings contain either/both lead based paint and asbestos wrap on steam pipes in the corridor ceilings and basement level. The basement here is nearly full ... at least 5 foot in depth ... with water (power offf = no sump pump). We also noticed mold creeping up the main floor walls here, and some "harvesting" has been taking place of scrap metal (radiators etc). It will require "deep pockets" to restore this building to a code-approvable multi-family residential use. Are there other options ? It could possibly be used for storage or warehousing at a much lower cost, but with a similarly low return. This building exhibited more decay to the exterior surfaces that 5109, but that may be simply because the other unit has some more recent effort made at cosmetics. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

title: Large, 24 Unit, Multi-Family Housing Unit At White Pine
comments: Sales 5109 and 5110 are reminders of the mining boom days in White Pine. These buildings first served as housing for mine workers, their families, and those in supporting local business during the last half of last century. title: Home In Need Of Help. Crystal Falls
comments: This home has a failing foundation, which could preclude it from economic vitality as a candidate for restoration without a serious, and immediate effort to correct it (see photos). The basement foundation wall is already leaning, and has a major stress crack that indicates it could probably fail and collapse inward at any time. It needs a roof and a complete interior redo. It does have a newer electric service, older furnace, original kitchen and bath. The home is worthy of rehabilitating, but you're going to need to assess the foundation situation before making that decision. There are 5 bedrooms here. title: Commercial Storefront In Downtown Crystal Falls
comments: This is an older frame building (with addition) "on the hill" in Crystal Falls downtown district. It has most recently been a second hand/antique store, but appears to have spent its original life as a hotel building or lodging house, as to the original two story portion on the left side. The property is still under the control of the store operator, so we did not have the opportunity to view the interior. From the exterior, the left side building appears to be solid, straight and square. The upper floor appears to be accessed from the side street, although there may be an interior stairway as well to the "Moberg Hotel" section. The building to the right is also two story, and the two are corrected inside on the main floor and by a hallway or some similar connection across the front of the second floor. The roofs here are quite old rolled roofing, and there are ladders visible which infers an ongoing battle has been underway to keep them from leaking. title: Messy, Collapsing Old House Near Crystal Falls
comments: If you're not sure how to find this one, you won't. The driveway is overgrown, and you can't see the house from the road ... but it's there ! And, boy howdy it's a treat when you get there ! This one has had a bad roof for a LONG time, and has lots of broken windows and other issues as well to compound that. And if you needed extra enticement, the foundation has collapsed and the whole structure has potential to cave into the basement. It's a "sunken living room" !!! The value here is in the land. We're thinking this one is probably at least 2 acres, and it's a really nice, private setting with some great cedar and softwoods. Remove this house and put in a new one ... the privacy of country living right inside the city ! Irregular shaped parcel. See local records for all the details. On Railroad Street up behind the Paint River Hills campground. title: Older, Frame Home In Crystal Falls

The main potion of the structure has some serious bows and weaves in the floor, and the back porch is badly leaning. We'd advise you to check with building officials regarding requirements for occupying this one again. The value here is in the lot, which is a very nice, dry open city parcel. title: Commercial Property : Trails End Saloon In Caspian.
comments: We seem to be getting a lot of small town bars the last few years. This one is in a commercial brick storefront in Caspian that would appear to have promise for repurposing to other retail, office or even residential uses. Had a big plate glass storefront in its original incarnation, "modernized" to small thermalpane windows in the last few decades. Inside, the property is in remarkably good shape, and appears to have been well taken care of during it's operation, which ended about 5 years ago. The original tin ceiling ... which is in very good, restorable condition, still exists .... mostly intact ... above the 1970's drop acoustic ceiling. Broken pool trophies litter the floor in front of a deco-era backbar of about 20 foot in length that is also very restorable. Small walk in cooler to the rear (watch out for the SKUNK that lives back here now). An exterior concrete block structure has been built to enclose an exterior stair to the living space above the bar room. The second floor was a remodel-in-progress which was unfinished. Niiiice hardwood floors here ... and it's 3BR and seperately metered for power. There is also an "annex", which in its original life was a twocar garage that they creatively attached with a secretive hallway ... probably was the pool room. Overall this is a very solid building awaiting your repurposing. The house, with a new front porch and new roof, may have some potential for restoration, but it would be quite an undertaking. The siding needs a little work, but we have seen far worse. title: Commercial Storefront Property In Amasa!
comments: This is a historic storefront property in "downtown" Amasa. At a previous tax auction, the property adjacent to this, which contains its septic system, was sold to a third party, who then donated it to the church next door. A buyer will want to investigate obtaining an easement, either voluntarily or with the assistance of circuit court, for the continued use of the septic system. This is an older wood frame building, the "Amasa House", a tavern in the Central Business District of the village. The building is vinyl sided, and the soffits on the right side are in rough shape. It appears that the left half of the building is the original structure, and the right side was added later, with a shared stairway to the second floor. Upstairs, the original/left half was originally a boarding or rooming house based on the layout we see. Parts of the upper floor have been stripped for a renovation that never happened, and there is a lot of incomplete construction. Overall, the building is solid, but all torn up. We'd recommend focus on getting a solid new roof on it, or the rest is meaningless. The roof does not seem to leak at present, but it's not going to be long until it does based on ther condition of the soffits and fascia. There is also a deteriorated outbuilding to the rear that probably should just come down. comments: Tall (2.5 story !), narrow concrete block home in Bessemer. This one has been left to sit and rot, and it now has large holes in the roof which have led to advanced decay of everything below it. This was probably a sharp home in its day, but that ship sailed a while ago. The front porch columns have been replaced with ill fitting 4x4 posts (themselves in disrepair). The inside has become a haven for pigeons, and we scared up a bunch of them when we opened the door. Inside, the floors have all warped up from the bad roof. It has the original staircases, but most of the wood trim was removed during a 70-ish "updating". The foundation is buckling inside the basement. This one is past it's ninth life already ... This is a 3 or maybe 4 unit rental unit in L'Anse. It is well used and will need some rehab. The roof is older and there are signs of distress in facia and soffits. The siding is hardboard and is warping and deteriorating in the couple of feet nearest the ground. title: Old Timer In Covington
comments: This is a 1.5 story wood frame home in Covington that is built on the often-seen wood pier footing system. Over time, these pilings deteriorate, and the whole home begins to settle. On this one, there have been some efforts made to stabilize the situation, but it's likely to continue. We're guessing that this one has been vacant for a little bit. It has peeling paint, some siding in need of attention, and the roof will need replacement sooner rather than later, as we saw some missing and displaced shingle. Inside, the house has been "modernized", circa 1980, with dropped ceilings, paneling and even z-brick ! The floors and ceilings sway, and there is a hole in the kitchen floor ... tho we're not sure what it's from. The upper floor is unfinished, and several of the windows have been covered over presumably to save heat. It appears that the building was last used perhaps about 2002. This one has some potential and is general preservable ... but will need some attention. The mechanical's are all ancient, and it appears they used the wood stove in the kitchen for cooking ...
